reviews.reviewText:
Weird flapping sound from the inside.... turned it off immediately and stopped using it ever since.... hope to hear from the manufacturer soon or I am returning it!

Update (1/28/19): I have been going back and forth with the Ninja customer service team the past 2 weeks and haven't come to a conclusion yet. If I could i'd take out another star from the review to make it 0 star.

Update (2/20/19): Did not hear from Ninja customer service after more than a month, talked to Amazon and got a full refund.

I have many ninja products in my home and I love all of them! I am sorry to say I was very disappointed with that strong smell of rubber when I use the ninja air fryer. It left a toxic smell throughout my home. My daughter came home and asked if I burnt something rubber. Needless to say I returned it. I was not aware of the rubber parts inside of the fryer when I purchase this

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't know how I managed without one for so long.
reviews.reviewText: Been studying air fryers for about two years. Decision was about counters-pace vs basket size. The ninja takes up slightly less space than the stand mixer. It's lightweight and easy to pull out from under the cabinet to use (to allow for air flow). I like it so much, I wish for a bigger one just to do my entire meal in it at once. For two people, it does a fair amount of wings or tater tots, or the sweet potato fries pictured here. I used the reheat function and the bang bang shrimp came out quite tasty. Steaks came out moist and medium rare, but not seared even on the crisper plate. It has worked well with salmon and chicken breasts. So much easier to clean than a pan and my stove top. It cooked those breaded chicken rounds, fish, and tater tots and in about 10 minutes. Much less time than a toaster oven. The Ninja does not come with added attachments for the grilling or baking as the Phillips, but it's $200 less. Nuff said.

I unboxed this a few days ago and followed the instructions for cleaning the basket and crisping tray with hot soapy water. I’ve used five times since and each time it has filled my home with a horrible smell of burning plastic. It doesn’t look like any of the plastic parts are melting, but if you sniff the basket after cooking something the plastic smell is much stronger. I think whatever non-stick coating they use on the basket is releasing the toxic smell when heated. Really don’t think it is ceramic as they claim. Kind of a bummer since it does seem to cook food very well. I would say get this if you don’t mind having a headache from breathing fumes along with every meal.

reviews.reviewTitle: Had to return it due to the strong toxic plastic/rubber smell
reviews.reviewText: I believe the smell was coming from the plastic handle of the basket and it got worse after I pre-heated as the instruction suggested. There are three rubber knots on the inside plate which they strongly recommend you to put it there when air frying. That was surprising to me as there is no information saying it is safe to heat it up. Another problem was the misalignment of the basket outsider. Overall, I was very disappointed and upset about this air fryer. Not sure if I ever want to get one in the future.

reviews.reviewTitle: I LOVE IT, Perfect for meals for 1 or 2
reviews.reviewText:
I try not to eat fried food and I never thought I was missing out by not having a deep fryer, so an air fryer just seemed replacement that I didn't need. So I was skeptical about how much I would use this... maybe a few frozen tater tots or fries for the kids. But oh my goodness I want to use this for everything. I like to think of this as a personal sized convection oven on steroids. Veggie burgers crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. Roasted vegetables, fish sticks, chicken, burgers, fries, fish all with about 30-40% shorter cook times than the oven and only a 3 minute preheat time (vs 6-10 oven minutes).

This would be perfect for dorms or couples who want to eat something other than microwaved mush. It's also perfect for families who want a better way to make "fried" sides like fries, mozzarella sticks, or chicken strips. The clean up is so much easier than cookie sheets. The tub and the browning air fry tray both have a very nice non stick coating making cleanup as simple as a rinse and a wipe.

So cons... hmm that's a hard one. The biggest cons are that you may want to get a few extra kitchen tools like silicon tipped tongs to toss or flip your food and maybe a small 7" pan for baking if you like the idea of making this your primary oven too. Also you will need to get a feel for how much faster this cooks so you don't overcook your food, but checking on the food is easy and just a peak away. Once you get your timing right setting the controls is super easy and the timer turns it off automatically and you don't have to worry about a lot of carry over heat like you do in an oven.

OVERALL... I highly recommend it, the Ninja controls are just as simple and intuitive on this as it is on my Ninja blender, it super easy to clean, and it cooks nearly everything fabulously.

Been having this fryer for 2 weeks now and it has NOT rested yet. I LOVE IT & wonder how I've gone this long w/out one. Before I start bragging on this thing, I am by no way endorsed by Ninja or getting paid by them. I've owned a few Ninja products blenders and still have one that's over 10 years old. They make quality machines. This fryer is a life & time saver...especially if you're a lazy cook. I have been researching air fryers for the past few months and nothing comes close to the Ninja. The basket size isn't the large 5+ quart capacity like the bigger fryers, (Ninja is only 4qt), but this thing cooks so fast you won't miss the extra 1 qt. It comes w/ a crisper that works perfectly, a recipe book and a multi-layer rack. The first night I had it I made wings and I tell you that I will NEVER buy fried chicken again!!! Yes, they were that crispy and tasted much better. I bought the Louisiana fried chicken flour from Walmart, battered the wings, spritzed w/ a little olive oil and had fried chicken in 10 minutes. No greasy mess, no 3rd degree burns from hot oil, and your house doesn't smell like a chicken joint for 4 days afterward. Because the Ninja uses a ceramic coating on their fryers the clean up is very easy. Next, I made sweet potato fries! Had a bag of frozen ones in the freezer and popped those babies in for 10 min. They were crispier than McDonald's. I tried homemade fries but the procedure takes too long. You have to peel, slice, soak potatoes, dry them...I'm just ready to pop them in the fryer and eat! It has been nonstop air fryer cooking in this house! I hit youtube to get a few recipes and it's been on ever since. What I like best about this fryer is it has a dehydrator feature and how fast it cooks. Frozen chicken wings? No problem! Throw them in the fryer for 10 minutes and they're defrosted. I've cooked pizza, fries, wings, reheated food, fried zucchini, and tonight I baked a chocolate cake. Everything came out perfect! Next up is donuts! The only thing I don't like about this fryer is 30 seconds after it finishes cooking it shuts off. I know this is a safety feature but I always have more items to cook. In 2 weeks, I have used my microwave twice, and that was to reheat coffee. Before I forget, I did cinnamon rolls too! I used the canned Pillsbury ones and it normally takes 20 min in the oven. In the Ninja? 8 minutes and that's if you like them brown. I actually could have stopped it at 5 min and they would be perfect. My house smelled like a Cinnabon factory!😛 I have used every feature on this fryer except the dehydrator but I'll be making beef jerky soon. Overall, I am VERY pleased! The best selling feature was the price & the size. The Ninja is much slimmer than some of the bulkier fryers and fits under my cabinet nicely. I'm also happy it only used 1500W unlike some of the larger fryers that burn 1800 which could kill your light bill. The outside of the fryer doesn't get hot so you won't have to worry about getting burned but do take caution when taking your food out. Is it loud? My exhaust fan on my stove is louder than the Ninja. The extension cord on it is long so you don't have to worry about being limited on where you can place it. I think I've covered everything? This thing is THE BOMB! If you're wondering what cookware you can use, just about anything you place in a microwave you can put in the Ninja. I went to the Dollar Tree and bought a few 7" foil pans I use to reheat food & bake in. Also, grab you some silicone tongs while you're there so you don't scratch the surface of your fryer. This thing has been almost as good as a kid getting a new bike for Christmas. You will NOT be disappointed w/ this purchase. Happy & healthy cooking!

This Ninja Airfryer May have Natural Rubber in it. I have a severe Rubber Latex allergy. Upon unpacking, I noticed a rubber smell and rubber- like round feet on the crisper plate. Concerned, I called Ninja Customer Service. I was assured it was silicone. I continued to wash before using and had my typical reaction to Latex- difficulty swallowing and breathing. Either Customer Service is misinformed or I was lied to.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best air fryer I've had so far
reviews.reviewText: LOVE this air fryer, especially the ceramic coating and how fast it cooks. I've had numerous brands of air fryers and so far this is the best I've ever bought. My only complaints is that they need to make a bigger one and have it automatically pause when you take basket out instead of having to push the pause button. Hopefully they will make at least a 5.6 qt one soon and I will be buying it as soon as they do. Cleanup is a breeze and even though it is 1550 watts and my other one is 1700 watts, this one cooks better and faster.

reviews.reviewTitle: Runs a little hot but it's a very nice appliance for the money.
reviews.reviewText: I'm a big fan of Ninja products as everything I've bought from them works better than I expected. This airfryer cooks fried foods that are crispy just the way they should be. I have noticed it runs either hot or the guidebook they include the times are about 2-3 minutes longer than you really need them to be.

With all the hype floating around about air fryers, I was interested to see if they would live up to it all. I was really pleasantly surprised! I do a lot of cooking, but also work a full time job, which means I have little time to make dishes that really impress me. In nearly every way, this fryer has upended that reality and changed my life!

It has adjustable temperature and time settings which accommodate pretty much any kind of cooking you would do - dehydrating, reheating, roasting, and frying. I hardly ever use my stove or oven anymore, because using this Ninja air fryer is so much quicker and more efficient. And there are fewer dishes to be cleaned when it's all over! Since it heats things with air, I use so much less oil in my cooking. The food does taste a bit *healthier* than it used to, but that's pretty much a necessary tradeoff when you're trying to eat better.

I love how big the bottom basket is, and I'm able to fit two pounds of tofu and some veggies in there without having it spill over the top or cook unevenly. The machine is really sleek and the parts are all easy to wash, ensuring that you'll return to use it time and time again. My only complaint is that the unit is pretty loud (kind of like a dehydrator), so best to do all your air frying before guests arrive for a holiday party.

10/10 would recommend!

reviews.reviewTitle: Simple to use, nice to look at, efficient cooking
reviews.reviewText:
But why only four stars? Because what others have posted about this air fryer is true - when you first use it, it stinks. (sigh) Yes. I read the instructions before even unboxing it all the way. Yes. I thoroughly washed the basket and all associated components with warm, soapy water before using. I ran an initial burn-in (no pun intended) for ten minutes at 390 degrees, and the unit produced a noticeable plastic/chemical burn-off smell that filled the room. When I leaned close to the machine and sniffed, the smell was too acrid to take.

But why four stars if it stinks? It's a great air fryer. It doesn't continue to stink. After the components are burned in and the (whatever that stuff is) burns off, it's a really good five-star cooker. The controls are very simple. I cooked several things that turned out really well. Crispy flounder filets, popcorn shrimp, chicken patties...all crispy, hot, and ready in ten minutes. And no plastic smell on the food.
If you're cooking for one or two people and you don't really want to fire up the big oven and wait for it to reach cooking temp, this is just the thing for you. If you don't want to deal with oil splattering out of a frying pan, this is just the thing for you.
However...
If you get one of these, wash the components according to the instructions. Take it out to your garage or on your patio/porch to fire it up for the first time. Run it for about 20 minutes at 390 degrees. After that, it should be good to go. I would humbly suggest doing this no matter what brand of air fryer you select, because anything that has a heating element new from the factory will outgas a certain amount when initially turned on.
Hope this helps.

So far love it and more importantly my husband does. At first he laughed at yet another kitchen appliance. But now he's using it daily and ready to retire his deep fryer. This is so much cleaner, healthier and.. faster. I told him I need to purchase another one for his and her air fryers. 😊

Finally decided to buy an airfryer and I don’t regret. French Fries are crispy and yummy. Takes about 20 minutes to make it. Chicken tender are also delicious. Easy to clean and easy to use. Just set the temperature and time and your done. I like Ninja. You guys are the best!

Just used for the first time this evening on frozen popcorn shrimp. Did not brush any oil on them, straight from freezer to the basket. Cooked at 390 degrees for 10 minutes. They came out nice and crispy. Not the same taste as deep fried but close enough. It held about a pound and a half easily without too much crowding. A 5.5-6 quart would be perfect but the 4 qt will be fine. Clean up was a breeze.

I love this sir fryer. Does nice, crispy wings... I’ve done frozen fries of all types, pork chops came out great, as did a small pork loin. My sister-in-law borrowed it for one afternoon ordered one...says it does the best burger she’s ever cooked at home! I also bought one for my daughter and my ex:)

reviews.reviewTitle: Drop what you are doing and buy an air fryer
reviews.reviewText:
I was hesitant about getting an air fryer because of the “hype” surrounding them. However, it has quickly become our go to kitchen gadget.

The pros:
- Consistent crispness of vegetables, meats, etc in the air fryer setting
- Easy to program and setup
- Easy to clean

Cons:
- The fan can be loud
- The grate in the bottom has rubber tabs that can be a little hard to clean.
- Has trouble cooking steaks for some reason

Recommendations and mods:
- Get a small dry erase board and write down settings, times, and temperatures per type of item being cooked that produces the best results
- have a sponge for cleaning dedicated for it, can be really greasy
- make sure you prep the fryer by running it empty for 3 minutes at 390 degrees

I did some of research on air fryers and finally decided on the Ninja, it is voted one of the best air fryers. The price is very reasonable for an air fryer, I was not going to pay a couple hundred dollars or more, also I did not need a large capacity air fryer as I am cooking for myself. I decided to make air fried chicken wings, I followed all directions prior to air frying the chicken, there was just a little bit of plastic smell upon warm up. I set the timer for the 1st batch of chicken for 25mins. recommended 21-26 mins. The chicken was actually done in about 20 min. This Ninja air fryer cooks food quick, and was probably the crunchiest chicken I have had and juicy too, the second batch of wings took a little less than 20 min., The 3rd batch of chicken was just chicken legs and seasoned only, no fry coating. It took about 18 - 20 min., and was some of the tastiest chicken I have had. I am very impressed with the Ninja air fryer. Clean up was simple warm soapy water rinse, and dry nothing stuck to any parts as for I did use vegetable spray in the basket and the heating tray and rack. This Ninja knows how to air fry, cannot wait to try the dehydrator. This was worth every penny.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fakespot said F but it’s fine!
reviews.reviewText: My Avalon Bay was chipping and peaking so I wanted a new ceramic coated non pealing and Ninja was only one I found. Fakespot said F. Amazon 4/5 stars. These things are all the same: a heating element, a fan and either digital or dial controlled. My test was my wings. !!!! Perfect! Can’t trust reviews anymore or fakespot. Who’s to say companies aren’t fudging data and paying fakespot now! Good luck. Only complaint it’s very loud compared to my other!

 After just four months of use, it sounds like it an old pressure cooker that’s about to explode. Unable to get anywhere with Ninja customer service. Calling Amazon now and hopefully will get better luck. I literally feel unsafe when this thing is on.

UPDATE: No issues after owning for 4 months now, still amazing.

First, let me say I love air fryers. They make frying food so much easier. The tots come out super crispy and evenly cooked, check strips are juicy in the middle and crispy on the outside. When I used an oven I could never get tots to be crispy, they would always be soggy or some were crispy while others were not, no longer an issue.

I originally had a Philips HD9220/28 Viva Airfryer but had to return it after using for a short while. It was hard to clean as the basket would just get grease a stuck in it, the first one I had rusted the second one started to get scratched in the back of the pan from the basket getting removed and added to the pan. Overall it felt that it was made with super cheap parts. While it cooked the food well, the quality was crap.

The Ninja, on the other hand, seems to be well made. the tray in the inside of the pan slides in and out of the pan easily and since it is a flat surface instead of a basket makes it super easy to clean in comparison. I love that you can easily pause the timer and that there is a power button. This way I can keep the device plugged in and pause the timer as I remove the basket to shake the food to make sure it cooks evenly then restart it when I put the tray back. The design is not perfect, as the tray doesn't match up perfectly with the device, so it isn't completely flushed to the device, but that is a minor aesthetic. Just like the Philips, the device smells horrible when you first start it up. However, after a few uses, the smell completely goes away. The digital display makes it easy to set the temperature and timer. The cookbook it comes with is thin but has some good recipes and the additional wire tray is a nice addition to the device. I highly recommend the Ninja as the quality is great of the parts, it is easy to clean, and the food cooks perfectly as long as you follow the instructions. So far this is the best Air Fryer I have used and it is super affordable.

If I notice any issues in the next few months as I use the device I will update the review.

This is a must have for those looking for a healthier life with cooking. Capacity is smaller, but I chose this one because it is ceramic coated. Most of the others are not. Also the dehydrate feature is great. I've made fried tilapia, hash browns, dried pears and reheated pizza in the last 5 days. really easy to clean. Next is ribs and pizza from scratch
Smelled gross... poor quality

Okay, this is my first air fryer. After reading a bunch about the health advantages, I was mostly sold on at least giving one a try, and then when I started to think about how I seldom actually deep fry anything because of the mess and cleanup work, I figured even if an airfryer gave me half the quality, it might be worthwhile.

The Ninja unit couldn't be easier to assemble and setup. Unbox it, wash a few parts and you're ready to go...doubt it would take more than 10 minutes for most people to go from UPS delivering the box to frying some fries. The unit is a bit of an awkward size - it sits fine on my counters, but it's not that easy to find a place to store it. Luckily, I have a nearly empty shelf in my pantry...otherwise, I would have been in for a little shelf reconfiguration.

In operation, it's somewhat noisy, but not much more than my full-size microwave oven, and probably less than my large range hood on one of the higher settings. It heats quickly without the outside parts getting too hot to touch, and that's important to me, especially in the hot summer months where the last thing I want is another appliance pumping more heat into my kitchen.

The food drawer/tray is a little smaller than I expected. Two medium/large potatoes cut into fries pretty much fill it, as do about 6-8 chicken tenderloin strips. The good news is that it cooks quickly, so it's not too bad if you need to split your food up into multiple batches.

I found if you shake or turn your food often (as the instructions recommend), then food generally cooks evenly. Yes, it gets crispy, but no, I don't think you'd confuse what comes out of the machine with true deep fried food. Still, it's definitely healthier, and certainly a lot faster and easier to cleanup.

I suppose if you're looking for an airfryer, this is a good unit to try. It's not super expensive, and it definitely gets the job done about as well as the others I've heard about. Definitely worth a look if you're shopping for a nice air fryer at a fair price.

This is not a good airfyer. The metal piece doesn’t fit and falls out so you can’t dump anything on a plate you have to scoop it out. I have burnt my hand several times because of this. This is my third airfyer and never again will I buy this brand. It’s going in the garage sale. Worst ever.

Received my Ninja Air Fryer - all I can say is that I wish I would have gotten one sooner! Excellent value for the money. First meal was chicken wings. Fast, delicious, and easy clean up. No more spending money on take out wings! Very pleased! Cooks everything nice and crispy. Was never really big on using a lot of oil so this is amazing for anyone trying to reduce their oil intake and be more healthy. The only drawback that I have run across is that it is very large in diameter and requires a lot of cabinet or pantry space to store it.

Does everything it claims to do. Great for a meal for a small family. If you have a large crowd of hungry people it would be best to go to the oven or big grill. Some of the juiciest steaks, chicken, and fish I have had in a long time. This has so many features, we would probably need several months to get through them all.
it works great but the smoke that fills the house is horrible

I have tried many washes and soaks but the odor during and after cooking is worrying me. What could be off-gassing like that and possibly getting into the food? If Ceramic, not teflon coated, is there some other chemical in it that is coming off? It's not the food being cooked as notice it with every item we have cooked--several times a week for the past month. Too late to return. Would running it dishwasher cycle help get rid of the smell? I am very sensitive to chemicals and surprised to have this "chemical" smell still after a months use. Seems to be noticeable when the unit is running at the higher temps of 350 or above.
Didn’t even work for 3 months. Ninja had terrible customer service. Hunk of junk.

reviews.reviewTitle: Do not waste counter space and money
reviews.reviewText: The minutes in the guide are grossly overstated, the machine is loud and the items I have tried were horrible, nothing good to say, a waste of money

reviews.reviewText: I bought this as a Christmas gift for a family member who wanted an air fryer. I didn't realize when I bought it that it could also dehydrate, roast, and reheat! The sweet potato tater tots they tried got warm but never crisped up like the others did. (My sister-in-law later said the operator may have had the temperature too low because when they'd done them in one they borrowed from a friend she'd used 425 and the operator of this one had had it in the 300-400 degree range.)

so I did a product review video and for some reason I can't upload it. anyways, this thing is a 5 star product hands down. I did buy this discounted through Amazon warehouse for $65. That's a STEAL! I'm very impressed with how crispy chicken wings turn out, I'm super picky with my crispy wings. (and I mean picky) but this did a very good job. I also made a little 7inch personal pizza in under 5 mins. The clean up is almost non existent the teflon material on this is just amazing. food wipes clean or slides out no issues. highly recommended!

We don't eat a lot of fried food but I wanted a faster way to cook certain things and not have the mess. The maiden voyage of this Ninja fryer was a complete success. I cooked chicken nuggets for my kids in 8 minutes from scratch. I used an old baked chicken nugget recipe and converted it with ease. Then I air fried a remaining chicken breast and it cooked to 165 degrees perfectly. I'm actually amazed. I can't wait to air fry veggies and the like! It was super easy to set up, easy to clean since it's a non-stick basket and tray... and it sounds like the stove vent fan is on when it's running. Some have complained that it's a bit loud but I'm used to boiling things and am rarely in the kitchen at dinner time without the vent fan on so it was no big deal to our family. 2 thumbs up.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is the one to get

reviews.reviewTitle: Wanted one bought two by mistake
reviews.reviewText: Great little machine I bought two by mistake and sent one back. I recommend this for anyone especially single and couples

First, I would like to share something I learned years ago from the owner's manual when I purchased my first set of T-Fal teflon-coated cookware--let any pan cool completely BEFORE soaking in warm sudsy water. My current set is well over 15 years old and just now starting to show deterioration of the coating. I think more from metal utensils being used occasionally (by an unknown person or persons!) than anything else. So when I read the reviews on other brands and saw where the coating was breaking down after a short period of time, I kept looking. NINJA AIR FRYER....I am quite pleased with the Ninja Air Fryer--I like that it has a digital display and is easy for me to read (I'm 74), that it has a pause button, the crisper tray is a bonus and works as intended, and it just looks good sitting on my counter. Its has 4 functions--air frying, roasting, reheating and dehydrating. First, of course, I fixed tater tots and french fries; last week I fixed a small roast and a baked potato, and this week I tried boneless, skinless chicken breasts (with and without shake and bake coating), and boneless pork chops (brushed with olive oil only). All came out looking good and very edible. There is learning curve involved with any new appliance, so I have made notes as I try each item. As with any new appliance, the more you use it, the more ways you will think to use it. The ceramic coated basket was a major selling point, and I let it cool before soaking. I use a soft rag mop-type brush (no bristles) to clean it, and it does the job. No scrubbing needed. I never have put my pots and pans in the dishwasher regardless what the manufacturer says. Today, I am going to try to bake cornbread using the small loaf pans I had purchased for my toaster oven. Tomorrow, muffins in silicone baking cups! This is probably a larger size air fryer than I needed for one person; however, I decided I'd rather have one too big than too small--plus it will be used when I have company. Money well spent! UPDATE: Another important consideration was that the basket was ROUND--8.5" diameter--unlike many other air fryer brands. All accessories (cake pan, pizza pan, etc.) and the parchment liners I looked at and ultimately purchased were 7+" and "round." Plenty of room for air circulation and easy to add to and remove from basket. Plus many of my existing oven baking dishes and pans will also work. Something to think about!

We've cooked so many things in this air fryer and they turn out crispy and baked all the way through! My husband is in the kitchen making chicken wings in it as well speak! I've made vege tots, pizza rolls, pork chops, and chicken thighs, all turned out great! You have to try it! The only reasons I marked it down a star down is because the frying rack has to be sprayed with oil or it isn't very easy to clean and I wish it were bigger.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy clean up...fan a little loud
reviews.reviewText:
I have been pleased with this airfryer. It is different in many way from my previous one. I really like more than expected. Only one basket to clean. Just wanted.to add
Wish Ninja would add rubber to legs under basket...it is leaving black marks on my counter.. I did not notice at first. Still pleased overall.

reviews.reviewTitle: What the hell are people talking about!
reviews.reviewText: This is not in anyway, even remotely similar to fried food. So just get that myth out of your head. I have no clue what the hell all these reviewers are talking about. "Omg best French fries ever" " it taste just like fried food!". All lies! It in no way taste fried. It's basically an adult easy bake oven. Does it make food a lil crispies than the oven, maybe. But if u cooked something in a convection oven or this, the taste would basically be the same. Now the only perk about this, is that it cuts your cook time exponentially. Instead of cooking something in the oven for 20min, you can cook it under 10min. So if u beed to save time or save money on your electric bill, viola. Maybe you wanna go camping but cant, obviously, bring your oven. Then this works great. Aside from that, its absolutely useless and just something that takes up space. Also, I tried the gowise that everyone raves about. It's the same results but the ninja build quality is far better. As a machine it looks like its built to last and well put together. So I'd choose this over the gowise. But if you really need a new toy, then get the ninjafoodi. You'll have way more cooking options and it's not that much more, considering ur wasting your money anyway.

Best purchase I have ever made. I have used this to make fried chicken and it is so good! This air fryer is so easy to use and cleanup is a breeze. I love all my Ninja gadgets and this one does not disappoint! Get it now!
I like this better than the Phillips.

reviews.reviewTitle: Third air fryer I've owned, this one is the best by far
reviews.reviewText:
I've owned to NuWave Air Fryers, and both had issues. The first one died after one year, and the second would started randomly shutting off (maybe overheating?). Regardless, I was in the market for a different brand. So far, I'd say I found a good one.

A few things I've discovered:
1) As others have said, it does run a little hot (or maybe other ones run cold?). You may want to reduce the temperature a bit than what's recommended on some recipes.
2) The non-stick coating is excellent
3) I was concerned about the design as this one doesn't have a basket, but instead a raised "plate" that sits in the bottom of the bowl. Turns out, it's a WAY better design than the ones with a basket. It's significantly easier to clean.
4) From what I can tell, the "smell" that some people complained about is probably just the silicone pads that hold the crisper plate against the sides of the bowl. I didn't think it was strong, and it completely stopped happening after a few uses.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use, works well and easy to clean
reviews.reviewText:
The Ninja Air fryer is easy to use, works well and is easy to clean. It worked great for most of the food we normally deep fry and I am glad that we are now able to cook these without using a lot of oil. It comes with a sticker with recommended temperature and cook times for common categories of food such as poultry, fish, meat, and of course, french fries.
This appliance is a bit bulky though but the up side is it has a good capacity basket and cooks enough for our family (2 adults and 1 child) in one batch.
The basket has an inner tray and both are easy enough to clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: One of the few appliances that lives up to the hype
reviews.reviewText: I use the Ninja Air Fryer every day to cook things. The heavy-duty non-stick grill and interior are easy to clean. I love that I can easily make Chicken Wings straight from frozen. The Salmon and Brussel Sprouts I made in the Ninja Air Fryer were also perfect. So far everything has been great. The only possible downside is that because it's reasonably sized it makes enough food for 2-3 people at most. It's not a monster sized Air Fryer. So if you need to feed a big family you're going to have to cook more than one batch or get two units or buy something else that's bigger.
It smellls like heated plastic during cooking. No way this is healthy and safe to use. Mine is going to the basement
Tried it & didn't like it. Tried several different types of food - Food doesn't taste very good.

I love my new airfryer. It has revolutionized the way I cook for the better. Even cooks ribeye steaks that taste as
good as those on the grille.

The functionality of this air fryer is nice. The problem I have is there is a horrid smell which I have been trying to diagnose. The crisper plate has rubber? feet on it which I thought was the issue. I took out the plate and used the metal rack only, and there was still a smell, albeit much less. I've used the air fryer several more times with the crisper plate since I thought it was coming from somewhere else, resulting in the same horrid smell. At this point I'm convinced it is mostly the crisper plate's rubber feet which I took off. I just cooked something that didn't take much time and the smell seemed much better. More experimenting is needed, but I want to love this because it works well and is easy to clean, but that smell can clear a room, very toxic and not something I want in my food!
Update (about 1 month later): Have been using air fryer, took feet off the inside tray. Sometimes does not smell too bad sometimes still smells awful. I notice the awful smell is usually when cooking bacon - a lot of grease drips down. I think it's the grease contacting the ceramic coating (if it is just ceramic?). Ceramic shouldn't smell that bad but the smell is toxic and awful. Will be returning, too bad because otherwise the product is great. They need to use less toxic materials.

Where have you been all my life, air fryer!

I was skeptical at first. We have a decent number of kitchen gadgets.

Here's the deal. An air fryer is insane.
Frozen Chinese food from Trader Joe's? Hell yes.
Toast? Amazing.
Shrimp? Aaaaammazing.
Cauliflower: kinda like chicken wings.
Chicken wings? Yes. It does those.
Frozen baked good you lost in the back of the freezer? Just like it came out of the oven.

Think of the air fryer as a reviver for foods. You know how friend food left overs never taste good? This is THE way to bring that stuff back to life, and to imbue your fresh foods with a perfect fored texture.

This particular one is easy to clean, spacious, and has a good user interface. What's not to love?

reviews.reviewTitle: Great quality and is so easy to use.
reviews.reviewText: We are new to the Air Fryer revolution so we didn't really know which one to get. We like the Ninja Brand so we figure we would spend the extra money on this one. We were not dissapointed. Have had it for 3 days and have made dinner in it for 3 days. Very easy to use / clean. This device will be used a ton in the coming months. Hope it can keep up.
this fryer can do almost anything. still learning. the only thing negative i can say is that they don't give you enough easy recipes with machine.
Does not fry. Would have loved refund but window is closed for a refund! :(
Great gadget. My wings turned out great with 1/8 the mess. Easy to clean. I only wish it could hold more food. I ended up cooking 2 batches of wings for me and my hubby.
So far I've done fries, onion rings, egg rolls and toasted ravioli. Everything is done in half the time the oven would take and is so much crispier!

It's just a convection oven, people, and one more appliance to hog up pantry space. I already have an oven and cookie sheets, a dehydrator and several cast iron skillets.
It is also covered in Teflon which is SO bad for you, but we just had to try it, and it had a bad plastic smell. I actually asked my husband if he washed it first and he said yeah. The food we made didn't turn out any better than the other batch we compared it to from the oven.
Save your money on this and get yourself a nice new shiny cookie sheet or cast iron griddle!

Kitchen gadgets are a role of the dice. Use them a half dozen times and the novelty wears off then it’s stuffed under a cabinet to become next years yard sale fodder. Not so with this guy. First off it works. Yeah, I know - shocker! But hear me out - we started with frozen shrimp. Yep, not hard to screw that up, right? Well they came out BETTER than when we bake or oil fry. Just as crispy with no oil to deal with. Just a sprits if olive oil spray and boom! Perfect shrimp. Same thing for fries, wings, and onion rings. We then scored a recipe book on air frying (thank you Amazon) and now we do so many different things you’d be amazed - I have to say over a third of the things we used to bake or fry are now done in the air fryer. Probably closer to 50%. My only complaint? Size - to get the most value you need at least a midsize fryer - go with something too small and you will regret it. Our ninja is the perfect size - but it is also large so be ready to clean out a cabinet to hold this guy. You can be lazy and just keep it on your counter but it looks out of place in our kitchen - perhaps if you sell your oven you would have a nice spot for your ninja! Just kidding folks lol! Enjoy!
Update: So spring is here and the grill is ready to roll but our air fryer remains the number one item in our kitchen next to our instant pot. Just made some fried green tomatoes (purchased from the store not locally yet - too soon) and they came out terrific. Not quite the same mind you but perfectly acceptable. Two thumbs up!!!
Handle came off first time I used it. Plastic hand plus metal screws equals poor design. Guaranteed to strip, just like they did.

reviews.reviewTitle: A must have for busy people who want to eat healthy and still enjoy taste
reviews.reviewText: I love that the food cooks in a short amount of time and comes out delicious and flavorful without using much oil. I use spices on chicken, cauliflower and brussel sprouts and a little spray. I wish I had discovered this sooner! This is a huge improvement over fries I make in the oven. My kids have been asking for air fryer food every night since I started using it. I also like to automatic shut off /timer feature so I can pop out and pick one of the kids up and the food is ready and warm whenever I get back.

This machine destroys food and appetites. Maybe it has a faulty thermostat. We set the temperature at its lowest setting and cut time in half and the outcome was not good. The book says to cook French fries 22 minutes. At lowest temperature they were done in 8 minutes. I called Amazon support and they transferred me to Ninja support. Stephanie told me that the instruction book that came with the fryer wasn't meant to be accurate, only a general guideline. She said you had to watch it and learn how to use.we have tried several different things and things get dry and hard. It is big añd noisy and the only food it hasn't ruined is some frozen fries.

reviews.reviewTitle: Delicious Fries and Very Easy Cleanup
reviews.reviewText: Friends of mine have used Air Fryers and I liked the results so I finally decided to get my own. I've made hamburgers, sweet potato fries, roasted vegetables, chicken, salmon, and even brownies. The Ninja is easy to use and is very easy to clean up. The 4-quart size is perfect for my wife and me. The results for chicken and salmon were good, but no better than our regular toaster/broiler oven. However the hamburgers and sweet potato fries were great, better than what we get otherwise. The brownie recipe that came with the Air Fryer is now my go-to recipe for brownies. They are similar to lava cakes. Roasted vegetables came out about the same compared to our oven, but the process is quicker and cleanup is a snap.

reviews.reviewTitle: The best air frier in its class
reviews.reviewText:
This is as good as air friers get. Cooks exactly how you want it to.

Now, if you are new to air friers I'll explain a little about them. Otherwise skip the next paragraph.
Air friers aren't going to produce the same results as deep frying. I will say however, it is the close enough to not rely on fried foods. Your foods cook evenly and have a nice crisp when cooked right. It's worth a try if you are on the fence.

Now back to the main review and recommendations for cooking. You can coat what you want to cook in an oil, butter, or some other kind of high cooking temperature substance. Toss the food every 5 minutes or so again, depending on what you're cooking. And the results will be crispy but still moist. Flavorful and fast.
This air frier can cook all kinds of foods. From frozen egg rolls and fries to freshly caught salmon from the Northern Atlantic. I'm confident in saying this air frier will be worth it's money in what you save enjoying more foods at home.

After hearing my friends talk up air frying, I thought If give it a try. I researched a lot of air fryers. The weird part was everyone I know has different brands and they’re all happy with them. I went with Ninja because I have the Bullet, that is used daily, and it is reliable.

The size is similar to an Instant Pot. It runs relatively quietly. Think of the fan on a computer. It’s noticeable, but not distracting. When it comes to cleaning, it’s super easy. Other than the tiny bar on the in the middle of the elevation tray, it’s non-stick. The controls are simple and button presses require very little force to register

My only complaint (same for most air fryers) is the horizontal space. Yes, you can pour 2 pounds of fries inside, but you can’t lay two burger patties without them over lapping. I end up cooking them until they shrink a bit then adjust if needed before continuing.

Overall the Ninja is a solid choice. I’ve used it at least once or twice a week with no issues. If you’re in the market for an air fryer, you can’t go wrong with this one.

Very easy to use. I bought thus because it's the only air fryer with ceramic coating inside, so i don't have to worry about the coating chip off. And I usually use parchment paper or foil on top of the stainless steel rack which makes cleaning extremely easy. Food tastes really great ( 100% like deep-fried with only a little bit of oil on food), and I also love it for fish like salmon, the whole thick piece is so tender. My husband and I are very happy with it. It is somehow small ( fits only 1 big steak) but that's what I wanted because I don't want it to take too much space in the kitchen.

reviews.reviewTitle: A crispy chicken and French-fry meal in less than 1 1/2 hrs after receiving.
reviews.reviewText: NOTE: It's really loud. We didn't start prepping the food until after the Ninja arrived. Hence the hour and half. Actual cooking time was less than an hour for all. We love it! We also tried broccoli, but the ends burned, so not a good idea. The chicken was crispy outside and juicy inside. The fries were mostly crispy and nearly oil free. Maybe cut the fries thinner next time, but I'm sold. I love fries but never order them due to the oil absorption. I already had a 20 amp wall outlet in place to use it. I would suggest you do the same, and standard outlets are only rated for 15 amps max. and may burn. The wiring is still no. 14, and marginal but ok.

Absolutely love this thing! I cant believe I lived so long without it. Made chimichangas in it the other night. 6 minutes at 400 degrees on one side. Flip for 2 more minutes. Perfection. Cant wait to use it next time!

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great just keep an eye on it
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely love my fryer although it is temperamental. When you first start cooking food you have to keep checking every couple minutes to make sure your food isn't burning and make sure you flip it too. however once you get the hang of it it's not that hard. I love to do bacon in ours it's so much less greasy and I don't burn myself anymore. Works like a champ when you need to reheat food such as Pizza or sandwiches. I made some delicious grilled cheeses with it too however my children thought they were too crunchy LOL. Other than it being temperamental at first my only other issue is it's a pain in the butt to clean the feet of the crisping plate sometimes especially if grease and guck gets in there. I have ran it through the dishwasher and it's worked wonderfully.

We have had this air fryer for several months now, let me say that Our oven no longer gets used for French fries chicken strips fish sticks or baked chicken. This has reduced cooking time by quite a bit with a much better crunchy fried texture without the grease. We like it so much we ordered one for my wife’s mom that will never use a microwave but fell in love with the ninja air fryer when she was here last. She especially liked the baked chicken I cooked her in the ninja, at that point she was sold. I will say it’s not a primary way for us to cook but it helps on those busy days when you are trying to juggle work kids and cooking a meal for a family all before it gets too late.

Likely the best quality air-fryer currently available. Per Consumer Reports, while most air fryers produce similar results, they differ in controls and cleaning ease.

The Ninja has excellent controls and a single ceramic dishwasher safe easy to clean basket - an important time saving feature. Most other air-fryers use 2 basket units that have hard to clean holes. The fan noise level is about the same as a microwave oven. Temperature control settings were tested against an oven thermometer and were found to be extremely accurate. Ninja is also unique in that it offers a low temperature dehydrate feature.

Also, Ninja is an established American based company, not a fly-by-night company with no physical address.

The Teflon coating in the basket is coming off other than that it makes excellent food (great wings)

I hope Ninja will take care of this issue...we will see...
fnot much different than using toaster oven.

I knew right away this wasn't big enough for just my husband and me. We're regular size, healthy people, who don't eat copious quantities, but good grief! You lay 4 chicken thighs in the basket and they're squished up against each other (which ruins the crispiness) and that's not practical. We're 2 people. I don't want to fry in batches.....But I like the brand, and when they advertised the larger one, I decided to return this one and get it. Turns out "free returns" aren't always free. They kept $12 of my money. Maybe it's for restocking? I don't know. I didn't raise a fuss, but I did keep it till the end of my return period, using it frequently, learning how to use an air fryer on it because I'd paid for the privilege.

This product will save you so much time in the kitchen. After working all day, sitting/driving in traffic, exercising, staying hydrated, & adult-ing; the last thing I feel like doing is cooking in the kitchen for hours. I HIGHLY recommend purchasing this air fryer. I just cooked chicken & a sweet potato in less than 35 minutes! I love that you have the option to stack foods inside using the metal rack that comes with the appliance. If you're looking for something that doesn't require too much time & cleanup, then this is the product for you!

reviews.reviewTitle: Had to get use to it but like it
reviews.reviewText: First two times I used this, I was ready to return it. Smoked my house so bad thought I was going to have to call the fire dept. Not sure what that was about but I kept trying it since it has so many good reviews & I have ended up liking it alot. It's not as great as my 1st no-name brand air fryer but it's still fine. I've noticed I must cook a lot of items on a much lower temp than my last fryer & I have to put water in the bottom for anything very greasy like bacon or hamburger to control the smoke. I do wish that it would pause the cooking automatically when I open it to shake but I have gotten used to pausing it myself. Also wish it had a shake reminder alarm on it like a couple other fryers I have seen. I love it's ceramic; feel like it's safer to use than the Teflon's. Had to get use to some of the temps not being there; for ex goes from 375 straight to 390, nothing in between. There are a few temp levels like that. Is it the best air fryer out there? To me, no, but overall, it's not a bad fryer and I feel you will like it.

I took the plunge. I don't regret it. Everything fries up super crispy. Be careful at first - the recommended times in the booklet led me to things being a little overcooked. Very easy to clean. Easy to use buttons. I got one for my grandmother too. Its surprisingly quiet.

reviews.reviewTitle: Where have you been in my life? Amazing fryer!
reviews.reviewText:
THE SHORT AND SWEET VERSION
- So easy to use... you can probably not read the manual and be a pro at it. Buttons are self-explanatory
- Booklet is an amazing guide - do not throw it out. Follow it closely and it'll almost guarantee your food will come out perfect each time.

THE LONG-WINDED VERSION
I've heard so much about air fryers but never actually went and got one. Well, my GF finally convinced me to get one (and it was also on sale so that helped) and I haven't looked back. First, it's super easy to use. The buttons are self explanatory. The instruction guide/booklet is even better (don't throw it away!) since it tells you what you can cook with it, what temperature, and time to use. I don't follow it exactly but very close to it. I love how it has a timer so I know it'll stop automatically when it's finished.

WATCH OUTS: the only watch-out, and it's probably standard, is that it blows out how air through the vents in the back. Make sure that the back of the air fryer is not against anything and that there's a lot of space/open air around it.

I've just used this for the first time to cook frozen breaded ravioli. Something simple just to see how it worked. The cooking went well. It was the washing up where some issues arose. First, I noticed a scratch in the non-stick surface. It isn't terribly large, but shouldn't be there, and what is going to happen in the future if it came with a scratch? Rust? Peeling? Secondly, that silver bar in the center is NOT non-stick, and the food absolutely does get stuck under and around the ends where the screws are, and there is very little room under it to get a sponge to clean it off. This is really poorly thought out construction for something that is going to be used often and need to be cleaned often. Not the first time use I was looking for.

This is my second air fryer. The first was a Power Air Fryer. That one didn’t last long. The basket coating peeled off!

The Ninja is nice looking, more important it is a nice large size. I can fit quite a bit of food in it.
The one negative, and really not that big a deal, is that the pull out drawer doesn’t fit snug, only if you give it a good shove.

The basket with crisper insert is a joy to clean. Nothing seems to stick.

The only other thing is that it is noisy. But most air fryers are.

I’m not an expert on air fryers so bought this based on name brand recognition and good reviews. It makes outstanding wings but I can only fit 8 at the most in there at once and it takes about 25 minutes to cook them so prior planning is imperative especially if I need a couple dozen cooked. I’m intrigued by the ninja pressure cooker air fryer combo machine but since I already have both appliances separately I’m not buying it at this time. Also I use this outside or in the garage when possible because it exhausts out high pressure chicken smelling air that tends to linger for a few days.

reviews.reviewTitle: Change the taste of your food for better
reviews.reviewText:
Never had an air fryer before this purchase, I have been missing out. Completely replaced my microwave and oven on small to medium meals within the first week so far.

Reason 1: Easy. I set and forget. Place the food (frozen vegetables, chicken, steak, etc) with a teaspoon of oil in the tray, set it to air fry, and in 20 minutes it’s done. (I do come by every few minutes and shake the tray just to check on the food from burning or try and get an even cook).

Reason 2: Taste. The food tastes better. Somehow, the air and oil create a crisp on the food that can’t be matched by microwave or oven. And only in 20 minutes.

Reason 3: Cleanup. Nothing sticks, reusable like a cast iron pan. Just wipe it down with your favorite oil and use again. Or clean it with mild dish soap and water.

I will give the Ninja Air Fryer a guarded 4 stars. I received it today. Tonight I made panko crusted shrimp and parmesan zucchini slices. They were good. The air fryer is definitely easy to use. Just wash the pan part, dry, and you’re good to go. The controls are pretty self-explanatory. It heats up fast and does a good job of cooking and crisping the food. You need to be careful not to overcook the food. This baby gets hot, as it should and the heat is very concentrated so watch your recipe. Use on line recipes as a guide, but don’t take the times as hard and fast rules. Check the food often.

It does warm up the kitchen because it is blowing the hot air out, but even with it being 106 degrees outside it wasn’t terrible and it cools down quickly when you get done. It isn’t as loud as our microwave so that is a plus. Clean up is easy for now, we’ll see after using it more if it cleans up as quickly.

The reason for a guarded 4 star rating is I need to see how well it holds up over time. Also, the food is pretty bland. Air frying doesn’t have the oil to give flavor so more spice is needed. As I learn to ramp up the spice I will revisit my review.

After 2 uses the nonstick came off the grate. Less than 2 months into using it the handle came completely off. The fryer plate is very small (I could only dehydrate HALF an apple).
When I contacted Ninja they said it would cost $19.95 in shipping for them to replace their low quality product... I'd rather save my $20 and put it towards one that is actually a quality product.

I have been using the Ninja for about six months. I really like it for French fries and just about every other fried food I make. It is excellent for making things that would otherwise require cooking in oil or grease. Very easy to use. The cooking pan is a bit small, but it hasn't been a problem for two person meals...a little restricted for larger meals. I find that I can load the pan and get the best results by stopping the cook cycle and rearranging the food to get an even browning. I particularly enjoy making fried fish and chicken breasts. The come out light and greaseless. I highly recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great air fryer with some shortfalls
reviews.reviewText: I do love this air fryer and it is great for most things. I've made fried chicken, buffalo wings, etc. and it works great. I've made French fries, but if you follow the recipe in the booklet you'll end up with burned fries. By trial and error I was able to find a time/temp setting that doesn't burn the fries. One of the biggest issues I had with this fryer (which not sure it is by design) the air blowers are pretty powerful. That means that if you try to fry anything light, it will fly all over the place. It works great for heavier things like chicken drum sticks, etc, but forget about trying to cook anything on the lighter side.

My wife and I really love this thing and have been using it a lot since we got it. It is very easy to use and just as easy to clean. In reality, it tastes terrible and is extremely hard to bite into, but I said the flavor was 5 star because if you know what your doing the food you cook in it will taste great.
I'm not sure why I knocked it down 1 star. I would have preferred to knock it down only 1/4 star. It gives you just one additional rack besides the crisper rack for using to dehydrate foods. Of course it is really meant to be used as an Air Fryer and not a dehydrator, but still, this really only gives you enough room to dehydrate a small amount. I was almost able to get an entire slice Apple into the three levels. This is a small thing really, but thee is plenty of room to have almost three more racks and there doesn't seem to be way to purchase more, and I'm not sure if you just bought a replacement of the one they do give you if it work stack like it needs to, so 4 3/4 stars rather than 5.

Anything you would cook in a convection oven, you can cook in an air fryer as long as it is big enough. If we can fit it in the air fryer, we cook it in the air fryer. You are saving energy by heating less air. This one is about as big as I want to go and still treat it as portable. It is light and small enough that you can store it in a cupboard. We take ours in our RV and it's small. Don't think every thing is going to come our perfect. It takes practice to figure out exactly how to cook things in an air fryer. The instructions that come with this one are pretty spot on but you will still have to practice with things that are not covered in the guide. Just realize that you will screw things up and you won't get as frustrated. Much of what you hear about these is hype. There are some benefits but you need to do your research, be cynical and make sure it makes sense for you.

reviews.reviewTitle: Next best thing since the microwave
reviews.reviewText: We bought this just to try out. Didn't have any high expectations because we tried hot air toaster oven in the past and didn't work out. This came out surprisingly well. Can reheat fried food without making them soggy. Doesn't taste like leftovers. The whole family uses it. Very easy to use. Our microwave and the Ninja air fryer are now about tied in terms of usage. We have it in the kitchen plugged into an outlet that is hardly used. Didn't want to trip any circuit breakers. 1500 watts is quite a bit. The microwave has it's own dedicated breaker. Don't share the same breaker as it will trip when both are on. It does blow a decent amount of heat from the back. We don't add any oil and any excess oil in the food will drain to the bottom. Last big plus is it's available in ceramic. We have birds so we got the ceramic version as the nonstick version will be too toxic for them. Anyone using this will not be dissappointed.

reviews.reviewTitle: So glad I bought it! Thank you again, Ninja!!
reviews.reviewText:
Guys, I am OBSESSED!!!! Buy it!!!!!!
Cook your favorite foods without the guilt!!! Seriously, Ninja - well done! You have impressed me again. I have the Nutri Ninja Pro blender 900 Watts, bought in 2015, and use it almost daily - LOVE IT - keep saying it has been one of the best investments I’ve done for my kitchen.... & NOW, I’ve invested in the Ninja Air Fryer 4-quart, (which equals 2 LB in the frying basket), and ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT as well! Super user friendly and SOOO EASY to clean!!!

Few things to keep in mind:
1. Always reheat the Air Fryer before inserting the food.
2. When prepping your foods, put them in a plastic bag or a container with seasoning of your preference and ALWAYS add a little bit of oil for a light coat to your food items (I use avocado oil or olive oil).
3. While cooking, check your food every 2-5 minutes, and move it around so that it cooks deliciously even!! (ie. chicken wings every 5 minutes, homemade fries or tostones de pana every 2-3 minutes).
4. ALWAYS clean your Air Fryer after each use. It keeps it in good condition and coated so that it’s always easy to clean, eliminates odors and flavors from previous meals.

Hope this helps, ladies & gents! 😉👍

reviews.reviewTitle: Will be a nice cooking utensil for our RV
reviews.reviewText:
It’s taking some experimentation to get use to it but I’m pretty sure this will be great for RVing. Easy to clean and does a pretty good job of cooking food once you figure out how to do it.

Update: I love this Air Fryer so much I also bought the Foodi. It's even better. Also, We did take it RVing and I cooked everything in it. Never even used the stove or oven which was nice for clean up.

So I had a different air fryer that I used for 18 months before the interior nonstick got so bad that I didn’t want to use it. I wanted a new air fryer with ceramic nonstick in hopes that it would last longer and I found this one. I have other Ninja products that I like and that work well, so I thought I would give this a try. It did smell like rubber for the first week of use, but it does go away. The nonstick is good, like really easy to clean and seems like it will last kind of good. Love that you can add more time while it’s cooking, the other one wouldn’t let you. The size is great and doesn’t take up too much room. Really just seems like a great air fryer.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love this air fryer so much!!!
reviews.reviewText: I love love love this airfryer! I had never even heard of them before, but my sister-in-law has one and she made us chicken one night and it was amazing. I don't like keeping appliances like this on my counter, but this one stays on my counter every day because I use it almost every day. You can cook meats and vegetables. There is a guide that goes with it that tells you how long to cook certain foods, and it takes a couple of times of trial-and-error to get it just right. That is not a complaint, it's just a fact with anything new that you get like this I think. And I can't believe how easy it is to clean! I have gotten things that proclaimed to be easy to clean, but they ended up not being easy. This air fryer is so easy to clean, that even though you are allowed to put it in the dishwasher, I always wash it by hand because it is so easy to do! And cooking in the air fryer is so much healthier.bHave I mentioned I love it? 😃

Bought one, was broken. Called Ninja and between Amazon and Ninja we returned the product and got a replacement. Machine is great! Just like our other airfryer that broke perviously.(non ninja product) This air fryer is quite and turns out great results. Definitely would buy again and would recommend. Ninja stood by their product and replaced the broken one.

reviews.reviewTitle: So amazing ! Would recommend to anyone!
reviews.reviewText: So far we have used the frying part of it and its way better than deep fryed! Its the same crisp without the aftertase of grease. Everything cooks evenly and fast. I did alot of research on different air fryers before i bought this one. This one had the best reviews and i know why. Its super easy to use /clean and uses no oil unlike some of the other air fryers and cooks really fast! I cannot wait to try out the roasting and dehydrator options ! It even came with a recipe for jerky !

1- They have had terrible customer service, asked the question never returned to me
2-Material and design used for this product are only in image not in reality
3- It is easy to use and work in the beginning only. Need time to see how it works

I’m not using this as much as I hoped to use it BUT it makes the crispiest chicken wings I’ve ever had. I made flourless garlic parm wings, normally I baked the wings then broil them for 1 min each side to get crispy but then its gets burnt too quickly and charred.

I seasoned 12 chicken wings cut in halves so that's 24 pieces with salt and black pepper and add 1-2 tablespoons of olive oil tossed around. I added it to the airfryer after 3 mins of preheating and set the temp to 390 degrees and 22 minutes as suggested in the user manual. I’d check on it every 7 minutes to shake the chicken around so that it’s getting crispy everywhere. By about 18 minutes though it looked like If I left it in there any longer it would burn.
I made my garlic parm sauce and added the wings to the mixture and bam! Best garlic parm wings I’ve ever made at home. I made them a second time and air fried it at 350 for 22 minutes, it got crispy but not as crispy as the first time.

I’ve also made roasted potatoes at the suggested time and temperature and they came out borderline burnt.

Update 10/22/19
I did Shake & Bake chicken to chicken legs. I prepared them just like I would for in the the oven (just shaked it and then baked it - no oil added and the skin was removed). I set the temperature to 390 degrees for 22 minutes using the little reference chart pasted on the airfryer. When it was done it was a little over cooked but the drumsticks were crispy and still a little juicy. I think 20 minutes would have been perfect.

Overall I love how fast food cooks in this but i think the temperatures suggested in the book might be too high or the timing is too long. So you have to be careful and check on your food at least 4 minutes before the end time to check its not getting burnt yet. Also, smelling the chicken cook in an air fryer is not the most fragrant smell I want in my kitchen - it just smells raw BUT tastes the opposite which is good.

Update 10/25/19
I'm starting to wonder if my machine is too powerful. Because it cooks stuff a lot faster than the suggested time for the temp that's in the book. I did brussel sprouts and the suggested time is 15 minutes at 390 degrees. When I passed it halfway through to shake up the brussels, they were already burnt. I had to take them out immediately.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ninja Air fryer was a great deal to choose
reviews.reviewText: I have did many research and decided to take a try with a Ninja Air Fryer. Now after a few weeks of using, I think I have made a very good choice because of the size is fit for my 5 members family, easy to use and clean with instruction including, I strongly recommended to follow the instructions for the first use because it would have a plastic smell, we should wash it carefully following the instruction and use it for outdoor in a few times before using it indoor. I did make the fryer and it is very delicious, especially the grilled chicken is very impressive taste !

I can’t believe how much I use this thing. Before I go and cook anything I first think “could I do this in the air fryer?” I use it almost daily. From frozen food (tater tots), to chicken breast/legs, to sliced mushrooms, and fresh green beans (they get a little charred!), everything get a little crispy in this air fryer. It’s a bit small but there are only 3 if us in the house so it works for us. Often I make meals where I want to cook both entree and sides in it so I’ve even thought about getting two! When I first took it out there was a hint of plastic smell. I removed the plastic feet from the elevated insert tray and threw them out. No more smell or hot plastic to leak toxins. I use that insert for everything. Helps the air circulate and crisp everything. I tend to flip everything once, and for something like tater tots or mushrooms I take it out and toss around a couple of times while cooking. Highly recommend.

A few years ago I bought an Emeril for myself for Christmas. It. Changed. My. Life. I LOVED it so much, y'all almost seen me on one of those TLC shows like "my strange addiction." When Emeril's basket started to rust and no longer be cleanable, my heart was broken. I was telling my boss about it and the next day he said he decided to buy the new ninja air fryer because I loved my Emeril so much. He gave raving reviews so I decided to just purchase a new Ninja instead of trying to get a replacement basket.
I got the Ninja and all was well. There's a bit of a break in period because Emeril cooked way differently than Ninja and they both have slightly different settings. The Ninja cooks great, makes the perfect roasted garlic cloves, and is easy to wash. BUT I miss Em. In the two years of owning him, he never once burnt me. He had an awesome detachable basket fo easy handling. All I had to do was put food in, remove the basket and dump the dinner on the plate. Ninja on the other hand.... Ninja has burnt me 4 separate times since he arrived. You remove the entire cooking thing and then have to use tongs or something to get the food out. That's not super awesome when you make things like brussel sprouts. SMH if Ninja redesigned this to be more functional and less burny, I would recommend it to others as well as purchase other products. For now though, I'm pretty disappointed that I gave up Emeril for this.

I don’t know if this thing does 90% of what it claims but it’s a hell of a chicken nugget maker. Do yourself a favor and go to Home Depot, in the paint section they have a wire brush for two dollars, get that to clean the grill basket. Inserting and removing the grill basket is kind of like a fun game of operation where you can burn your hands if you don’t have the nerves of a drug mule going through TSA carrying a kilo in his prison wallet.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cooler kitchen in summer with this Ninja!
reviews.reviewText: Have had my Ninja just a bit over 2 months now. I love it. I use it several times a week. Joining an Air Fryer group on Facebook gave me the courage (and recipes) to try new things in it. The 4 quart size is just right for me since it's just my husband me in the household. It gets really hot in the summer where I live, so I have been happy to not have to turn on my big oven and heat up the house for meals. Still trying new things in it, but have not been disappointed so far.

I am in a wheelchair and could not reach the buttons on my stove, so I could not use the Oven. Also I have the tremors and so frying with hot grease was dangerous for me. I got this hot air fryer and I am amazed by the cooking quality. It is easy for me to reach all of the control buttons, I am able to fry food with out using oils. I will be able to bake all the things that I want now.
I wanted to update this review. I have fried chicken, baked a potato, steamed brussels sprouts karma and I am looking at making my special macaroni and cheese I am still so in love with this appliance.
I am 60 years old and all of my children are grown so I am by myself small meals are difficult for me as I was cooking for a large family. With this air fryer I am able to cook small amounts for just myself to consume and it is hot and fresh , Not out of the freezer. I rarely use my microwave anymore and have not yet used my kitchen stove

The fryer is really big but doesn't have much capacity. Cooked the food OK but our convention oven works just as good. Fish is just OK - grilling is much better and cleanup is easier. I think this would be OK for apartment dwellers.

Oh my, do not hesitate to buy this!! Excellent for frying bacon. Outstanding cooking any frozen Schwan's food, their French fries, chicken tenders etc. No grease splatters to clean up on oven. No grease to throw away. This Southen girl is "going to her trailer and frying something". Joking because I now live in MN!! Seriously, best purchase in years.

I do love this new appliance. I make all kinds of stuff in it now. I rarely even use my stove/oven OR microwave. The only downside to this is it has made it easier for me to eat fried foods which i would never bothered with before. That isnt a negative to the functionality of the machine but just to my diet. LOL Everything comes out crispy and it is so fast! You do need to turn on your vent hood or your entire house will be smelly but otherwise, it is awesome! Love the color too, it is more of a grey then all black which compliments my slate appliances.

This is a great product. We bave tried cooking many different types of food in it with great success. I have always been a Ninja fan due to they're reliability and quality of products and this one is no different. I highly recommend it. It is an awesome air fryer.

My wife travel for a living staying in hotels 365 days a year. As you can imagine it is very hard to eat a healthy meal. We have been on a low carb diet and with the air fryer it makes cooking low carb meals fast and convenient. We keep it in a rolling duffel bag along with the spices we like and other thing you would need for cooking and cleaning up. We have never had a problem with it causing any smoke from the exhaust vent or tripping the breaker in the hotel room.

reviews.reviewTitle: so easy to use and clean, great addition if you love to cook
reviews.reviewText: this thing is so stinking easy to use and it works great. I probably gained 10 pounds trying every single frozen junk food/appetizer I could find and cooking them in this air fryer was a total game changer. but it also does an amazing job with homemade items, and keeps them lighter! fries, wings, tenders made from scratch are amazing in this little guy. I wish it was a little bigger, and if you're feeding a family I would go larger, but for two people it's pretty perfect. plus it couldn't be easier to clean. it has a permanent spot on the kitchen counter!

I had been researching air fryers for quite some time and I wanted to buy one that was decently priced, but had a well-known brand backing it. The Ninja seemed like the perfect fit and it was! It is stylish for keeping out on the counter, easy to clean, both the inside and outside, and the food I have made so far has been amazing! I have made chicken parmesan, brussel sprouts and homemade french fries and all have been better than expected. I highly recommend!
The product itself is so pretty. It’s easy to use, clean 🧽, and food turned out really delicious. So glad i got it

reviews.reviewTitle: basket doesn't fit- heat leaking out
reviews.reviewText: I never take time to write a review- but I am so you can move on to a different product. The basket does not "snap" closed. Therefore there is not a seal- there is a gap on both sides where the basket sits and heat is spilling out. Also the smell of burning plastic can not be healthy. I will not bother with another- I'm sticking to the tried and true oven.

Can’t say enough nice things about this product. It has changed the way we cook many things. Very pleased.

8/3 roasted our first meatloaf. Came out perfect. Shape meatloaf to a round bun shape to fit the pan. I air roasted @ 325 degrees for about 15 minutes then topped it off with a ketchup/brown sugar mixture and roasted another 10 minutes until internal temp reached 150 F. Came out delicious with a nice crust. Family loved it.

Last week I air roasted potates that were peeled and cut into French fries. Soak them for about 30 minutes in ice water. Drain, wipe dry with a paper towel and put in a bowl. Pour some oil (I used olive oil) in and toss potatoes until well coated. Preheat oven for about 7 min. @ 375F, then toss in fries with a pinch of salt and air roast @ 350-375F for about 10 minutes. Remove pan, shake it a bit to mix up fries and roast for another 10-15 minutes until desired color. Perfect!

Tonight I am making the family roasted salmon filets. I will write how they turn out. Jack

My family uses the air fryer so much that I hardly ever use the oven anymore. We originally had another air fryer from a different brand, which we loved, but one day the fryer stopped working (we assumed it’s cuz we used it SO much). So we decided to get a bigger air fryer and stumbled on the Ninja. We got it because of the size and because Amazon was having a great $30 off price on it.

We were BLOWN away with how much better this air fryer was compared to our last! It’s just a better piece of equipment! Quieter, cooks so much faster, easier to clean. Ive been trying to spread the word on air dryers to my family and friends before, but now I’ve been recommending this brand to everyone!

This is a great buy! I've been making everything in this from frozen foods, salmon, sweet potato fries and even a whole roasted chicken! Everything comes out pretty good and fast! It's really really easy to use and easy to clean!

I was hesitant to get an air fryer because people on the Internet are suspiciously vague as to why they like their air fryers so much. After all, I've heard often that air fryers are basically just tiny convection ovens. Decided to try it anyway because nobody is ranting and raving about convection ovens.
As it turns out, this thing can actually make all kinds of stuff and I've really been enjoying it. Fries/roasted potatoes have been really good solely because of the smaller wait time, but I've also made mini hamburgers, roasted veggies, reheated pizza, crispy tofu (which was unexpectedly REALLY good because I've never been able to get it that crispy without a coating before) and last night I decided to throw in some frozen gyoza and pizza rolls as a late night snack. All of it has turned out great. I haven't used my oven in weeks.
Cleaning couldn't be easier. The only thing getting in the way of you cleaning it after every use is being lazy.

Overall I'm definitely satisfied. Worth the counter space for me.

I was nervous about purchasing an air fryer after reading the mix of good and bad reviews on so many of them. I finally went with the Ninja (slightly more expensive than some of the other ones) and am so happy. The food is wonderful and feels so much lighter than most fried foods. Its easy to use and there aren't any complicated instructions and it is extremely user friendly. No peeling of the non-stick coating as some people have noted with other air fryers. It's very easy to clean as well. I would highly recommend if you're looking for a user-friendly air fryer.

I purchased this air fryer after another brand I had for a year failed out of warranty. I won't mention it so people don't think I am promoting or have a negative agenda toward any product.
Compared to that other fryer, this unit is much louder. Some compare the Ninja to a microwave oven. Here are my sound readings in decibels. This is for comparison only as my sound meter has not been calibrated.
From five ft.
Small/Medium microwave: 58 db (about the sound of people talking).
Ninja: 66 db (about the sound of a vacuum in an adjacent room).
What is the difference? I'll not go into the physics of sound and energy, but for every 3 db difference, there is a substantial increase in perceived sound. My subjective impression is the Ninja is about twice as loud as my microwave 3x that of my previous air fryer.
I'd be interested in the most reliable and usable air fryer that is also the quietest.

I super duper love my air fryer! I have had it for weeks now, and use it about 5 days a week! Chicken thighs are my favorite - the skin is SO crispy! I also cook chicken breasts, and fish (tipalia breaded with pork rinds is my new fav!), and green bean fries (green beans dipped in egg and pork rinds, or just oil and pork rinds). YUMMY.
