I researched these for a LONG time. I am so so happy with this one - it is really easy to clean. I kind of wish it was a little bigger, but I knew the size before I ordered it. I can fit 4 chicken thighs, or 2 butterflied chicken breasts. Highly recommend!

I've had this for about 3 months, and I kind of love it. Obviously it's great for frozen fried foods, I've done several things in it, I just caution you to watch anything that has cheese it as the cheese will cook out of the item. I use frozen broccoli and put a little garlic butter on it before putting it in the fryer, that is wonderful. Cleanup is easy I just run hot water and dish soap in the basket let it sit a bit and wash it out. NOT when it's hot tho wait for it to cool down before you put water in it. Chicken wings, pork belly, salmon all came out wonderful.

reviews.reviewTitle: Says what it does, does what it says.
reviews.reviewText:
I had a different model that didn't work as expected. Bought this one and love it. It crisps well and is very easy to clean because there is no inner "basket", just pull the crisper plate out and soak it while eating. It cleans as easy as a dinner plate.

The only things I don't care for as much is wishing it had a bit more capacity and remembering to push the pause button before removing the "basket" if there is still time on the timer. If not, the unit continues to run. Just a slight matter of getting used to it. If I had to do it again, I'd buy the same model.

I love my Air fryer. It's easy to use. Meat/veggies come out crisp on outside, juicy on inside. It cleans up like a breeze. The ceramic coating makes this so!
My one critic is that you have to preheat for 3 minutes. There should be a preheat button, as it's not an effortless thing to set 3 minutes. I called Ninja customer service and the tech said she just adds 3 extra minutes on when she sets the timer to cook......that's a fix but not great, as I like when it beeps to tell me the preheated 3minutes is done........
OTHERWISE, I love the system!

I was a skeptic with all the hype over air fryers, thinking ok for french fries and thats about it. Ninja is a well made product as I have several, and this stands up to it. Amazing chicken, fish, roasted veggies, but I use it a lot for reheating - nearly as fast as the micro wave, but no more rubbery steamed food! It comes out as good as it was made, heated with HEAT not radio waves. Wish the basket was bigger, but perfect for 1-2 servings of stuff. I even eat zucchini now - toss with olive oil and some smoked paprika, comes out lightly browned firm but juicy inside. Can't wait to try more, anyone have an idea for the best cookbook?

reviews.reviewTitle: Hard to get items cooked how we want
reviews.reviewText: Works. We have struggled to find the best amount of time to cook things. We follow the recipe books and look online but still cannot seem to get things how we want them. A lot of our chicken comes out on the verge of being jerky. Wish it was a bit easier to clean. I tend to use use the toaster oven that I have instead. Not thrilled with it.

This surpassed my expectations by miles. I didn't realize it could roast, reheat, and dehydrate, too. Yeah, it says that in the description, but I was so focused on air fryer that I failed the notice the other functions. Almost all the pieces are machine washable, but they're easy to wash by hand, too. It also came with great manuals for both caring for the machine and a practical table of information for cooking a lot of different foods. It was a lot easier to use than I expected and the other functions (especially roast) make it an extremely useful addition to the kitchen.

I have owned several deep fryers over the years, but they always wind up being a real hassle to keep clean. I picked this up to replace the deep fryer I recently got rid of, as it had old grease caked on it that no amount of scrubbing could remove. This is my first air fryer, so I wasn't 100% sure what to expect, but I am rather pleased with this unit. I find that it often takes a little bit longer to cook my food that it would have in my deep fryer. Without cooking in oil the flavor is noticeably different compared to my old deep-fryer, though not so much that I don't enjoy the food. Say what you will, but I definitely prefer my food fried in oil... those trans-fats might not be good for your body but DAMN do they taste good!

reviews.reviewTitle: Wish I would have bought this a long time ago!
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love my air fryer! It has been super easy to use and the food has been exactly as I expected. It has a crispness to it just as if I fried it but better because it’s not saturated in oil! I’ve only had it for three days and I have already used it multiple times. My husband says I’m going to wear it out in a year. HA! He has been very pleased with the food as well. It’s super easy to clean. I have zero complaints!

reviews.reviewTitle: oh my goodness this Ninja air flyer is the best i ever used..
reviews.reviewText: this air flyer works so good until i find myself wanting to air fry something to eat .its easy to use, its easy to clean..only i have to soak that lil riack some that comes with this air fryer, and i have to use this air fryer in a open space of the heat when cooking this air fryer but otherwise, i love using this air fryer.. it cooks fast and food tastes so delicious until my kids thought my air fried chicken wings was from a fast food place.. so yes to this air fryer. tomorrow im air frying battered coated fish..

I am a bachelor therefore I cook mainly for myself.

I believe the air fryer is an excellent way to avoid heating the house up, and it works fine for me because I only need a small portion.

However, if you expect to cook for an entire family, I would suggest that you should buy a convection oven.

Additionally, you are not going to be frying much bacon in an air fryer. The space is very limited. Like I mentioned, though, I don't really need that much food capacity.

I would suggest that you buy the round parchment paper to line the bottom of the air fryer. It makes cleanup a lot easier. This parchment paper is available on Amazon.com.

Okay so I am a diabetic, so I have to watch my sugar intake and oily food intake.
This sure helps in that. I use this all the time to fry my tater tots, fried chicken
dehydrate fruit.. I like using it....

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent investment - another GREAT Ninja product!
reviews.reviewText: Love this unit! Our family loves fried foods but not all the grease. This air fryer has been the perfect solution. We are a family of nine, and I can usually do things in 2-3 batches fairly quickly. We mostly use this for tater tots, chicken fingers, wontons, etc. Great for reheating these types of foods, too.

My husband broke my previous air fryer that I had for about 5 years. Based upon reviews on Amazon and Consumer Reports I decided to go with the Ninja Air Fryer brand. Absolutely love the way this air fryer cooks and its way easier to clean than my last air fryer. My only con is that there is no pre-heat button?? The instructions just say that the temperature desired will normally take 3 minutes, so I normally just let the air fryer heat up for about 3 minutes before I put my food in.

It worked exactly as it was sold as. Cooking with this is quick and easy! The food comes out in the same quality as a restaurant without the greasy oil or tons of pans. Cooking simple frozen snacks in it is when the product comes in handy the most. The only downside is the tray is not really that big. You can only fit about 3 hashbrown patties inside the airfryer without stacking them ontop of each other. But they will cook to the same crispy level as mcdonalds only without the oil! Great buy
Horrible chemical smell comimg from the air fryer every time I use it. I have cleaned it multiple times and I can't get rid of the smell

I was hesitant to keep it due to little space in my kitchen and I am so glad I did. I have been using it daily for about a month, mainly with frozen food. I have made frozen chicken, flounder, fries, veggie burgers. Everything comes out perfect. Used ti also for Goya frozen products like croquettes, empanadas, tostones. The croquettes in the convection oven used to burst open and I ended up with a puree instead of a croquette, with the Air Fryer they came out crispy and well cooked inside. I have not been so happy with a product in a long time. Now, I just need to try to eat a little healthier and cut down on pre-made foods.

ive been wanting an air fryer forever now but hesitant due to price. i have seen videos on youtube. Ninja is one of my favorite brand. i have a blender from Ninja and its one of the best blenders I have ever owned. so I trust their name. let me tell you... i am soooooo happy I finally invested in this. i am currently cooking drumsticks and its smelling and looking soooooo good and crispy. in under 20 minutes-!!!!!!! no oven or oil needed-!!!! wow.... i kick myself for not plunging in sooner. loving this and would recommend to my friends and family

reviews.reviewTitle: Fell it love, then it broke after 8 months, but got another one.
reviews.reviewText: I love my air fryer, my daughter's and I use it more than our oven. Unfortunately eight months after purchasing it the unit stopped heating. No worries it's covered by the one-year warranty right? Sort of. I called Ninja and spoke with a cs rep who acted like I was bothering her. She told me that they would send me a new unit, just the main unit, not the whole thing which was fine. I asked her if the one-year warranty on this unit would start from the time I receive it and she said "no, it will end in January just as the old broken unit would have" Seriously??? I asked if it was a new unit or refurbished and she said it was brand new. Then I was charged $21 to ship it to me. I called back a couple of days later because that didn't sound right. I was told I was charged because I didn't buy it directly from them, I bought it from Amazon. Not impressed with their customer service. I hope the new unit last longer.

I was really skeptical about air fryers ... waited until now to get one and wow i’m glad i did. First thing I did was fresh chicken wings, 390° for 22 mins and I would swear that they were deep-fried at a restaurant after I tasted them. Amazing!! I can’t wait to experiment and throw all kinds of weird stuff in this thing.

If you are on the fence, get one !! Not even my convection toaster oven can get things this crispy and delicious.

So I use my airfryer very often, and I love it. I bought this one because it was cheaper and I just wanted a smaller investment to see if I liked it, which I still recommend. Since I do like it, I wish I had a bigger air fryer. Its a good size for making things for 2 people, but you'll be cooking twice for more people. Also of note, the screw heads inside the container scrape off my knuckles frequently when I wash it by hand. Easy to wash otherwise, but I wish they would have done something to cover these.

For the longest time, I couldn't understand why everyone was talking about their air fryer. I had an oven and microwave so I saw no use spending my money on a product that would not be used. I finally broke down and purchased this product after reading numerous reviews. Oh my goodness. My daughter and I use our air fryer almost everyday. I've cooked everything from fries to fresh salmon. Cooks fast and doesn't dry out food. My adult daughter who could only cook ramen noodles, uses this and loves it:-) Very user friendly...

reviews.reviewTitle: Only good for 2 servings for a lot of recipes. Does not taste like true fried food.
reviews.reviewText:
Taste: My wife and I bought an air fryer because a lot of people told us they made great fried food without the calories. Most reviews rave about the taste. The taste, to us, is not the same as true fried food. It's ok, but it does not have that true fried taste. For example, I tried several different recipes for fried chicken, wings, and french fries. None tasted great, but were just ok. So, if you want true fries food taste, you won't get it with the air fryer. However, if you want to reduce caloric intake and can tolerate a bit of a different flavor, it might work for you. Also, in order to get the closest fried food taste and texture the pieces cannot touch each other. We could only fry 1 small chicken breast, thigh, and leg at a time. So, if you have more than 2 people to feed at the same time, it won't work. Also, you need to cook french fries in small batches. We could only cook 4 wings at a time, too. That includes removing the tips. Finally it takes a full half hour to make one batch of french fries. With our fry daddy, we could easily make 4 batches in the same amount of time.

Ease of use: It is easy to use, but most recipes require turning over the food to cook evenly. There is not a need to do that with a deep fryer, thus a 4 not a 5.

Cleaning: although it is a lot easier to clean than a deep fryer, you must clean some of by hand. IOW it is not entirely dish washer friendly.

I suggest having a friend or family member make you something your very interested in trying before you buy. (sound like a party :)

I didn't know how often I would use this when I bought it. Out of 2 weeks, I have used it 10 times! I love this product! I have been able to perfect chicken wings! I love them better than any restaurant's wings! I am now able to cook pork chops without drying them out! Even did baked apples that were delicious. I LOVE this product.

I love this air fryer! Can’t believe I went without one all these years. I have bought 3 different ones in the last 2 months. Not sure why but this fryer gives food such a great taste. Have absolutely loved everything I have cooked. This is used everyday with a home of 3 people. Every item cooked is exciting when it comes out so delicious 😋 I have always made pork chops dipped in flour and fried. This fryer makes pork chops so perfect. Comes out moist and crunchy on the outside. I actually think it is far better than fried. I could write a book how excited I am on this new find. Lol.

reviews.reviewTitle: They buy this from Walmart for cheap and send it to you.
reviews.reviewText: Came two weeks early, which was great. It’s a little noisy, and the interface isn’t super user friendly. You can’t just set it to preheat, a timer automatically comes on.
Love this thing. Only issue Is it doesn’t save on the calories, as I eat twice as many fries now that they’re easy to make and doesn’t make my kitchen smell like oil
Exelecte freidora de aire solo como recomendación usar menos tiempo que el manual dice por todo lo demás perfecto

I have no complaints other than I wish I could see the food but that is my issue not the units. So far I am very happy although I have to get used to specific cooking times and just do a lot of test cooking. It is a heck of a lot easier than dealing with all the other prep needed with other baked / fried foods. Worth it, yes and also even though I love fried foods but my stomach cannot handle the grease this worked great.

reviews.reviewTitle: Having fun experiencing with this new kitchen toy!
reviews.reviewText:
We love our new air fryer and use it daily, especially for dehydrating. It's great for summer cooking in the South where I want to heat up my kitchen as little as possible. Most things I would roast or bake go right in the air fryer instead, conserving energy and cooking much quicker. We even ditched our toaster oven and gave up its counter space to the air fryer! Everything gets crisp but do watch it closely because stuff can burn if you let it go too long.

My one complaint is what I think is a design flaw. The basket which goes inside the drawer and holds the food has some larger vents and holes and smaller foods fall through, like okra and small chilies. Also, the handle for lifting it out is tiny, in the center, and needs tongs to get it out. This makes it hard to dump out the hot food in the basket without oil drippings from the bottom falling out too. This hasn't kept us from using it, however, and we just keep a pair of silicone tipped tongs and a hot pad next to the fryer for serving the food. The ceramic coating is easy to clean.

I really wanted an air fryer to make quick meals, especially meals I can't order at restaurants due to food intolerances. I must admit I bought it on a whim on prime day without doing much research. A lot of food falls below the basket including large fries (I'm not even sure how it happens). Even using the instruction manual for temperature and cooking time length much of my food has come out burnt in a shorter amoubt of time or it's taken much longer than expected. I'm still working out the kinks on what to use it for, but I think better options are out there.

I was skeptical as to how much I would like and really use this appliance; well......I use it almost EVERY DAY!!!! Oh my gosh! I have never had anything make my life so much easier when it comes to cooking!!! I make my dogs chicken, and it only takes about 10 minutes to come out perfectly!!! No flipping chicken in a pan! I use my meat thermometer to make sure the chicken breast are really done, and they always are! I LOVE LOVE LOVE this air frier!!!!!!!

Let's get this out of the way: I'm a married dude in my 30s with my culinary skills consisting of sandwiches, microwave and simple stove top stuff. So for me, this product is perfect and has in fact become my favorite appliance. The food just tastes so much better in the air fryer. Food is crisp, not greasy, and the damn thing is as easy to use as a microwave.

Cleanup is simple with just a quick wash of the cooking container and wiping out the inside when you're done using it.

If you are like me, you will love this thing.

Everyone that doesn't have time to cook should buy this! I can't believe how easy it was to fry chicken thighs! 4 beautiful bone-in thighs fried to a beautiful golden brown crisp outside, tender and juicy inside in just 20-22 minutes! With just seasoning the outside of the chicken, rubbing/brushing with a little oil they turned out amazing! I'm totally hooked. Healthier cooking fast! I'm over-the-moon!

I don’t have much time , often too tried to cook but always feel guilty of eating unhealthy food. This air fryer is a life saver, it solves all of the above problems.
Now my no brainer dinner cooking after work is a 7 mins of healthy yummy salmon!

I wash the salmon fillet, pat it dry, then spray slightly of olive oil and rub them throughout the fish. After that sprinkle some sea salt, pepper and paprika on both side. Don't forget to spray some olive oil on the skillet, then place the fish on top of it. Close the basket and turn the heat up to 390 degree + 7 min. Voila! Juicy salmon! Don't let the picture fool you, the salmon is really moist+soft inside!!
Along with the salmon, I always add some vegetables while air frying the salmon, also 7 min ;)

Cons: the machine is way bigger than i thought and if you are cooking for two hungry people, then its usually a two rounds of cooking.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bought for my son for birthday
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my son for his birthday. He loves it. I can't provide a lot of details since I haven't used it personally but he did send me a picture of his wings and french fries. I was impressed. (Excuse the side chicken bone. I don't think he thought I'd send this in a review).

I wasn't sure about purchasing an air fryer but it has turned out to be a fun addition. Chicken, potatoes, kale chips, tofu, lamb, and more come out with a light crispness (if coated for the meats) while moist on the inside. I've baked pastry in it and that came out great too. I chose this particular air fryer because of the size and non-stick coating. Reviewers seem to have had problems with the coating on some other brands but the Ninja has performed well.

reviews.reviewTitle: You Need an Air Fryer in Your Life! A+++
reviews.reviewText: This is by far the best thing I bought this year. It’s so easy to use, clean, and you can cook all your favorites super fast. It’s dishwasher safe, which is a huge plus and makes clean up easy, one thing I hate about my croc pot which needs to be hand washed. So far I’ve made chicken wings (best my boyfriend has ever had), chicken legs, brussel sprouts, shrimp and tonight I made salmon. The salmon was so juicy but had the charbroiled crispy taste on the edges. I only had to cook it for 15 minutes. For those that work full time jobs, it makes cooking dinner that much easier. I read several reviews on different air flyers and this seemed to have the most positive reviews. A few users complained about the smell of plastic which I never experienced. I made sure to run it through the dishwasher before it’s first use. If you’ve been debating about an air fryer, then now is the time to give in and purchase one. You won’t regret it. I find myself using this more than my croc port now.

Can’t believe I haven’t written this review yet.. I sound like every other air fry snob out there but this has changed my kitchen and clean up game. I personally don’t eat meat. But I cook a hell of a lot of it. Bacon is a breeze, chicken wings, pot roasts, French fries, vegetables. You name. Everything that goes in comes out fresh and amazing! To die for

reviews.reviewTitle: I Think of it as a Mini-Convection Oven
reviews.reviewText: I'm still figuring out what uses this excels at. I am not convinced it is any kind of "fryer.' On the other hand, as a mini-convection oven, it is really convenient - fast to pre-heat and really quick and easy to clean. Bags of frozen fires (TJ's simple ones) were disappointing compared to tossing them in oil and baking on a cookie sheet in the oven. On the other hand, i was very happy with burgers i cooked in it and with chicken I browned quickly and, then, cooked in it. I think I will find more uses for it, but it is not a "gotta have" for me, although the convenience, as mentioned is great.

I have used this to make chicken nuggets and waffle fries WAAAYYY too many times. You will never want oven baked or microwaved again. Also have made jerky with it -- works awesome for that as well. Can cook a whole lot in here, I've barely scratched the surface and I already love it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty good Chicken Wings vs an oil fryer
reviews.reviewText:
The little booklet that comes with it is pretty good with cook times. I've noticed preheating seems to help the cook a lot more.

A few years ago I wanted to get a fryer to make chicken wings. I ended up getting an oil fryer, and had been using that to make wings, it was amazing. Just made chicken wings with this air fryer, it was surprisingly good. I tossed them in oil, and cooked for the time it said in the booklet (I think 390 for 22minutes?). So my point is, this makes pretty good wings, I don't know if I'm sold on this over the oil fryer for that, but if you don't know the difference then I'd say get the air fryer.

Love all the features of this air fryer. Love Ninja products. Really like the dehydrator option and the fact there are
no vents in the cooking basket to leave a greasy mess to clean up.
Works perfectly. I can eat fried chicken without a single drop of oil. It's super easy to use, literally 1 or 2 clicks to roast, or air-fry whatever you want. I just love it.

Once you get the hang of the recipe adjustments you'll need to make, this thing is amazing!! Super easy to use and clean. Make sure you clean inside, up by the heating element against oils, etc. Also make sure you operate this near a vent or something as certain items (wings, meatballs, etc.) will pump smoke out the back. Not crazy smoke but still. Definitely recommend. And yes, i said wings and meatballs... They come out amazingly! Wings crisp and other things fully cooked and delicious! Chicken nuggets for the kids went from taking ~20 min with oven preheat down to 7!!!!!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice for certain kinds of food
reviews.reviewText: We've had fun trying different things in the air fryer. Does french fries really good. Some foods, like bread crumb coated chicken come out dry and lack that "mouth feel." Comes with a basic cookbook that won't be enough for you. Other cookbooks and recipes are all over the place in terms of time and temperature. Plan on experimenting.
Where has this been all my life? I didn’t believe the hype, but trust me... it is incredible! Easy to use, simple operation and instructions, food cooks evening and crispy. WORTH EVERY PENNY!

reviews.reviewTitle: Burns Food on Top, Leaves Food Raw on Bottom
reviews.reviewText:
DISCLAIMER: Mine may have been defective from the beginning.

Eitherway, I followed the recipes given in the "quickstart guide" and they all turned out burnt on top and raw on the bottom.

Also, this isn't a "Set and Forget" device like an Instant Pot. The recipes tell you to set the time for 20 minutes but to return back and "shake" the contents for best quality. Even when I would flip my food over completely it would still end up raw on bottom and burnt on top.

In short, either this is not worth the $106 after tax, or it really was a defective item.

On the otherhand, It was in fact super easy to clean and easy to use (to get burnt/raw food) but easy enough controls. The flavor... well... that's a moot point on a fryer as that depends on the oil and seasonings, etc.

This is a great alternative to deep frying your foods. Of course most foods don't taste exactly like they've been deep fried but the healthy aspect of it far outweighs the difference imo. Plus you don't have to wait around for your little deep fryer to heat up as long either. This unit heats up quickly so you really don't have to do any preheating if you don't want to. Only draw back, like a few others have noted on here, is that I wish the basket was a little bigger so it could cook a little more food at once when I want to.

Love this air fryer. I use it to roast vegetables, make dried fruit snacks, reheat fried chicken left overs even pizza, and I’ve air fried wings and fries. Everything comes out great. Love it is so versatile and 1 machine. You do need to check in between roasting and air frying it cooks fast and time recommendations maybe too long. I’ve had mine almost a year and now familiar with the times I need. Usually roasts veggies within about 15 mins. Basket is large, plenty of food for my family of 3. Easy to clean after each use.
GOT THE WRONG ONE. NOT WHAT MY GRANDSON WANTED,

A crockpot, a toaster, a fryer, an oven? It's a combo of all the bests, but with less prep, less cooking time, and less of a mess. My favorite thing to make using this is any kind of chicken... crispy outside, juicy inside, but completely cooked, even the thickest of pieces. Very easy to use and dishwasher safe makes it easy for everyone to use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Frying Without The Oil Splatter. And Easy To Clean
reviews.reviewText: Super impressed very quiet easy to use, easy to clean, the meat was tender and juicy. Will recommend to anybody how is looking for a good healthy way to fry food with out the oil. Cook four pieces of chicken in 30 minutes, recommend time was 26 minutes but I want it extra crispy, they were nice and crispy in the outside and tender and juicy in the inside. Thank you to my daughter who recommended this Machine.

This is an awesome unit- built better than a lot of its competitors. Takes some practice to get used to it- but we now use this 4-5 times per week. Wings/fries/onion rings- all come out quick and awesome. Cornish Game Hen cooked up in 30 minutes ! Still working on the "fried chicken " thing- but its still way healthier than deep fried.

reviews.reviewTitle: Covection oven better use of space
reviews.reviewText: Disappointing that the word 'refurbushed' wasn't mentioned in title & hard to find in the large amount of verbiage (this is more ding on Amazon than Ninja). Have only used in to heat fish sticks but think will be OK. Takes up a lot of counter space and I really unnecessary if you already have a convection oven. Still better than a full sized oven if you live in a small apt.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best Air Fryer out there for the money!
reviews.reviewText:
I love this air fryer! It does not smell like others do. Maybe the Phillips is better, but it is too costly.
This one works great! I tried 2 other types but had to return due to breakage, and other problems, like making your food taste like chemicals (plastic melting or something else).
I highly recommend this. The Customer Service for this sucks though. They are really bad. But, I think you will not need them as this work great. I did have a small problem with the frying plate,but got it taken card of using Amazon.

Fire Hazard??

I was impressed by this air fryer and used it every day. Yesterday I made bacon in this air fryer, smoke poured out while cooking! Also, there was burning smell from the unit. I'm sure something inside was burned up. Now I'm afraid to continue using it for fear of it catching fire!

reviews.reviewTitle: easy to use, easy clean up
reviews.reviewText:
We're currently loving this air fryer. This is the second brand we've tried and compared to the other, it feels like the food cooks quicker in this one. We also love that the parts are dishwasher safe, it makes clean up a breeze. We also don't need to worry about the coating chipping off or rusting.

If you're searching for an air fryer, try this one out. I will say that one thing to note is that it is a little loud, but all air fryers make noise due to the fan. Definitely would recommend.

This machine works pretty well and is simple to use, heat up, and clean.
It does have a limited capacity, so its good for about 2 people. Or 3-4 people if you do more batches and want to wait more time (not ideal). It's also somewhat bulky, so good if you have extra kitchen storage, since its not the most pretty machine to have laying around.

We noticed the cooking times were a lot less than the manufacturers recommendations, so check on your food periodically, depending on how big it is and how cooked you prefer, then adjust from there. We did chicken wings (came our very crispy) and halibut chunks (moist; don't overcook).

Started with a cheaper small model (different brand) and after several months of use - the inside basket started to flake. I replaced with this Ninja and LOVE LOVE LOVE it. Love how the grate/insert fits in snugly with silicon (?) rubber feet. Easy to clean. Great results. Like that you can adjust the temp easily. I want to try the dehydrate options, but the air frying and reheating has been awesome. So happy I was able to snag this during a sale.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best Air Fryer On The Market Right Now
reviews.reviewText: I've purchased a total of 3 of these air fryers (two were gifts for friends). I my previous air fryer, that was another brand, had visible rust on the removable grill. However, the Ninja doesn't have that problem even after multiple uses in the dishwasher. It is a bit smaller (cooking area) than my previous one but the overall quality of the Ninja Air Fryer more than makes up for it. Long story made short. If you are in the market for an air fryer, you won't find a better one than this one.

reviews.reviewTitle: Use it more than I thought I would
reviews.reviewText:
I ordered this on impulse one morning because Amazon had it on sale. I love my Ninja blender/food processor combo and when I saw this brand on sale I felt I could trust it, as there are a plethora of air fryers out there. Keep in mind I had never used one before, did no research and had no expectations. I read the instructions, looked up some recipes and came to the conclusion I just needed to jump in and try some things based on what I read. I follow the Trim Healthy Mama lifestyle (avoiding wheat flour when possible) so I substituted some other flours. So far I have been pleased and found that I use it about once or twice a week. There are just two of us to cook for, but when the grandchildren visited I threw in some fries, some fish sticks, some chicken nuggets (both pre-made and made from scratch) and they came out great. Anything pre-frozen, like fried okra or sweet potato fries would come out nicely and quickly. However, since I am more of a whole foods kinda girl, I am experimenting with my own, from scratch, foods.
So far squash does well and green beans not so good. The basket is adequate for 2 people, and the air fryer a bit large for a countertop appliance but I keep it in the pantry and just take it out when I need it. Another thing I like about it -it is sooo easy to clean. I can have it cleaned up and back in the pantry in less than 2 minutes. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because I have never tried any other one so I have nothing to compare it to. I have no regrets on this impulse buy!
The ninja air fryer I bought gives off an electrical smell after using two times! I read other reviews and find that there are so many such issues. Read before you buy! Try another brand.

reviews.reviewTitle: Multi-function appliance you never thought you needed
reviews.reviewText: Just like the InstantPot, you can use this for many types of cooking. It’s basically a small, powerful oven. The wide range of temperature settings sets this device apart from other air fryers, with the lower range used for dehydrating. The different programmed settings basically differ with fan speed. The device has a relatively small footprint with a spacious basket available to use. It easily fits my 7” baking pan for cakes and lasagna. I am quite satisfied and highly recommend this for anyone interested in cooking, especially if you have a limited counter space.

I am replacing another brand of air fryer, I bought 3-4 yrs. ago. This is my third Ninja product. Each is superior to all other brands. My new air fryer is superb, especially compared to my old Luxor brand. Ninja products exceed all my expectations. The only possible downside is Ninja’s customer service, which leaves much to be desired.
This is ceramic coated, dishwasher safe, much lighter drawer, many options, instead on just air fry. It is noisy, but a small concession to pay.

I have had this a week now and have used it every day and several days multiple times a day. I love it and can’t wait to see all the things I can do with it! I do have to say one annoying thing is, the book recommends preheating for 3 minutes. But when you turn on the timer it automatically starts at 20 minutes so you have to go back 17 minutes??? That does not make sense to me. The timer should start at 3 minutes.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice if you can figure out the times
reviews.reviewText:
Please don't take my review as how it'll be for everyone. I'm not a cook. I wasted more food trying to figure how long to cook things. I cooked most things too long and ruined the food and yes I read the manual.
I'd say for a cook or someone who likes being in the kitchen it'd be a nice addition. It's a heavy quality feeling machine.

I absolutely love everything about this air fryer!! I use this nearly every day for anything from french fries to steaks, chicken breasts, pork chops, asparagus, and fish. The ceramic coating makes cleaning incredibly easy. Cooking a chicken breast can take 45+ minutes in an oven, and I can have a fully cooked breast in 20-24 minutes in the air fryer. Cooking a steak with a cast iron skillet would cause way too much smoke in my apartment, but the air fryer emits no smoke and I didn’t change anything about how I prepared it. You can cook just about anything and everything in this! HIGHLY recommend buying one!

Being pre diabetes I really had to do some shaping up and change my diet . I really bought this for chicken breast and kale chips. Cooks chicken perfect. I don’t plan on making cakes and fries. I didn’t experience any funny smells or anything. Easy to clean and it doesn’t stink the house up.

reviews.reviewTitle: Chicken cordon bleu!!! So easy and delicious!
reviews.reviewText: I love my air fryer. Yes it does smell at first, almost all appliances you get like this that use high heat will have a little smell the first couple times. But after that it is fine. It cooks great and I am in love! The only suggestion I have is if there is more then 3 of you. Go up a size. I can only fit 2 stuffed chicken breast in mine.
I had another air fryer that the Teflon type coating started to peel just after a couple weeks of use. This Ninja is perfect, cooks well, cleans well, coating is exceptional. I rate it the best!

Excellent machine! I’ve had it for months and it works great! Makes grilled veggies in under 5 min! I don’t even use my oven anymore. Highly recommend to anyone who cooks daily and doesn’t have hours to make a meal for your house hold

AMAZING! This little gem has changed the meal prep game for me! I am now obsessed with making healthy turkey meatballs in 20 minutes, start to finish. But, that’s not all...fish, potatoes, chicken, pork chops, vegetables, you name it! And it is all deliciously browned and yummy! The Ninja air fryer is super easy to use and cleanup is a breeze. One of the best purchases ever!

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and Delicious meals!
reviews.reviewText: We made chicken wings (they were huge) for our first go round. They were delicious!!! Can’t wait to try pork chops. The air fryer was sooooooo easy to clean and use. I’m getting one for my mom as too!!! I would highly recommend. :)

We can't get enough of this Ninja air fryer. My daughter has one and some friends of ours had theirs in their RV! They couldn't leave home without it. Cooks everything in a jiffy and cleanup is a snap. This doesn't heat up the house by running your oven and cooks in a fraction of the time.

reviews.reviewTitle: It works very good only has 4 quart capacity but not a major concern
reviews.reviewText: I love this air fryer I cooked up some venison brats in it for it's first use, and they were awesome! It can cook just about anything that fits in it has a rack to use to add second layer of cooking space so it will cook two racks at once.

I bought this for my stepdad and he is in love. he has done multiple stuff in it and he says everything tastes delicious! he told me at the beginning he was a little afraid of the color of the chicken wings but the taste was the same and of course its great that its healthier!
The only thing he wished was that it was bigger, I got this size because its only two people on his home... but he says he likes doing multiple stuff at a time..so he got one more! now I probably will get one for myself lol. He extremely recommends it so he made me write this review.

reviews.reviewTitle: No kitchen should be without!! No more oven use!!
reviews.reviewText: Took it out of the box immediately upon receiving and haven’t stopped using since. I have air cooked chicken patties and tator tots, reheated a piece of pizza and took frozen chicken breast right from the bag into the fryer and in 24 minutes, lunch!! No more oven!!! Yes!! As with all new appliances, always test your heating and cooking times. Less is more with this power machine. But always make sure you cook to proper internal eating temperature!! This is a must have!!!

Amazing 😉. My hubby couldn’t be happier. He is on the Keto diet and it works like a dream for chicken. He majors in old bay wings and he probably uses it every night. I have cooked salmon and it was awesome. Skin was crispy & inside tender and juicy.
Cons: I tried to dehydrate bananas and it didn’t work out. I assume I didn’t do it right.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wasn't sure I'd use it much....now I'm not sure what I did without it!
reviews.reviewText: Love this thing! Spotted it on a daily deal and had just had a conversation with a friend who bought an airfryer and liked it, so I went ahead and ordered. Now I use it constantly - it's so simple to use and simple to clean. Of course we've used it for frozen french fries and tator tots, but also discovered it roasts hot dogs beautifully with a little water in the bottom -in about 3 minutes total time. Re-heat leftover pizza, frozen muffins, toast scones....we use it almost daily!

So, I was very skeptical about adding another gadget to my kitchen. I roast veggies and potatoes all of the time and thought there was no way to get the same quality on and air fryer. Man I was pleasantly surprised. Works great! What I love the most though is there is no preheat time, (my oven takes 10 minutes) just pop your food in and go. The cook times in the booklet that comes with it I have found to be a minute or 2 long. I am so glad I got this, it also is amazing when I am just cooking for myself when my family is out for the day.

reviews.reviewTitle: It worked perfectly out of the box
reviews.reviewText: We use this regularly. It cooks our food, both meats and veggies pretty quick. The trick is learning if you need to use the crisper or not, or oil or not. Other than that, it works just fine.
Absolutely love it, super easy to use. And the food comes out amazing. So far I’ve made pork chops, burgers, fries and mozzarella stick. And they have all come out amazing

reviews.reviewTitle: Capacity is small. Imagine your sauce pan.
reviews.reviewText: Way too small. Returned. If you have a convection oven or micro you are ahead of the game. Speaking of game. If you have folks over for a game. You’ll need to make wings 4 or five times since the capacity is so small. If you live alone. You may get this to fit your needs.

reviews.reviewTitle: Love it can I have another
reviews.reviewText: Love it can I have another, we really enjoyed this air fryer. We especially enjoyed the dehydrator feature. We are trying many different recipes with it. And hope to have a going for of the next while. Easy to clean and versatile. And sturdy. I wish the tray gaps were smaller. This would be helpful with dehydrating. Maybe even a second one for more space. While cooking an item that needs a toss like fries, you need to pause the unit, not an issue but would be an added benefit when you open the draw it pauses.

This is the 2nd air fryer I have owned. I love this !! It is so easy to clean. I have fixed plenty of foods in it with no trouble. My favorite to fix is chicken wings. They are perfect every time. Plenty of room to cook for 3. It does get HOT so make sure you leave clearance on the back side and keep children away from it. I recommend this 🙂

WORTH EVERY DIME. I purchased this air fryer because i hate cooking and I hate that cooking takes so long. I literally wrap salmon in butter and spices in tin foil, put it in there, turn it on for 30 minute frying time and cooks my salmon,, its roomy enough for two dinners. Definitely recommend for people on the go who hate waiting for dinner and hate cooking.

reviews.reviewTitle: All I use when I cook now
reviews.reviewText: This is an incredible machine. It's so easy to use. The sticker for temp & time are on the side of it. Easy to adjust and take things out & check on it when needed. Such a nice tool- and a great way to incorporate more healthy cooking into the home. Best price I've found for any air fryer online. Highly, highly recommend.

I love it. I use it almost exclusively now and haven't used my microwave since I bought the Ninja. Makes great "fried" chicken, crispy frozen fries and even toasts bread. I highly recommend this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: I barely use the microwave oven anymore!
reviews.reviewText: I don't know how I lived without this for so long. Airfry is amazing, no more soggy fries. Probably what I like the most is the other modes: Reheat, Roast, Dehydrate. I find myself using "Roast" a lot. Best chicken breasts that I've made at home. It takes a couple tries to get the grasp of it (heat level : time) but once you figure it out it's a less messy cooking experience.

I love my Ninja air fryer. I purchased it to make wings. We have had several batches and all have been food. You need to watch the time if the wings aren’t meaty. The first batch were meaty wings and did great at the suggested time and temp. The last batch were not very meaty and could have been cooked for less time.
I will try other recipes and I am sure all will be good.
Very easy to clean. No mess from frying!

reviews.reviewTitle: If your looking for a healthy alternative to frying this is the product for you!
reviews.reviewText: This product is amazing! The first week we cooked every meal in our air fyer. This product is easy to use, easy to clean and quick to cook. It comes with a good recipe book for anything you can think of. The 4 quart is the perfect size for sitting on the counter and cooking space. I have a family of 3 and even though I've had to split certain meats like pork chops, the cooking time is still less than an oven. I was worried just how crispy everything would but I have been very impressed with everything I have made. Even the air fryer okra was amazing! If you into eating healthy this is the product for you!

I was slightly skeptical at first but after a few weeks of using this at least three times a week I have been loving it. No doubts this is one of the greatest things in my kitchen now. So worth it. Dehydrating fruit is great, run it through the night and fresh stuff for the next day. Amazing no doubt.

Just got my air fryer today and I already used it! We couldn’t wait to try it out. Plus we got it on amazon prime day for only $66.

So far we just tried potato wedges. We prepared them two ways. On way was costing them with egg, flour and panko. The other way was using oil and garlic with other seasonings! Both turned out great. The one with panko had a super crispy outside! It was amazing!!
2nd day update:
Today we air fried fresh Broccoli and frozen egg rolls! It’s perfect!!! Super crisp on the outside! You can hear the crispiness in the video I added!

We can’t wait to try other recipes and I’ll update my review when we try new stuff.

Love. Love. Love. This air fryer is perfect! We use it all the time. It cooks food perfectly and is SO easy to clean afterwards! It is very user friendly and I love the digital display and button options; makes it easy to use. The booklet that it comes with is an awesome guide for what and how how long to cook things.

I have not turned on my oven since this purchase! I love it. I wanted this item because I trust Ninja and do not like preheating my oven for one small item. I have cooked chicken, steak, pork chops, fish and veggies in it. It is the perfect size for 1 or 2 people. One word of caution - check the food often as I have found it cooks faster than the time recommended for most recipes.
Very pleased with this purchase.

This is fantastic product. I bought it for my wife for her birthday. We now enjoy a range of frozen foods like fish fillets, french fries, hash browns, egg rolls, chicken strips, etc. All are cooked without any oil yet come out crispy as if they were cooked in a deep fat fryer. The cooking time is also very fast. I especially like the Ninja because the tub and crisper are all ceramic coated for easy cleaning.

Absolutely changed our lives. We are now able to roast veggies and chicken, air fry chicken, bacon and so much more, cook frozen pizzas, fish sticks, chicken nuggets, taquitos and fries and reheat foods without losing its texture in MINUTES! It's definately made life easier for two fulltime working parents with 2 kids under the age of 4. IMPORTANT: Reduce cooking times if trying online/cookbook recipes. This baby is powerful! Most used and important countertop appliance other than our coffeemaker/espresso machine. Wish it came in a 6qt size

Love that I can use this instead of the oven, especially since summer coming on now, but use 2 to 3 times a week and loving everything that I make out of it. Great size for just two people. Not had any issues and it will not be going into my pantry, stays out all the time. Got this in Feb 2019 and today is 5-19-19

I hesitated to buy this since I’m running out of space in the kitchen lol, but I’m so glad I bought it! I settled on the Ninja brand bc of reviews for other air fryers flaking in the dishwasher. I use it at least three times a week for the past 4 months and it’s holding up well! Chicken legs have been our favorite. It fits about 5 drumsticks one layer. I can do up to 6 red potatoes for fries and tonight I fit 6 chicken thighs one layer. It’s big enough for our family of three 🙂

This thing is awesome! We have made almost everything in this thing. It cooks quickly, fairly quietly considering, and evenly with NO grease. You don’t have to worry about smells either, you only smell the seasoning not any oil or grease which is awesome! It’s very user friendly, read the handbook that comes with it and it tells you how to cook pretty much everything. It’s awesome and I would 10/10 recommend.

We make everything in here! Fries and tots are perfectly crisp without oil. Wings take 1 tbsp of oil and that's it! Made bacon brussel sprouts in 10 minutes.

Everything you cook in there will come out more crisp and done faster than you expect. Loved it this summer with the summer heat and not wanting to start my oven. Highly recommend this brand with its timer and digital temperature.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's a small basket only thing I wish it was like a 6qt
reviews.reviewText: I bought this air fryer for my fiancé for Christmas he kept talking about them and so I got this Ninja brand and we absolutely love it your food comes out crispy without the use of any oil and it taste so good. I am not sure why it took us so long to get one and the clean up is super easy and it works for us since we are always on the go:)

reviews.reviewTitle: Does not stop heating element when basket removed
reviews.reviewText: I returned because it seems dangerous if someone like a child or memory impaired person were to pull the basket out as it is cooking. could cause an accident or fire.

Now that I'm a empty nest, I love this Ninja Air Fryer. No more oven (unless I'm baking a cake from scratch) using, not even the stove unless I want some grits. I even use it to make toast, grill cheese sandwich and reheat all my leftovers (I don't even need a microwave anymore). Best thing I've ever spent money on.

Exceeded my expectations on so many levels! I was skeptical to buy after purchasing an instant pot and not using it as often as I thought I would, but the hype around the air fryer is REAL. I’ve had this for about 3 weeks and use it nearly everyday. Great and convenient for potatoes, veggies, bacon, sausages, chicken tenders + more!! Clean up is hastel-free.

It’s small, but can cook enough for 4-6 people. Cook time just takes longer if you’re making more.

Also... this is the first review I have ever written on a product. If you’re on the fence, I highly recommend.

Outstanding quality. Extremely easy to clean. And cooks food very evenly and well regardless to how much food is used. Most air fryers I have use need the food to be in a single layer. The Ninja can have a full basket and the easy to hold handle makes “shaking” the basket during cooking extremely concurrent. Everything I have attempting to make has turned out excellent. I highly recommend this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great for making typical fried Foods
reviews.reviewText: I like fried foods coming from Japanese background. This makes acceptable tonkatsu, crisp fried seafood and shrimp using panko, deep fried style gyoza and shumai, potato korrokke, fried chicken, french fries, sweet potato fries and general heating of foods requiring crispy exterior quickly. The machine is light compared to many other kitchen appliances which makes it easy for me to move on the counter.

We love this air fryer. We use it everyday, and it has basically replaced the oven. My 13 yr old son uses it the most. We cook all kinds of stuff in it and don't want to live without it. We did have a different brand air fryer previous to this one that we liked, but when it wore out we replaced it with the ninja. There was big difference.... the ninja is great! I highly reccomend it. If this one breaks or wears out, I will buy another ninja brand.

reviews.reviewTitle: I love my Ninja air fryer and can't live without it!
reviews.reviewText: As someone who hates kale, I find myself air frying kale chips, broccoli, cauliflower and so much more in this air fryer! It's very easy to clean and has pretty much replaced my microwave! Tonight I'm planning to make some homemade egg roles. Truly can't express how much i'd rather make food at home now after purchasing this product! GO BUY IT! :D

What can I say, this thing works like a dream. I love making veggies in this for meal prep. It adds a crisp fried style flavor, without all the oil and mess. AND it gets everything cooked in such a short time. I highly recommend it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Paid for itself in savings & more so.
reviews.reviewText: Initially bought this to fry tofu. Figured it would pay for itself in few uses versus ordering out Chinese a few times a week. Now I cook with it almost daily, be it air frying, roasting, or dehydrating. Pairs well with a vegetable chopper to ensure everything is a consistent size. I also recommend using less oil than the companion cookbook suggests. Just toss your food in a Tupperware-ish container to ensure even coating with less oil. Easy to make “one pot dishes” as well by simply adding your ingredients in phases based on needed cooking time. Attached photo is “one pot” sweet potato home fries with vegan sausage. Much easier to clean up than my cast iron skillet and far less oil used in my food.

reviews.reviewTitle: Super Easy and Super Tasting Food!! Love it!
reviews.reviewText: My husband wanted this even though he doesn’t cook. I was skeptical at best. However upon using it I was very pleasantly surprised how great it works! Seriously easy and the crisper plate makes unbelievable fries both fresh and frozen and reheated too. I just made lamb chops which were superb. Easy to clean and the food turns out perfect. This is one appliance I won’t be giving away.

I must have received a defective air fryer, because mine did not stay on all the time. If I had to pause it for any reason, trying to get it to work again was a pain, and sometimes it wouldn't even go back on. I was so excited about this, especially after reading the reviews. And I have other Ninja appliances that I love. So I'm quite disappointed. I'll be shopping for a less "fancier" air fryer and see how that goes....

I like that you are not adding oil to food. You are getting a healthier meal. We love waffle sweet potato fries. French fries are good cooked in the air fryer. Left over pizza tastes fresh reheated in the air fryer.

I received this as a Mothers day gift from my husband. My first thought was...what am I going to do with a Air Fryer. Well let me tell you... EVERYTHING. Since I opened the box I have used it every night. This thing is awesome. Easy to use, easy to clean. I'm really impressed.

Love the Ninja. I have the food processor so went with the same brand when I got the air fryer. Not been disappointed. It is so easy to use and makes food so crispy and keeps the deliciousness of the food I am frying. Use it all the time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Go to for cooking and reheating everything.
reviews.reviewText: Love this air fryer. Does exactly what it says it will do. Easy to use and clean. Good price. Target sell for twenty dollars more.

I have a different brand of air fryer, but bought this as a gift for my boyfriend. I like it so much better than mine! Easy to clean, rack is simple, controls are simple, and all around solid nice air fryer.

I love my Ninja Air Fryer. I use it mostly to cook sweet potatoes fries and other roots. I also cook sausages and hamburgers and there is no smell or smoke in my kitchen. It is very fast and quick. You must monitor your food if you don't want it burn!

This has been my first airfrier and I don't know how I got on without it. I hate fried food because it's way too greesy. This godsend makes fried food tast better and saves your heart. It fits almost any amount of food you would want.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great way to avoid making a mess!
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely a must-have. It makes cooking so many different dishes much easier. It takes 25 minutes to make wings with quality that are on par with those purchased from the restaurants. We also made steaks with it too... it is cleaner and easy to wash. Not only does it not require cooking oil, it is a great way to avoid messy/smoky kitchen. Note: it does create some odor when raw meat is being cooked at the beginning. Get one...

Love this thing it's awesome! I cook for myself only and it's made my meal prep go so much faster only thing is it takes some time to get good idea of amount of time and tenon to cook food I've found that their recommendations seem to overcook the food. Make sure your rotating your food especially on the airfry mode..I like to use the roast mode it cooks things the way I'm used to and for things that take a while or needs lots of heat and time I'll use air dry mode and not use air dry insert gives you a little control, unless you want a certain crispness

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use. Great Results for Air Frying.
reviews.reviewText: I've been wanting to buy one for a while, but was hesitant. No regrets! The instructions were very clear and the device is easy to use. I only used it once to air fry sweet potatoes, but am excited to try other foods and the other settings. Air frying the diced sweet potatoes took half the time it usually does for me in the oven (with less oil) and ended up much crispier. It was larger than I expected, but that isn't too bad of a trade-off for me.

Absolutely love my new air fryer. I've had it for a week & have already cooked several things in it. Use the printed times for each option as a guide. My food never takes as long as it says it's supposed to. I've been extremely impressed to say the least. It's so simple & safe, my 12 yr old son uses & loves. Great job, Ninja! Your products never fail me.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don’t know what all the fuss is about
reviews.reviewText: Have you ever had deep-fried food? Air-fried Food does NOT taste fried. It tastes blah or dried out. I make my own French fries, from fresh potatoes and they were awful. Yes , I followed the directions. Sweet potato French fries, same thing. If you buy pre-made, frozen food, it might be ok, but you can just put that in the oven, toaster oven or skillet. I returned it. It worked fine but food was awful.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buy this.. need I say more?
reviews.reviewText: Finally decided to hop on the air fryer band wagon when I saw an amazing sale on this during the prime deal days. I’ve looked at other brands before in stores and wasn’t super impressed with their quality. I was extremely pleased immediately after unboxing this to find how sturdy and well made it was. I started off by throwing some fries in. They came out crispy and not greasy. I next threw in some egg rolls. Same outcome. Next was the real test, freshly caught fish. I whipped up my homemade breading, coated the fish, and threw it in the fryer. The outcome? No surprise.. absolutely outstanding. I honestly don’t know how I’ve lived without this fryer for this long. I can say that after using it that I couldn’t live without it. If you are even slightly considering buying this fryer, don’t hesitate, buy it. You won’t regret it.

I use this air fryer at least 3 times every week. I choose this model because of the high ratings and especially the coating on the internal cooking surfaces (not painted). It is great for fish, French fries, finger foods and it makes beef jerky in about 5hrs.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great time saver | easy to clean | less oil to use
reviews.reviewText: Bought this during the Amazon prime day sale for my dad and brother. Enjoyed that everything was compacted and now my father doesn't always have to pan fry all his food. This Ninja Air Fryer has helped my family save on using excess oil and time! When I was a child, my asian father would always fry meat/fish on his plate and it would take a long time since he needed to time the flips to ensure the meat/fish was cooked properly. Now my father's time has been shorted to over 50%+ in terms of cooking and cleaning.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wish I Bought One Of These 10 Years Ago
reviews.reviewText: This product has dramatically improved the way I cook and the way I eat. I fry with very little (or no) oil and the food comes out perfectly. Easy to set up, operate and clean. I prepare about half of my meals using this air fryer exclusively. Two important tips - one ALWAYS pre-heat and two - be sure to regularly shake, toss, stir the food inside to get crispy results. I made the best hash browns and onion rings I have ever tasted this week. Highly recommended.

We're still learning how to use it and the cook times seem to be a bit off from the book but the food tastes great and my hubby is enjoying trying everything out in it! And it keeps the house cooler on hot pre-summer days

Honestly was on the fence of getting this but the wife wanted it. Now I use it more than she does! Basically just a miniature convection oven, but for frozen foods like chicken and fries it is absolutely the best!

The product was delivered by USPS! The mailman did great job by taking my package to the door of my apartment due to the size of the package.
The Ninja Air Fryer is so easy to use. After clean the basket and crispy plate, I made pot stickers and cauliflower and washed basket and plate in the dishwasher as the instruction.
I’m very satisfied with the delivery and the product.

I've only had this for less than a week but so far I love it.

I've made chicken nuggets, jalapeno poppers, hash browns, chicken wings, and beef jerky and everything has come out awesome! "Fried" food is crunchy as if it came out of the fryer but its not greasy.

I read some reviews that said it smelled like burning rubber or something. I took the advice of one reviewer and I ran it empty outside at 350 degrees for 20 minutes and it's fine.

It's pretty quiet, it's like having the fan over your oven running on low.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very simple to use and clean
reviews.reviewText: I didn’t know much about this when I bought it but everyone I know swore by it so I figured alright let’s give it a shot. It’s pretty easy to use, there’s a small sticker with a set time and temperature for different foods (fish, poultry, veggies, etc. ). I usually pop French fries or wings in there and while those are cooking I can get everything else prepped for dinner.

reviews.reviewTitle: Why did I wait so long?
reviews.reviewText:
This little guy is a game changer. My issue is that I live in a studio apartment and whenever I would pan fry / grill anything my entire place would smell even if I turn on the vent open the balcony door.

I’ve air fried egg rolls, frozen dumplings, and roasted chicken breasts! I can’t wait to try other things!!

In regards to the strange plastic smell all I did was turn it up to 400° put a piece of cinnamon bark in there and had it run for 30 minutes and the smell was almost entirely gone. The more that I use it the plastic smell has lessened each time.

I wanted to use this to eat healthier. However, my air fryer compartment was unable to close properly. Not sure if this was the reason my food always came out burnt on the top portion. I've followed directions to cook different recipes but the air fryer did not work well with my cooking. I can see how this will make food healthier and ease for cooking.

Love this air fryer! Cooks food fast! Made beef Jerky according to the recipe in the manual, sooooo good ! Wish I had this before in my life! No need to waste time heating up the oven and getting your house hot( in the summer) . Game changer!!

Paid a little more than my first air fryer and I am so happy with this one. The last one got rusty and the drawer stopped fitting properly after about a year. We mostly do frozen french fries or tots and it is used almost 2-3 times per week.

reviews.reviewTitle: Bought this for my mom, kept it
reviews.reviewText:
Was super easy to set up, i just started using it straight out of the box. Made French fries much faster then deep frying. Confession: i love kitchen gadgets but was very skeptical about this one and really never wanted one. I found it so easy to use and it gave me what I love: nice browning and fast cooking.

Mami liked it but I loved it and she gave my gift to her back to me.

I live alone and thought this would be so much fun I would eat better! Nothing has been great except the hamburger. I have made beef jerky and I will try that again with a better marinade. I may end up donating it to the church yard sale . It’s so big!

reviews.reviewTitle: Should have bought one a long time ago!
reviews.reviewText: These things are amazing. Healthy and fast alternative to deep frying, we are finding that we are looking for new things to make with this appliance, and its getting us back to eating at home. Easy to clean up and wonderful set of instructions and recipes are included.

reviews.reviewTitle: Must experiment to get "your" best results.
reviews.reviewText: I like to play around with food and gadgets so it works for me. Not much for following recipes so I'm probably more likely to have a few mishaps. Ha. I like my ninja and would purchase a bigger on next time.

Bought this for my daughter’s apartment and it’s pretty awesome! Easy, fast and everything we’ve made so far is absolutely delicious! Ninja products are fantastic and I chose this because my love for my ninja blender goes beyond what should be for an appliance, lol! This fryer did not disappoint and I’m glad I went with this brand.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best thing to get for a College Apartment
reviews.reviewText: This glorified oven is extremely addicting to use. My roommate and I use this fryer almost every single day to cook anything from fresh chicken to frozen meals. There are lots of air fryers out there, but I can tell you that this is definitely one of the best. Cleaning is easy, using it is simple, the the flavors are amazing.

I love this. I've used it the last 2 nights and have found it easy to use and easy to clean k though I worry about buildup on coils over time (even with wiping it with a damp cloth).

I think this is a match made in heaven LOL
We have had several air fryers, and this by FAR is the best! It works extremely well, and cleans super easily! Great non stick basket and plate. This one is a must!

reviews.reviewTitle: A great addition to my kitchen
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love the Ninja air fryer. I've made my own beef jerky, I can cook raw meat in minutes, & I can also make frozen chicken nuggets in minutes. This little machine is great. You can make a meal without heating up the kitchen like an oven would. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE, my Ninja air fryer.

Best damn device since a bread cutter! No really if you haven’t tried an air fryer yet you have no idea what your missing. I always hated frying foods the grease smell lingers and it’s awful. No smell with this bad boy! Had to play with the times a bit from their directions but other than this HIGHLY recommended!

Absolutely love this air fryer. My husband practically uses it every day. We make wings, fries, chicken, shrimp.... All come out great. I just bought a second for my step son who was wanting one after tasting our food and seeing how easy it is to use. Ninja is the best choice.

reviews.reviewTitle: Compact, ease of use and great results
reviews.reviewText: Perfect for a family of 1 or 2. It has replaced my microwave and is perfect for preparing and reheating meals. Took me a while to discover that the heating plate lifts out to clean.
Food tastes very good. Hot dogs taste like those at the ballpark

So just like alot of people I wanted an air fyer. I like the brand so i figured let's start with ninja. Making wings is amazing I cook them for about 20 mins. They come out crispy and tender. No oil used either. we have made veggies too. The one thing is after the third round of wings make sure you clean it out or it start to get smoky in the house

I love everything about this air fryer! I will say if you cook something that doesn't naturally have oil in it, it may taste a bit dry, so oil is needed in some instances. However, it cooked food very quickly. I use it daily. I took one star away because it has caused an increase in my electric bill.

Love it! So easy to reheat foods or create new ones. The options are endless. Wish I had bought the bigger
version though. This would be great for a couple but it's small for a family.

reviews.reviewTitle: Gamechanger! Versatile and makes delicious food!
reviews.reviewText: This air fryer is remarkable (kind of like a whiteboard). Whether using it to dehydrate fruit, make crispy and flavorful falafel, or making a quick batch of sweet potato fries (that come out way crispier compared to making them in the oven) the air fryer does not disappoint. Very happy with my purchase, wish I had purchased one sooner!

I bought this air fryer after returning one I had purchased previously without knowing anything about air fryers.
This one is easy to use so far, but I haven't prepared anything complicated. I'm waiting to find a cook book with recipes I can try. So far I am quite happy with it.

I use this air fryer for so many things! It works great in quick froze snack for the family, like cheese sticks, nuggets, and fries. It also makes easy work of healthy roasted and air fried veggies for me! I love Brussels sprouts in it! I do find it seems to cook a little “warm” and things don’t take quite the recommended time. But that is easily adjusted!

I bought this on a suggestion from a friend. They were right. Wings are incredible. And not so fattening. I am still learning the fries part but man you should see what it can do with a steak. You'll love it and find yourself using often. Suggestion, always preheat for 5 minutes, makes a big difference.

I had to turn the product because came whit the error of assembling
I call to customer service from Ninja and I found the frier plate was in the wrong position and I was not able to use
Customer service recommended I turn back the product
They apologize for the problem but I was not able to used
As this is a exceptional issue I think this review is not for publication because is not a general problem

Very quick and easy to use. Cooks foods nice and crispy, and the flavors remain authentic. I use this to cook fries, tots chicken wings and fillets, as well as all seafood, and even chocolate chip cookies. Baked potatoes and sweet potatoes also taste great cooked in this air fryer. The basket is large enough to cook for a family of four (4 fish fillets, 4 chicken breast fillets, or 6-8 chicken strips...). I have also cooked tofu and mini pizzas in this air fryer, and both have came out very tasty!

reviews.reviewTitle: Where have you been all my life?!?!
reviews.reviewText: My wife and I just love this appliance. We've experimented with a variety of dishes and perfected cooking times and temperatures. The guide labeled on the side is very helpful, though meals seem to be done quicker than the specified time. The only caveat we have is that it's a bit small but it's a tradeoff we're willing to accept to save countertop space.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good size, good value, easy to clean
reviews.reviewText: This air fryer is well made, not too big, not too small, and the price is good. Once you get to know how it works best, it can change they way you prefer cooking some of your favorite foods. A spray bottle for light cooking oil, and a pair of silicone covered tongs are necessary for best use. It’s very easy to clean.

This is my first air fryer, and I've only had it a few weeks so I may update this later on.

The positive side is this thing is amazing. It cooks things perfectly, and the included cook book guide is very easy to use. It's easy to clean, and you can even buy replacement parts from ninja if it ever gets worn out. The only downside I can see to this model is the price, and the size. 4 quart is big enough, but if you have a larger family, you might want to get a bigger model.

All in all I'm very happy with this product.

I bought this and let it sit in my pantry for two months, I was thinking of returning b/c I thought I’d never use it. Then I made chicken strips and this was the best I’ve ever made! Can’t wait to continue to use it!

reviews.reviewTitle: It’s small, only good for re-heating
reviews.reviewText: This fryer is great for one person. Buy a larger one if you are a larger family than just one person. The ceramic coating makes it superior to other fryers. It is great for cooking fries, frozen burgers, etc. not so great cooking fresh breaded chicken strips-mine came out under cooked and when I put them back in to cook thoroughly they were dried out. My range-oven is still a better method for most foods.

I love this air fryer! I bought it to make Skinny Taste recipes and it was so worth it. On the first day I already made whole roasted garlic, chicken, reheated chicken wings, and cooked frozen nuggets. (Not all for me ! Haha) this thing is great and it’s so easy to use. It does have the plastic smell like the other comments mention but I think it’s just because it’s brand new and will likely go away with use. I like how easy it is to wash too! Can’t wait to cook zucchini and many other recipes in it!
Love how quick things cook and flavors are awesome.

reviews.reviewTitle: I need to use it more to give a fair assessment.
reviews.reviewText: Perhaps after I use this more and learn how it works best, I will like it more. I’ve only used it about 3 times for fish, chicken, biscuits. It seems to dry out food more, but maybe I cooked it too long. I don’t think I can give a fair assessment until after i’ve Used it a while.
This air fryer is fantastic!! you cannot beat it. We just purchased two weeks ago and have used it for so many different things already. We love the versatility and the ease of use. Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best thing I’ve purchased in a long time!!
reviews.reviewText: It took me a bit to jump on the Air Fryer train but I’m glad I did. This has made cooking dinner so easy.

Perfect for cooking chicken wings! Now you can enjoy tasty wings that are not filled with grease. Air Fryer cooks wings crispy & flavorful. Vegetables are delicious. It's easy to use & cleanup is a breeze. This is a smaller size than other air fryers, which makes it perfect for singles or couples.

reviews.reviewTitle: Glad I bought this air fryer...
reviews.reviewText: If you are not air frying, you are missing out on diversifying your diet. We fry sausage, cauliflower, potatoes, bacon, chicken, brussell sprouts, kale... the list goes on and on. I use this machine at least twice a day since we purchased it. It cleans up easily and cooks quickly.
My wife loved it. It is so easy to use. We actually stopped deep frying ever since we got our air fryer.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best purchase I’ve made this year
reviews.reviewText: Love my air fryer! This is the best purchase I’ve made all year! We use it almost every day and the dehydrate feature is awesome! It’s easy to use and very easy to clean

I was worried that I wouldn't have enough use for this, but I keep finding new recipes all the time. The best thing is the time and convenience factor. Most recipes are less than 15 minutes in the fryer with minimal prep before. I also love that the entire pull out drawer and inserts are dishwasher safe.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best for 1-2 people but not a family of 4.
reviews.reviewText: Love the air fryer but what I didn’t realize is the overall size of the cooking space so it is best for 1-2 people but cooking for a family of 4 it isn’t so great. You can fit 2 chicken breasts so it takes a long time to cook for 4 people. But it is wonderful for potatoes and heating up fries, etc.

This product is awesome. However, we noticed that the default suggested times and instructions are always higher and will burn if you follow instructions. We have been learning our own tricks and putting less time and it is getting better. It is as advertised and we love it. However, need better instructions/recipes.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice helper to cook and keeps the taste
reviews.reviewText: We liked it so far. Shaking every 5 minutes is the key to keep the taste. We tried vegetables mostly potatoes and chicken. It was nice. My wife loved it. Before this we tried 4 similar product. So the things I am saying came out mostly comparison. Honestly best one ...

reviews.reviewTitle: Best purchase ever for the kitchen
reviews.reviewText: I love this fryer. Love the fact that you can use almost no oil. The smell has left my kitchen from years of conventional frying in a pot. This appliance produces crisp flavor-laden food. French fries, steak fries, steak, pork chops. I haven't even scratched the surface of all it can do yet, and I use it everyday. Easy to clean. Easy to use. Not brain surgery. Everyone should have this in their kitchen.

I bought this for my husband as a gift as he had wanted an air-fryer for quite some time. I did a lot of research as there are so many of them out there right now. Because we love our Ninja blender so well, I chose to go with the same brand. It was a great choice and we are more than pleased with it!

Love this air fryer. I did a lot of research on reviews for different brands and this seemed the best. I have had no problems with it, it cooks quick and it it easy to clean. The only thing is you need to play around with the cook times. I found if you cooked things according to the times in the booklet, the food was over cooked.

I previously had a Paula Dean air fryer that I had gotten at a flea market and I got a lot of use out of but I dropped the lid and it would never close again so I had to get a new one. I invested in this Ninja air fryer and IT IS AMAZING! I use it all the time and it cooks very quick and so easy to use. I almost cook everything in there! If you are looking for an air fryer this is the one to get!

Purchased in Jan 2019...
Not sure what took me so long. My energy bill has definitely decreased. Not a big chicken fan from this but I like my chicken dry'r than most. Everything else from our I love... especially bacon!!! I'm a great con but when I do not have the time this works just fine.
So far so good. No problems with cooking. Took me a little while to adapt to using it, but I got is figured out. Nice for quick small batches.

I like it. I wish I had bought a bigger one but this works for just myself and my husband. You can't pile french fries on top of each other like the photo shows or they really won't cook well. The french fries were good after all cooked. I cooked chicken in this and it was great.

We absolutely love our air fryer. My husband was very unsure about whether he would like it. Now he is sold!! We have cooked anything and everything in here. From steaks to chicken to corn dogs, pork chops, and bacon... even veggies and reheating pizza. We have never had an issue with the rubber smell that others have mentioned. We probably use it a couple times a week at this point for both meals and small snacks. My husband loves buying the boneless chicken wings and making ‘homemade’ Buffalo Wild Wings at home.
