He even said to me that this air fryer is one of the best things that’s happened to us - haha.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5 months and complete broken after hardly any use
reviews.reviewText: Bought this about 5 months ago and only used a handful of times. It stopped working completely and won’t even power on anymore. For paying the price of a ninja you would expect it to last longer than a few month with hardly any use on it.
All I can say is WOW! Don’t know how I ever cod without it. No more grease to clean up Fried come out crispy and brown as well as bacon. I love it

This has been a time saver. Super easy to use. The timing suggestions I am mostly spot on however you may need to tweak for things like chicken or vegetables depending on thickness. Clean up is a Breeze. Recommend hand washing. We love this air fryer, will buy another one for my mom!

All I can say is WOW! This Air fryer works so well and makes food taste delicious. I was skeptical of this product because I had a different air fryer in the past that really dried out the food. This is easy to use, doesn't dry out the food, and cooks fast. I highly recommend!

This thing is AMAZING... I haven't stopped using it since I got it a couple of months ago. Everything turns out perfect! Absolutely love making chicken legs and wings in it because they cook so quickly and turn out great every time. I'm obssessed! I just purchased the 6.5 quart because I end up cooking in batches with this one for a family of four. It would be perfect for someone cooking for only 1-2 though.

I was pretty sceptical when my husband told me about air fryers I wasnt sure how it would preform but I was amazed how crispy our food came out without all the oil. When I first turned it on I thought it was pretty loud but after awhile I zoned it out, it sounds like if you turn on ur stove fan but it's not too bad. I fried some chicken skins and they came out amazing.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't expect Amazon to help when it breaks!
reviews.reviewText: Overall this is a great product. However, ours stopped working after roughly 6 months. I contacted Amazon to see if there was a manufacturer's warranty or if they could help with anything. The only response I got was...."contact the manufacturer, the return window is closed." This was my first experience with Amazon offering absolutely no help, so maybe it was a one-off occurrence. Just keep this in mind. My opinion would be just to order directly from Ninja.
I’m just not a fan of the air fryer. It’s one of the tools that u just don’t use that often. So I put it under the counter for now.

Food tasted much better than I anticipated cooked in air fryer. It cooks really fast, & I have to adjust temperature & cooking times to my taste. Some frozen food taste much better when first defrosted in microwave then cook in air fryer. A real time saver!

My whole family loves this Air Fryer! It is used almost daily! It makes the usual items (chicken nuggets, french fries, etc.) but it can be used for so much more once you start experimenting. My daughter makes crispy tofu in it and I've made pork chops in it. We also reheat so many things that we would have thrown away because we wouldn't have turned on the over to reheat a small amount of leftovers. We have had this now for about 4 months without any issues. It cleans up nicely and I would highly recommend!

reviews.reviewTitle: This takes some getting used to, but you’ll love it.
reviews.reviewText: Works fine. I do wish it included all the other pans and double wire try that you will probably end up buying separately. I’m thinking that a closed basket would be especially nice to keep plantain chips etc from flying around. I’ll use this to cook veggies!
Easy to use and great addition to the kitchen. Helps spice up the chicken rut. Has a good crust like grilled and very moist on inside.
This appliance has saved me so much money and time. It helps leftovers come back to life and fresh food is cooked quick and perfect crispy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and works very well
reviews.reviewText: The only thing I do not like is the size. I wish I had purchased a larger unit. But the quality of the food I have cooked in this is amazing. It is easy to clean. I even took it on vacation to the beach as air fryers are not standard for a rented beach house. Good product.

I bought this air fryer after hearing all the fuzz about cooking in this, and OMG I am super please. Have barely cooked anything on my stove since we got this air fryer and it is so easy to use and everything comes out so good that I bought two more to give to my daughters. The basket cold be a little bigger, but for two is perfect! thinking of buying another for us so we have two when cooking for more people. Wings, pork loin, steaks, fish, burgers, fries, eggplants, egg rolls..... you name it! There are many great recipes out there for air fryers making it really fun to use everyday!!!!!! Highly recommend this one. LOVE IT!
Still finding other ways to use this but for a quick after school/work chicken nugget prep for the kids it’s awesome. Cuts bake time by 1/3 to 1/2. We’ll worth the time saving alone.
Everything has come out better than cooking in the oven or stovetop. We have essentially replaced using our oven with this!

reviews.reviewTitle: Wow!!! The best thing EVER!!! Love....Love...Love!!!!
reviews.reviewText: It is super easy to clean. Super easy to use. The food comes out amazingly great! I love it so much I bought one for my daughter, my mother, my brother and my mom bought one for my niece. I plan on buying one for my dad for XMAS. You will not be disappointed!!! Go for it!
It is really great to make single servings and adds a crunchy outside of food unlike when using the oven

reviews.reviewTitle: great item, worth the price, genuine product
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use and sturdy. Great flavor and easy to clean as well. It a must buy deal if you want a healthy lifestyle.

We love this product! We have been using it for a few months and everything comes out delicious. Great for frozen food because it cooks it quickly and the clean up is a very easy. My husbands even started cooking because it’s so easy to use- he loves ribs and pizza rolls in this and i love chicken wings.

My first air fryer. Day 3 of owning it. I’ve made zucchini fries, sweet potato fries, chicken Katsu, bacon-both turkey and reg bacon.
So easy to use. Easy to clean. Crunchy, yet very little to no oil needed. Doesn’t stink up the house. My only semi-complaint would be, I need to do cooking in batches. But that’s how things crisp, without overloading unit.

reviews.reviewTitle: Super Easy Clean Up, Use Daily
reviews.reviewText: I haven't even turned my oven on since purchasing. This thing will reheat, air fry, dehydrate. I used it daily. It cleans up very easily with almost no effort. My previous (another brand) air fryer worked well, but did not clean up well and always had food residue stuck to it. The only thing I may have done differently is buy the larger model, but this is generally only used for 1-2 people and is sufficient.

Just google Vegan Air Fryer recipes and you will start drooling! This air fryer is the right size, super easy to use, temp control, timer, easy to clean. I'm still experimenting, but I really enjoy using it. I like the common items printed on the fryer, so you don't have to look in a book.

I love the ninja air fryer. everything Ive done in it has been fabulous. the only
downside is it is basically for 2 people when cooking certain foods. I wish it was bigger

The product works as advertised. My fiancé likes how it turns off automatically when she removes the frying basket. The recommended cooking times are a bit too long and result in dried-out food. The crispy texture that this appliance lends to battered chicken tenders is enjoyable, but be careful of cooking for too long or they will be drier than you expect. It’s very easy to clean because all the removable parts are dishwasher safe. Works great with french fries too. Worth the money.
I love oven roasted veggies but the they are a hassle .. this takes the hassle out of it. Lost a star because you really can't fit all that much into it at once.

I wanted to give air frying a try without spending a ton of money and so far I'm very happy with this little fryer. It's big enough for cooking for two, but if you want larger meals you should probably get a larger model. Easy to clean and super easy to use the controls, it's very intuitive. Not a lot of bells and whistles, just a simple air fryer, which is what I wanted. Price is just right! Seems to be built sturdy and doesn't have a cheap feel to it. It is a bit loud, not terrible, but you definitely know it's running. Heats the food evenly, pre-heating is a must (only 3 mins).
Made several different things in this and all have turned out good. Live it for reheating pizza and chicken

reviews.reviewTitle: Great and easy to use fryer.
reviews.reviewText: Best air fryer ever! My husband has to decrease his fried food intake so I purchased this as a “love” gift. He says it’s the best gift I have ever gotten him. Fried come out great and he did chicken wings and can’t believe they taste like he fried them in the skillet.

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing, but check the cook times
reviews.reviewText: We love this air fryer. It is easy to use, easy to clean, and the food turns out amazing every time. If you follow the cook time guide that comes with it, I suggest decreasing the cook time at first and checking the food. I’ve made fries following their recommendations multiple times and they come out burnt. Once we figured it out, they were amazing.

reviews.reviewTitle: Gave it as a Gift - They LOVE it
reviews.reviewText: I gave this to my son and daughter in law for Christmas - they simply love it. they work very different hours so this works wonderfully for them. They are able to have a healthy home cooked meal at any time. I am considering one for me and my husband because they love theirs so much

reviews.reviewTitle: Best choice for Air fryer and Air roaster!
reviews.reviewText: Super easy to clean, and has both roasting and air fryer settings. I highly recommend this air fryer. My daughter had a different brand and I enjoyed the food so much that I ordered this one. Hers is not easy to keep clean...

I've looked at it fryers for about year, but it wasn't something I was convinced That I needed, recently my sister was saying about how much she used hers and recommended the ninja, and I love it it's so easy to use and I'm very Satisfied

The food did not cook well and would not recommend buying this particular air fryer. Read the reviews and that is why I picked this one, but would definitely not order. If I could send it back I would. Used it for first time a week ago. Should have gotten it out of box sooner to use so that it could be returned.
Amazing . The quality is there . This product is built tough and for the price you are hitting a homerun. Extremely easy to use and the user guide comes with all cooking recipes . Well done ninja

I love this product! It does take a little trial and error with temperature and time, but the food tastes good. Everyone knows how awful cold french fries are. You can reheat them in this and they are crisp again. I've used it for all kinds of food that would normally be fried.

reviews.reviewTitle: Yes you can wash the basket
reviews.reviewText: Our biggest concern after getting this was if could, like the instructions said, run the basket through the dishwasher. Everything except for the main piece (with all the electronics) is dishwasher safe. It took a little bit of time to dial in temperatures and cook times for what we were making but not much. Once we had that we have been using it like crazy. We love our air fryer.

Easy to clean (just remove the rack on the bottom and wash with soap and water.
Reheats pizza very nicely! Does a really nice job on eggplant parmigiana, potatoes, etc.
Does not cook Brussel sprouts well.
This is so easy to use and makes cooking time so much faster. No waiting for pre-heating, and it makes things crispy but not oily. Just love it!
If like me your wife is a terrible cook, then just go for this ninja! She is now obsessed to try new recipes everyday and it takes no longer than 25 min for 90% of the cooking we do. Great purchase !
Large capacity, easy to use and clean. Had tried other brands and returned after a day or two. This Ninja Air Fryer is great and is a keeper.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quit reading comments and just buy it already.
reviews.reviewText:
I’ve made everything from beef jerky to chicken wings to hash browns, everything has tasted awesome.
The thing I find the most valuable is that the entire bucket can be thrown into the dish washer. If you’re lazy like I am, this feature alone makes it worth the extra money.
As usual, Ninja delivers.

So far I have mainly done fries. I wish it came with a cook book of some type beside the few pages of what is a few dirctions. I have found that it cooks faster then the prescribed minutes so you have to check on it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Enjoy your favourite fried foods, without the oil and guilt.
reviews.reviewText: My first adventure with an airfryer. So far we have used it for French fries and fried chicken. The food was evenly cooked and very tasty. Cleanup is quite easy, just three parts that go right in the dishwasher and you’re done!

All my friends raved about the air fryer. I decided to get the Ninja air fryer because of the reputable name. This size is perfect and nothing smaller since it still only makes about 1-2 chicken breasts per session. I love the air fryer and all the recipes I find online for free. The best thing about it is not only is it healthy but its super easy to clean. Another thing, I used to warm up chicken nuggets for my kid in the toaster and it would take a while, now I use the air fryer in half the time and it comes out perfect each time.

I was skeptical when I received a recommendation from a friend, but decided to get one. It exceeded my expectations. It make deep fried food without oil. We use it several times a week. Cleanup is a breeze. Love it.

Love it. Pretty easy to work and instructions are easy to understand. Booklet breaks down cooking time and temp for different types of foods which is helpful. The color is a little different than the picture, at least it seems to me. Looked darker or almost black in the picture but is a lighter dark grey, if that makes sense. Which isnt a problem anyway but its something I did notice.

Obsessed. Makes my life so much easier. I am a busy full time employee and full time student. I Don’t have much time to prepare meals for my boyfriend and I but I love this thing. I can typically throw a whole meal in and in 20 minutes or so dinner is ready. Also making jerky in this thing is awesome too.

I love this thing! So easy to use and clean. I eat a lot of frozen and microwavable foods and this is awesome for that. Reheating leftovers is a breeze and food is crispy and tasty. Make sure you preheat it and shake or turn your stuff and get ready for goodness!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great air fryer, but not the color shown!
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love this air fryer it's probably better than the one I have now, but the color really annoyed me because I thought it was black on black like the advertised photos and it was this weird gray color that didn't match my kitchen.

Like the best invention since the microwave! We’ve cooked and heated up a plethora of things using this air fryer and while there is a learning curve, It has worked exceptionally well and I highly recommend

reviews.reviewTitle: Great bit of a learning curve
reviews.reviewText: Great product I purchased as an impulse buy. Have had some big wins (tator tots are crazy good) cooking meats I have yet to master. Would certainly buy again and use this often. Takes up a good bit of counter space

reviews.reviewTitle: Cook like you're cooking on a hot grill. Keep an eye on it.
reviews.reviewText:
if you can't cook with this, Change your name to Leonard and stick head back to
where it was.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product for traveling or dorm
reviews.reviewText: My college student is using this air fryer this summer during his internship which has him living in a hotel for 3 months without kitchen facilities. He loves it [and he is not a big cook], but is making grilled chicken, burgers, tots, pizza rolls - he is planning to bring it back to campus with him in the fall. Very easy cleanup considering he does not even have access to a dishwasher.

Finally bought an air fryer and I love it. Very fast and easy to use. Cleanup is a breeze. Not sure I will ever use our oven again. Now I am excited to cook stuff and take some of the food prep load off my spouse. She will like that!

I gained 10lbs in a week.
Should probably send it back, because it's not helping with my clothes.
I joined a gym instead. Maintaining balance

reviews.reviewTitle: Mothers day present for the wife.
reviews.reviewText: She was curious about one, asked for one for Mothers day. She likes it. Great for chicken wings, Onion rings, tater tots. I don't think she has used it for anything else. Chicken wings are great in this thing.
it seems that the temperature control isn't accurate. either I over cook my food or doesn't end up cooking at all
Love it! Super simple to use and clean! Great purchase! My new "favorite kitchen thing"! Fried foods turn out fantastic...chicken, fish, mozzarella sticks, etc.

Excellent air fryer. Very easy to clean. It works very well and I love that it is electronic. Only downside: the interior part that hold the food doesn’t come out from the exterior holder, so if your are doing small things or French fries for example you have to take the entire drawer out and turn the food on a plate which is not as easy as if you could remove just the interior part no burning yourself

We like it! When purchasing this air frier, I did not realize I was getting so much more! It has controls for a roaster, dehydrator, air frier. This machine is simple to use, easy to clean and our food come out tasting amazing!! I purchased it on-sale.

Bought this bad boy at 2 am when I was taking care of my one month old and needless to say it was a surprise when it showed up. I have used air Fryers before and this o e has great reviews. As of today I have made frozen and homemade sweet potato fries in the 18 hours I have owned it. I’ll crisp up some smoked wings this week and do so e homemade chicken tenders. Easy to clean and operate. A little bigger than I thought it would be.

reviews.reviewTitle: Still getting the hang of this.
reviews.reviewText: I love fried foods, but never ate often. Now with the ninja I am loving the actual taste of foods you would normally fry without all the oils. It is amazing the difference. However still getting a hang of fries in this. But love love love this machine

reviews.reviewTitle: Very hard to control cooking temperature
reviews.reviewText: I have had it since July 3 - used it 6 times and burned 5 out of 6 things. If you use the guide book you will burn everything. You must use your own judgement and watch the food to see how fast it is cooking

The only thing I dislike about this air fryer is the wire rack that you can add into the base because it does not fit no matter how you set it in there. Regardless- I bought another. I use them everyday!

reviews.reviewTitle: This will change your food life for the better
reviews.reviewText: I live on a busy schedule with plenty of hours on my job accumulated. So I could never find time to cook. Air fryers help immensely. With a great quickstart guide, I cook burgers, fish, fries, and more with relative ease! You will be thankful to have this in your life!

Granted, we just got it yesterday so our review is a bit limited- but we have made potstickers, salmon, turkey bacon and crispy breakfast burritos. I am in love, this thing is a game changer. I can’t wait to see what other goodies we can make! I love how quick it made the food, the easy clean up and the flavor of our food.

reviews.reviewTitle: Smokes up the house and stopped working after using 3 times.
reviews.reviewText: Not Happy, smoked up my house while cooking chicken and hamburgers, also after the 3rd use, it had stopped cooking and I turned it off and then heard a peeping sound, it was the Ninja with a code E2 flashing on it. After that it stopped working all together, that is sad after using 3 times and having a little over a month!!!! Would of given no stars if I had the option.

I absolutely love this air fryer. It arrived very quickly. Is definitely worth the money. Great value. It makes are fried foods absolutely delicious. I use it almost everyday. I would definitely recommend.

reviews.reviewTitle: I recommend this product to everyone!
reviews.reviewText: Everything that I have made in the AF had been great. I've done bacon, french fries, pork chops, and chicken. I haven't used any oil since the first time I used it with fries, you can but I don't find a need for it. Love this AF.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quick and guilt free fried foods.
reviews.reviewText: I am loving my Ninja air fryer so far for the quick and tasty items I’ve prepared in it. Fresh or frozen French fries are almost guilt-free. Chicken cooks quickly and remains moist. It even works well for a small casserole dish to be put in the basket. Love it for cooking frozen fish and chicken patties. Frozen coconut shrimp were fantastic. I’m looking forward to trying the dehydrating function and making some fruit chips.

Wasnt sure how well it would work or how my food would taste... But wow!! I love it. My kids love it . Total score buying this. We make chicken nuggies, mini corn dogs, bacon, tater tots and wings so far. Its easy to use easy to clean. My 13 yr old could even use it. I recommend this air fryer :)

reviews.reviewTitle: Use shorter times than you think. Pause and check food until you get used to it.
reviews.reviewText: Love my air fryer! Took me about two tries to get used to it but I finally figured it out! I literally make everything in there now from French fries, to empanadas, to samosas and egg rolls! Highly recommend! I love love fried foods but don’t indulge since it’s obv unhealthy but now i can eat all the crispy foods I want guilt-free!

I love, love, love this air fryer. Its east to use and easy to clean. It only holds enough food for about 2 people but I love it. I haven't used my stove since this air fryer arrived in the mail. The food comes out super crisy like it was fried in oil.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to program, cooks evenly, easy clean up
reviews.reviewText: This is a replacement for my old unit. This airfryer is amazing. We use it almost daily, warming up left overs, cooking meals and snacks. It is easy to clean and cooks quicker than the book. Highly recommend this unit!

This is an extraordinary product. It is the epitome of home cooking. You have never had a pizza roll until you have cooked your rolls in this bad boy. 7 minutes and you're staring at the most perfect, evenly cooked pizza rolls you have ever seen in your life. Lightly crunchy on the outside, perfectly warm on the inside. You can cook virtually anything in this dream machine. Simple to use and easy to clean.

This air fryer just works, I’ve read a few reviews stating there was the smell of rubber while in use, I simply removed the silicone boots from the ceramic crisper plate and I didn’t have the same issue. I would recommend this unit to anyone looking for a good air fryer!
Wonderful addition to our kitchen. Cooks food quickly without heating up the entire kitchen. Chicken comes out moist and juicy, without all the fat of fried chicken. Simple easy cleanup.

Great appliance! Have had for about a month and used with shishito peppers, brussel sprouts, and heating up various foods we wanted to get crispy again. Super easy to use and clean and no issues to speak of.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great appliance but had to return :(
reviews.reviewText: Really liked the product. It was easy to use. Loved throwing the crisper drawer in the dishwasher after use. Air dryers are the way to go! The heating element broke within two weeks so had to return. Went with a different brand.

We love this air fryer! We bought an instant pot and this when we decided to start eating healthier. I can say we use this at least twice as much as the instant pot. Love the air fryer! You can't go wrong with anything Ninja--we have their blenders and food processor and have never had issues. This is easy to use and easy to clean!

reviews.reviewTitle: Veggies in the air fryer taste great
reviews.reviewText: I use this to cook quite a few things but my favorite is veggies. I can finally enjoy eating veggies. I’ve never said that about any vegetable, ever. But in the air fryer even broccoli is delicious.

Bought for my daughter who is legally blind. She has a hard time seeing the letters and buttons to be able to use a product. This air fryer was perfect for her to be able to use and it’s large enough for her family of 4. The kids use it too

Just used my new Ninja and it was LOUD! Fried green tomatoes were great, but I considered returning it because of the noise . I'll keep it, but use it less often than anticipated--I often watch news or like to carry on a conversation while cooking and the noise made that nearly impossible.

This product is the best invention ever for meat. It cooks meat so well. Its amazing that it's not fried. The taste is so crisp. The oil of the meat drains right to the bottom where it is separated through a strainer. Love love love this

reviews.reviewTitle: Air Fryer is the way to go
reviews.reviewText: We have used it almost daily since we bought it. Don't know how we got along without it. No need to heat up the oven any more. Crispy roasted potatoes and vegetables in a matter of minutes. I would compare the result more to oven roasted than deep fried. But it is crispy and you get the flavor and carmelizing benefit of the oil. If you don't have one get one.

This is the one. So easy to use. Food comes out fantastic. I love fried food but my wife hates the mess I make when cooking/how unhealthy it is when traditionally fried. This item solved both problem. Clean up is very simple since cooking basket can go in the dishwasher. Couldn’t be happier with this purchase.....
I LOVE this air fryer. It’s so easy to use and cleanup is simple. We make chicken breasts, French fries, steak tips, veggies, etc and everything turns out great! So happy I decided to buy this unit.
This thing is amazing, it air fries food incredibly fast and perfectly each time. Easy to clean and great functions.

I ordered a different air fryer and had a bad one so not a great experience I was almost turned off by them entirely but decided to try a different one. Not to be totally cheesy but this is everything I could want and more in a kitchen appliance. Things actually cook evenly, crispy. It's so simple to use and I would never lie about dishes, it's very very very easy to clean. I freaking love mine

reviews.reviewTitle: Terrific cooker. Used daily. Thin coating.
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use. Cooks great. Fast. Daily use. Washed very carefully. Notice coating is very very thin and the outer base is peeling a bit. Works so great that I gifted 2 of them so far. Great value for the price. Works as advertised.

i put off getting an air fryer because EVERYONE talked about them an i thought what could another kitcken gadget do that the others couldnt but........ let me tell you. I COOK EVERYTHING in mine i love love love this thing.

reviews.reviewTitle: Best air fryer for the money
reviews.reviewText:
-Loved this air fryer, had a ton of features. -Non stick coating seems to be pretty solid, though with time it will probably wear off(to be expected)
- Dehydrator feature works great, wish there was more room.
-Outer Console works and looks great.

reviews.reviewTitle: The picture look good, but the fries are taste awful..
reviews.reviewText: These potatoes fries look the same as other people made, I am so excited to try it. But I found out they taste terrible and not like fresh fries, no crispy at all, instead the outside turn out to be like a soy paper, yeap, like a sushi lol, but more like plastic,just oddly ...

This was my first air fryer and I'm only disappointed with the round cooking basket, a square basket like in the 5.8 qt. size works out better for me... This one I use for potato wedges fried mushrooms etc and it works very well... GL

I absolutely love this air fryer. It works great, is easy to clean, and has saved me a LOT of time in the kitchen. I went back and forth for 6 months trying to decide if I wanted to spend the money and I am so glad I did. I would highly recommend it!
I would return this but I don't want to go thru return hustle. This is first ninja thing I'm not happy with. It's bulky and smoke so much that is not fun to use.
I've literally tried everything in this to see what it can't do, it has yet to fail.
I love the ability to cook healthier foods, and even showed my 12 year old granddaughter how to safely cook healthy foods. We both love the Ninja.

reviews.reviewText: It's great

I LOVE tater tots. To a ridiculous degree - I LOVE tots. I always order them from restaurants that serve them - and I make them at home sometimes - but it's like comparing apples and...zebras. SO not the same result.

For a while we had a deep fryer and cooking tots that way made them taste great - but was a huge mess and such a hassle that we almost never did it. And then? And then.

We got this air fryer. To say that I was skeptical would be a huge understatement. The idea that hot air could make things as crispy and wonderful as hot oil? Just seems ridiculous. But it is one that is wonderfully, magically true.

The tots that came out were PERFECT. Crunchy on the outside, tender on the inside - absolutely perfect. And? SOOOO much healthier! I am still in awe at how this process works. Shaking in the midst of cooking does seem to be a key component - but the idea that only the small amount of oil/fat in the frozen tots themselves can result in this kind of goodness? Amazing.

We are going to try fried chicken next and I cannot wait to taste it. If I could give this product 6 stars? I absolutely would.

I'm pretty in love with the Ninja brand. Everything I've ever bought by Ninja has been perfection. This air fryer is no exception!

The air fryer is incredibly easy to use - select the type of cooking you want to do, set the timer and start. If you are frying, it's important to pause every once in awhile and shake the food so that it gets crispy all the way around (not just on top). That is seriously the only "trick" with this thing and that's with all air fryers.

We LOVE chicken wings in my house, and we cook them in any number of ways : oven, kamado Joe, fryer. But all of these ways take a lot of planning, babysitting, or clean up. The air fryer gives me another option that is so much easier on clean up, and it's inside so better when the weather encourages me to stay inside to cook. I cooked about 2 pounds of wings in the air fryer at a time. I toss the in 2 tablespoons of oil and cook them for about 25 minutes, stopping at least 3 times to shake thrm around a bit. Afterwards, I toss them in sauce and they're deliciously crispy! Win!

I'm looking forward to trying this as a dehydrator. We have a stand alone dehydrator and I love all things consolidating, so I hope this woorks well. I will say that it will not be capable of dehydrating the same quantity of food as our other one. But, if it works well, then maybe I can get rid of my other appliance!

I completely recommend this product - it would be a challenge to find something easier to use!

reviews.reviewTitle: Makes AMAZING wings (Seriously. Better than deep frying, and way less fussy/messy.)
reviews.reviewText:
I used a sort of proto-air fryer years ago, but it had an arm to automatically stir the food--a good concept, but too much for all but the sturdiest food. (I called that my Healthy French Fry Machine. I call this my Magical Wings Machine.) While having to stop the machine and shake your food a bit seems like it will be a pain in the neck, it was no big deal, and totally worth it.

This works great for freezer fries and other prefab fried foods, but where it is really mind-blowing--actually BETTER than the conventional methods, including deep frying--is for wings.

It makes really amazing wings. We love wings, and I've fried them, wasted a bunch of time with the stupid (overly fussy, not as delicious, probably not any healthier) Alton Brown method for years, and recently returned to frying, though the mess, oil, and attention it requires meant that I was not eating wings as often as I would like.

Making wings in this air fryer is easier, faster (if you do do the slow/double fry, which produces the best results), and way less messy than either method, and the wings are better--totally moist inside and crispy as heck outside. Though the instruction book called for adding a little oil, I don't like to dirty an extra bowl to toss them, so I skip it with great results. I preheat 3 minutes, then add the wings and cook for 20-22 minutes at 390, shaking once about 10 minutes in, and they are PERFECT. This is now that is the only way I'm making wings. A great fringe benefit is that the excess fat and crispy bits collect in the bottom of the basket and you can use them the next day (or, next course) to make chicken fat fries with it.

The only downside is that you can really only do about one grocery store tray of wings (14-16, typically) at a time. This is good news for me, because that's the right amount for the two of us to eat without overdoing it, but that also means I won't be using it for a superbowl party.

In general, that's the only drawback to this machine. It's easy to use, easy to clean, and pretty fracking versatile (you can even do tiny batches of dried foods--this won't replace anyone's dehydrator, but will let you keep that stray apple from going to waste, I guess?). But it is sized for smaller families. Wait, there's one more drawback: it is a space hog, though the footprint is way smaller than most cooking appliances.

But those wings. I forgive it everything for the wings.

Got the air fryer unpacked from the box. Washed the pan and the grate inside prepped my wings and throw them into the air fryer. Set the timer for 26 minutes and let it warm up for 3 minutes before adding the wings. After the three minutes I pulled the pan and the thing wasn’t hot. Put the wings in anyway and let it go until there was 12 minutes left on the timer. Pulled the on again. Still not hot. Stupid thing didn’t even work. Garbage don’t waste your money.

reviews.reviewTitle: Crispy Frozen Fries w/o Oil, what's not to love?!
reviews.reviewText:
I love this Air Fryer for one main reason, Frozen French Fries!! Fries and Gravy, Fries and Honey-mustard, or Fries and Ketchup, Fries are a great food and air frying them is so much healthier.

The unit is large enough to easily crisp 4 servings of fries, or a standard size frozen bag.

This Fryer is easy clean, for frozen french fries!!

My favorite feature of the Ninja air fryer is being able to cook foods that are often fried without using all of the nasty oil - and still being able to obtain that delicate balance of a crisp exterior and and moist interior. This device is perfect for that and to be honest that's mostly what I have used the air fryer for although it does have other options and functions. The quick start guide that comes with the air fryer offers many different suggestions for cooking a variety of foods in a variety of ways. From fruits and vegetables to meats and breaded items, you can air fry, steam, dehydrate and re-heat. I have not tried the dehydrate or steam functions (yet), but when it comes to cooking things like french fries, tater tots, chicken nuggets, (frozen) breaded eggplant - the air fryer is amazing with these things.
The quick start guide offers temperature and cooking guidelines for just about anything you can imagine - you generally cook at a slightly lower temperature than you would in the oven and the food cooks faster because of the hot air that is constantly circulating around the food. Thanks to the non-stick coating of the interior cleanup is a breeze and while the cooking basket is dish-washer safe I always wash by hand to help the non-stick coating last longer.
A few things I'm not crazy about with this machine - it's huge, and it's heavy. It is very tall so may not fit under cabinets if you want to keep it sitting on your counter-top, and it's extremely heavy to lift and move which isn't an issue for a normal/healthy person for for somebody who is elderly or handicapped not a good idea. Also keep in mind that the machine is blowing hot air the entire time, so the sides and bottom of the machine can get very warm - keep this in mind when using it and make sure there's an adequate amount of space between the air fryer and anything around it. My last (minor) complaint - it's loud. Like listening to a loud hair dryer running for a long time which may not bother some, others it may drive them crazy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cuts cooking time down about 80% from oven time!!
reviews.reviewText:
Got my first air fryer and I Love it. I have cooked so much in the first seven days and brag to everyone about how good it is. (My kids are getting tired of me talking about it. P.S. this is my first review ever. But, I thought it was that good!!!

*4 Bake potatoes (15 to 20 minutes). 1 1/2 hour faster than oven. Taste better.
*Hot dog (2 minutes) like it came off grill
*frozen country fried steak (5 minutes)
*Frozen onion rings (3 1/2 minutes)
*frozen French fries (4 to 5 minutes)
Stuffed jalapeños (9 minutes) 1 hour oven
Bacon (4 minutes) crispy
Frozen pickles(3 1/2 minutes)yummy
Reheated a slice of pizza(1 1/2 minute) like it came out of pizza oven. Crispy crust—melted cheese!!

I have done few more items but you can see cooking time is cut way down from oven times. I also check on everything about 3 to 4 minute because it cooks so fast. But
I only do half bag of fries at a time and don’t overload the basket. Because cooking two batches is still faster. Cooking times is shorter than what they list. ( on the peppers I made. I had to cook the peppers and cheese 5 minutes than added the small strip of raw bacon and cooked another 4 minutes. Let sit in basket two minutes before removing it. Because the first batch I had everything on them and had to take the bacon off because it was already done and peppers wasn’t). You just have to play around with timing while getting used it. And I always preheat the unit for three minutes before I add the food to basket. Instructions tell you that also.

Normally I don’t buy a lot of frozen foods but I have realized that most frozen foods that have been precooked cooks very well in the air fryer. Can’t wait to try frozen okra! Still wanting to make fish and homemade chicken fingers. (Oh yeah frozen fingers does great!!!)

Ok cons. Just a little loud. Sounds like a hair dryer blowing in kitchen. But I can live with that. Hope this helps.

reviews.reviewTitle: Frozen food tastes so much better than oven frying!
reviews.reviewText: I got this because my daughter loves hers, so I had to give it a try. I haven't used the roast or dehydrate settings yet, but the other two (air fry and reheat) work great! Fries, jalapeno poppers, Brussels sprouts, and anything with a crispy coating taste so much better than oven baking, and they have a better crunch. I love the reheat setting. It's so much more flavorful and crispy than reheating anything in the microwave. My only warning is that you should check the food more often than they suggest - every five minutes rather than 15, because I've found things sometimes get done a lot more quickly than recipes and the included cookbook says. And reheating only takes two or three minutes for some things. Definitely worth the investment!

So I bought this at Walmart (sorry Amazon) but based on reviews here. I love this air fryer. I don't notice any toxic smells or things flapping around. I've been heavy meat keto for almost a year. So far I've tried rib eyes, New York strips and bacon. They have all turned out famously. The clean up is a snap. There is no smoking or grease smell. I don't know how I ever lived without it.

Got my Ninja about 2 weeks ago, not a day since where I haven't used it, it's that good! I tried another brand just before this, the house brand from a well know national electronics store chain, and no comparison. Much better than using the oven, especially in the summer, and to me, baking things that are traditionally deep fried just don't taste right from a conventional oven or toaster oven which has an "oven taste". Even though an air fryer, any air fryer doesn't deep fry food of course, you do get better results than in just the plain old oven. You can't get deep fried taste without a deep fryer, that's physics, but air fryers, and especially the Ninja does a great job at getting closer to real fried taste, and helps to spritz your food with oil first, as the air fryer will heat that oil much faster than a plain old oven while it's on the food, and that really helps initially crisping things up and browning. Pork loin chops in 10 minutes, ocean perch in 6 minutes. Makes frozen fries and onion rings better than the oven and quicker. Good on home made fries as well, great on chicken wings.

This one (4 quart) has an 8 inch round cooking surface area, good for 1 person, or 2 if snacks. The one I took back (5.8 quart) had a 10 inch round area, but in either if more than 1 type of food, have to do in batches.Usually fries first, then meat here, keep fries warm, and while the fries are cooking and you prepare your meat, fries are done! Usually around 7 - 10 minutes depending on french fry thickness and if frozen. I start on 400 degrees after preheating 3 minutes, and then reduce the temp down to 350 or 325 later if browning too fast.

The Ninja has a crisper plate that goes in the basket, instead of another basket in basket, much easier to clean. Easy digital controls and display. Only small com is you have to press the pause button when you take the basket out to shake of flip food, or it will keep running. The one I took back, had to support with the other hand, and push the basket back in so hard almost topples, and had a wonky display and countdown. The Ninja basket slides in easily.

Ninja has great quick responsive customer service, even on Facebook, as I had a question about mine. This one is definitely a keeper. This one goes down to temperatures like 105 or 150 to dehydrate, and will allow you to set the time for several hours in the dehydrate mode, instead of only 60 minutes in the other modes. Also uses a slower fan speed to dehydrate so it doesn't blow drying small food all around. Most other air fryers only go down to 250-300 and 60 minutes max, unless you get certain Ninja Foodi's. I have a friend with a Foodi, great machine if in your budget, and another friend with a Ninja that steams, slow cooks, and has "stovetop" whatever that is, but they both love them. Also, if you get yours from somewhere other than Amazon, make sure it has the extra rack so you can put 2 layers to dehydrate, instead of 1, and may also help with bacon. Versions from some stores don't have that extra rack. With an air fryer, any air fryer, don't let how many quarts mislead you. Unless you're roasting a thick piece of meat, or baking a cake, food can't overlap or be on top of each other to truly get the benefit of air frying.

This was my second air fryer...the food we cooked was very good however we did notice the unpleasant odor while cooking the foods..my husband questioned the rubber feet on the crisping plate as soon as we took it out of the box ..so he removed them...no more smell..I will just have to be extra careful not to scratch the basket now that the rubber is gone ..ninja needs to rethink putting rubber of any kind in an appliance that cooks food

I can't be more happier with this air fryer it does everything so well. I haven't tried to dehydrate anything yet but all else is so fine. The food all taste and cooks so good in it. The manual comes with some quick easy recipes. This product makes me forget about the micro wave because when you reheat chicken or your air fried meats they don't get that gummy or taste doesn't change and that's a good thing. The air fryer doesn't dry your meats out everything is so jucie. I had another brand air fryer a cheaper don't know the name brand and the temp. control didn't work properly stopped going to 400 only would get up to 265 so back it went. Now with the Ninja brand and all is well now. There are so many other brands on the market but ninja stands by their brand and have good support too. So if you are in the market for an air fryer and it is just 2 to 3 people in your house hold then you can't go wrong with this model ninja. Happy buyer.

Look, here's the thing - this thing is amazing. There's no ifs ands or buts about it. It's quick, efficient, and extremely user-friendly. I'm still giving this product 5 stars but the only thing I have to say that is negative is that I wish I could cook more in the bin, but that's about it. I bought this product about a week ago and have used it at least five of those days and it has worked great - food cooks EVENLY, the fries (both frozen and homemade) were crisp and enjoyable, and the wings were cooked perfectly. When I cooked these in the oven or in an oil-based frier I found there were uneven heating areas where some places would cook at the right temp but others wouldn't or with the frier the food turns out soggy and it's extremely difficult to clean. The Ninja air fryer is aboslutely none of that. If you had your doubts like me at first, you can be safe knowing it's worth the money. I hope you enjoy your food as much as I have enjoyed mine.

Everything turns out better and cooks quicker in the air fryer. Seriously, the oven has nothing on this thing. Perfect for chicken wings, fried pickles, broccoli, or leftovers. This is a great quality gadget, doesn't take up much space, is very powerful (so cook less than the recommended time if you're looking at internet air frying recipes), and easy to clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: Roasted some root vegetables--easy and quick clean up!
reviews.reviewText: My friends had been raving about air frying and I had no idea what that would even look like so when I saw this, I thought I'd try it. I found a recipe online (there are plenty of recipes and videos to guide you) and used the roasting setting to roast some root vegetables. I was really happy at how well the food turned out. Highly recommended for people trying to lose weight, looking to reduce their use of oil, and to save time!

I love this thing!! We have made fries, sweet potato fries, chicken nuggets, and fries green beans this far. Everything turned out perfect! I don’t even use spray oil because it really does not need it... I’m frying oil free!!
Love the ceramic coating, easy clean up. We use the ninja more than our larger air fryer. Wings come out great in this one.
This is a great product. i was skeptical but my friends had great success with cooking in it. no oil needed for fried-like food. no mess and less stress. i would recommend this product to others.

Received my air fryer today. Followed the cleaning instructions before use. After reading some reviews about burning plastic smells I noticed that there are plastic bumpers on the crisper tray legs. I removed them. It doesn’t take away from anything anyway. I cooked two steaks inside of the fryer and I must say that they turned out great. The only thing you have to do is pay attention to the cooking times. I was aiming for a medium rare but got a well done after about 15 minutes, so pay attention to the cooking times check as you go It’s all about trial and error with this thing. I honestly love this air fryer.

Absolutely love our Ninja! One of the best purchases I’ve made in a long time. It’s very easy to use and to clean. Also cooks quickly. We live in Florida so it’s a huge plus that we no longer have to heat up the oven to cook. I even made Cornish hens in this thing and they came out great!
We’ve had it for six weeks and loved it but now the handle is falling off. For the price, that’s unacceptable.

Best money I've ever spent on kitchen do dads. This thing is awesome and easy to clean ! (bonus!) it is trail and error when it comes to cooking certain things from frozen. I haven't had any luck with hand battered items. Best bacon I've ever had!

This thing is amazing. I forgot to pack lunch last night. So I pulled out some very frozen chicken thighs put it in for 25 mins on fry and by the time it was ready to leave to work in the morning it was all cooked perfectly crispy without all the grease and oil.

My mom gifted this to my husband for Christmas, and it has been the most amazing and perfect gift for our busy life style!

Having an impatient 2yo can be tricky when you are trying to cook some chicken nuggets! I found that putting them in the air fryer for 1/2 the time the bag calls for cooks them perfect and helps a lot!

Also... the 7-minute bacon?! TO DIE FOR!!

reviews.reviewTitle: So versatile and totally worth it! Cleaning it a breeze
reviews.reviewText: Love how simple it is to clean after making things like bacon in it. We cook everything from cookies to garlic bread and full meals also. SOLID in construction and quality. Love it!

The product arrived in good condition but I paid extra for the gift wrap option and found out the gift arrived in Christmas themed wrapping with a Christmas themed gift card. I would not recommend paying extra for the gift wrap option.

reviews.reviewTitle: Time saver. Loved it loved it love it.
reviews.reviewText:
This product is sooooo good. This item is one of my favorite item in my kitchen. I have very good experience with Ninja Air frier. Time saver, healthy food is ready within few mins.
I have tried, vegetable, roast chicken breast, potato bake, chicken wings.
Loved it.
You won’t regret.
I received this for Christmas and have used it a few times already! Everything has turned out great but I have found the times to be a little off from what the book suggested.
Love, love this product! I have had this less than a week. I have cooked homemade potato wedges, pork chops and chicken. All excellent! I have teens and it is easy to use and clean. Awesome!!

Simple, not expensive, compact, efficient, easy to clean and maintain, looks cool, like all Ninja products!

Guys, please, add a dedicated "Preheat" button! Thanks! :D

Worth the price. Easy to clean and comes with helpful guide book. So far it actually cooks a little faster than the guidebook and recipies say. Tip: don't try to cook shrimp the very first time you use it, frozen French fries will turn out much better.
Great for french fries! Really taste like it was fried with oil. Takes around 20 minutes to make the fries. Haven't tried for anything else yet but so far so good!
Easy to operate and food is ready in just few minutes!
I have never had a ninja product I didn't love. This is no exception. I absolutely love this product. It works so so well and everything is SO delicious!

reviews.reviewTitle: Can never again go without one!
reviews.reviewText: I received this air fryer as a Christmas gift from my mother-in-law. I am in love with it! I have made french fries, buffalo cauliflower, keto cheese sticks... the list goes on and on. It's a must have, in my opinion. Fast and efficient, easy to clean!
Best air fryer I've had. So quick and convenient...real time saver.

The strong chemical smell does not go away. It gives us headaches and causes us to feel light headed and sick. I have washed it multiple times. Others suggested letting the chemicals burn off. I ran it on high for 20 min at least 10 times and the smell is the same. It's junk. I'm not eating food cooked in this thing.

Bought this for my moms birthday and shes used it almost every week. Cleaning isnt to bad and it heats things up very well like pizza and Kolaches. The only thing i noticed is the pan isnt all that to big so if your cooking for more than 2-3 people youll have to do a double batch of fries. But over all good produce.
Love the way Ninja recreated this airfryer to one single component. I got burned when the other brand broke from the handle and dropped hot oil all over my leg

reviews.reviewTitle: Love this product! Don't know what I did without it.
reviews.reviewText: I've been using it every day since it was delivered. Everything turns out delicious!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Air Fryer and attractive design
reviews.reviewText: I own this particular model & so far i really like it I have no complaints I just wish the basket was larger So I can add more stuff.

reviews.reviewTitle: Just died after a few months
reviews.reviewText: Bought this at Walmart, same exact thing. Had been working great. Loved it. Then out of the blue went to turn it on and wouldn’t power on at all. Tried different outlets because there’s just no way, but yeah it’s dead. Loved it while it worked.
Gets hot

reviews.reviewTitle: So easy to use & clean up after use. Incredible flavor when cooking meats, chicken, and vegetables.
reviews.reviewText: I made Itailian sausages came out like I cooked them on the grill. I also made a large chicken breast it was incredible and so juicy.
Food comes out great! Moist and delious !

reviews.reviewTitle: Amazing!!! Best thing since the microwave!
reviews.reviewText: I have never done a review but this thing is amazing!!!! I am single guy I seldom cook I just love to bbq but bbqing takes time. The ninja fryer it's so easy to use even a 14 year old can use it.
I use my air fryer at least a couple times a week. So convenient!

I love my air fryer , cooks my food to an crisp perfection. Without all the grease I even reheat left overs in it to keep the texture of the food .. because the microwave with change that and make it soggy
This product is really easy to use. The only thing I don't like it makes really loud noise.
Yes, it is expensive and more than what I wanted to pay, but the benefits are amazing. Does take time to get used to it and master it, but well worth it. 5-Stars.
Simple easy as advertised. Nice quality construction, great product
Grift for my sister family they love it easy for the kids to use

reviews.reviewTitle: The ceramic coat got scratched off
reviews.reviewText: Only used three or four times, and the ceramic coat got off. I used it very carefully. I don’t know if this is normal and if this still safe to use
Convenient and easy to use!
Excellent. I've had other air fryers which broke for one reason or another. This one has been very durable and very easy to clean. I use it on a daily basis.
Best invention. Love this machine ❤️
This air-fryer is amazing! Love it !!! 100% recommended!!!
Me agrado
easy to use
Very tasty, thanks, quality
Food is cook as promised

Very strong chemical smell. I didn't cook anything in it, so I'm not sure how well it works. It had a very strong plastic/ rubber/ paint thinner type of smell when I opened it. I ran it on empty on my patio twice for 30 minutes each time, and the smell improved but did not go away. We could still smell the chemical smell even with it outside. We specifically purchased this one over others because it had a porcelain coated surface which is considered safer than teflon type coatings. I wouldn't feel comfortable serving my family food out of something that smells like this. Even if the smell went away, it doesn't seem like anything your food touches should smell like this. Definitely returning. Disappointing because I also had to return a Ninja blender recently for not working properly. I loved my old Ninja blender, but now I'm considering avoiding the brand altogether.

I bought this for a quicker/easier way to roast vegetables, but it has proven to be a very useful appliance. I've made sweet potato fries, roasted Brussels sprouts, chicken wings and breaded fish. I tried the Brussels sprouts first, spraying them with a little olive oil, and using salt and pepper; i was a little nervous at using the air fryer for the first time, so i didn't leave them in as long as the directions suggested and they didn't get as crispy as i wanted. When i make them again, i will follow the recipe suggestion on time. I was better with the sweet potato fries; they mostly turned out cripsy, again, with a simple spritz of olive oil. The chicken wings turned out perfect. i dusted them in flour and seasoning. The wings were cut up in pieces; the smaller pieces took less than 7 minutes, with me turning them over once, before they were done. The little drummettes took about 9 minutes. I breaded the fish in panko and gave it a spray of oil; perfectly tasty.

I made fairly small amounts of the food and it cooked quickly and evenly. The tray has space for much more, if you were cooking for more than one or two that I was. I think it would take longer and would involve shaking/flipping food more, though, if you filled the tray.

The air fryer itself makes a noise similar to a microwave. It's noticeable but not overly loud. The machine continues to run when you open the tray to check on the food; you can also pause it when you pull out the tray to shake or flip food, and then resume when you insert the tray again. The outside of the machine, and the counter below and cupboards above -- no noticeable heat.

I love that the kitchen/house did not smell like the food i was making. Brussels sprouts can leave quite an aroma when roasting in the oven, but the house remained fairly aroma free after all the different things i made.

And lastly, cleanup was super easy. I just used a soft, nonabrasive pad to clean in the sink.

Very happy with this purchase, and as i only cook for one or two at a time, this is perfect, a better option than heating up my oven for just a chicken breast or a handful of fries.
Too heavy for me. But...I gifted it to my friend for Christmas. Don't refund my money.

reviews.reviewTitle: It came with the defective crisper plate and they are not able to send me another do not buy
reviews.reviewText:
I am beyond disappointed in this product.
the crisper plate that came with it has a metal pin in the center of it and it is not covered like all the pictures show so I contacted Amazon and they said there was nothing they could do to replace it for me so it makes it nearly impossible to use the plate.
I regret ever buying it and really hope that I am able to help another customer that considers this product .
it is entirely useless without the crisper plate

This is my second air fryer, well made. But the issue is there is no inner basket, with air frying you have to flip the food 2-3 times during the cook cycle. This has no inner basket so when you try to flip the food, all the oil/grease also flips, not a good design.

reviews.reviewTitle: After "extensive" contemplation, I think I'll stick with the deep fryer and a vat of vegetable oil
reviews.reviewText:
Or, if forced to capitulate to the undocumented household nutritionist use the T-Fal Actifry we also have at hand. So far as I am concerned this Ninja thing is all about french fries and I don't care whether the opening gambit is frozen or fresh cut. Either way, it doesn't measure up. To start with the user has to monitor the cooking time to make sure the basket is regularly jostled and if the amount in the basket is anywhere published capacity, it is not going to matter how much shaking was going on. A goodly portion of the fries are either not going to get crispy or the bottom layer on the crisper is going to be substantially deeper fried than the remainder.

Conversely, the T-Fal has an agitator wand so you can set it and forget it. Yeah, there are other bells and whistles with the Ninja like the convenient temperature and timer controls, the fan is not as noisy as the T-Fal, It has a roasting feature and admittedly, if you're frying chicken pieces it doesn't beat them to a pulp (BUT you do have to pause the process and manually turn the pieces) however when I think air fryer I'm only interested in how well it handles french fries and the Ninja currently sits as my fourth choice behind deep frying, range top frying pan and the aforementioned T-Fal.

If I'm going to dehydrate anything, it's because I fried it too long.

reviews.reviewTitle: One of the few products I would definitely buy again.
reviews.reviewText: There is a bit of a learning curve when learning to airfry. There are very few "reliable" time/temp resources available. However using the Ninja Air fryer is very intuitive and you quickly get the hang of creating cooking times/temps for new food items items you've never cooked before. The airfrying results you get with the Ninja are remarkable. I have owned other brands and they didn't perform near as well. The only negative I can think of, is the fry basket on the Ninja is smaller than some others. It is definitely made for cooking for two people. Nevertheless the Ninja works so well I could care less about that. By the way, the ceramic coating is remarkably easy to clean. I've airfried pork chops, hamburgers, wings, brussel sprouts etc and nothing sticks to it. A wipe with a soapy sponge cleans it right up.

reviews.reviewTitle: I never knew I needed an air fryer until I used one and now I love it
reviews.reviewText:
This is my very first air fryer and it has been a bit of a learning curve for me. First of all you have to figure out the way to put your food in there because if it doesn't get the air around it doesn't get the fried crispness. I've also learned that it Cooks more like a convection oven and cooks much more quickly than your standard oven. You can absolutely overload it and I can cook most of a dinner in this thing if I time it right. I have preschool children and we do a lot of chicken nuggets and fish sticks and french fries. This has been an awesome kitchen tool, it even cooks faster than my toaster oven and takes less time to preheat.

It looks like a little space pod sitting on your counter. It's user-friendly as far as learning how to cook and if you read the instructions first you avoid a lot of mistakes. Take it from someone who didn't think I needed to read them. Last night I made 'fried chicken' tenders using panko bread crumbs and it was outstanding. It's super easy to clean and even says that it's dishwasher safe. I wouldn't want to eroad at the non-stick finish so I hand wash and it cleans up in a minute. This is kind of one of those things you didn't know you needed until you had it. I love making chicken cutlets and this is my new easy way to do it. Wonderful appliance.

Bought this air fryer after watching a TV segment of commonly prepared healthful food items.
I also bought three air fryer cookbooks, and reviewed numerous other online.

THE GOOD
Comes well packaged, very attractive unit. Instruction manuals are straightforward. basket size is typical from what I've read, and the crisper insert fits well. Exterior controls are easily set, and not complicated.

THE BAD
I tried zucchini, apples, regular potatoes and sweet potatoes. In all cases, I followed recipes to the T, and did periodic cooking checks and shaking to help avoid hot spots. I used high heat canola, while also experimenting with olive and vegetable oils--and sprays.

Every item I cooked turned dark and borderline burned, before ever turning crispy-- regardless of method.
Taste was average, and I found myself wondering why I was hassling with this-- vs. using my tried and true toaster oven.

I know all the true believers will assume I didn't do something right. As for me, I'm not a believer.
I'll stick with the basics.

I’ve been hearing a lot about how great air fryers are, and was told I had to get one. This one was recommended by a friend, but I really wish I had done more research. This particular brand is very very loud. It’s louder than my microwave, it’s louder than my central air-conditioner (which I thought was loud), It’s loud enough to disrupt watching television in the living room while it’s on in the kitchen. And apparently, they’re not all like this. A friend of mine bought one that is so quiet you can’t even hear when it’s on. This one is a little bit pricier too. You can find the same size, comparable value, at a local Costco for a little less than half the price (is it good? I don’t know that, but worth a shot).

I love it so much because it cooks fast. It is easy to use and easy to clean. Good price too. The food is cooked evenly. It is not necessary to spend several hundred dollars for an air fryer. This one is good enough. It is recommended to everyone who hasn’t used an air fryer before.

Being an optimist, it is not common for me to show a skeptical side but air frying made me find my skeptical side real quick. Over the years, I have reviewed many nutrition supplements, exercise equipment, here on Amazon and every year, I use the summer to try something new in my diet/exercise. This late spring/early summer, I decided to try a very basic style of eating. It is not fully Keto or Carnivore but it might look like it to some people. My main meats to eat this summer are Ribeye steaks and non-fatty fishes (sorry salmon, you will be back in fall and winter).

A friend of mine has an air fryer and was going on vacation. I asked if I could borrow their air fryer for a few days. The first thing I threw in it was homemade onion rings and they were great as expected. I think I was hesitant to try a meat in it. I wanted to look at it a lot like a deep fryer. That's where I was making my mistake. It is nothing like a deep fryer. My onion rings were golden and had zero grease on them. The next day I took the chance and put two 12 ounce Ribeyes in it. I seasoned them with Montreal Steak seasoning and used a little avocado oil to add some healthy fats. I ate both of them! My wife came home from work and wanted to know where her steak was. I blamed the puppy. I still had my friend's air fryer for 5 more days but I went ahead and ordered this one by Ninja. The Ninja is making the steaks even better. I do not know if maybe my friend's air fryer has been used a lot or is not as good as the Ninja or what but I lost that skepticism.

I tried this Ninja with pollock lightly breaded with Panko. My only complaint was I could not fit more in the basket! One of my concerns was how long the air fryer would take to make Ribeyes and to make my favorite white fishes. I have used it so much, I can tell you exactly how long they take.

For 1.5 pound of Ribeye, it could be two 12 ounce, it could be three 8 ounce (if you can squeeze them in), I do 7 minutes on 390, flip them for another 7-8 minutes and they're perfect.

For 1.5 pound of lightly breaded white fish, I put it on 360 for 5 minutes, flip them for another 6-7 minutes or until the breading is golden and they're perfect.

I have a Zojirushi grill in the kitchen and I still love it for sandwiches and breakfast items but this Ninja has taken over my biggest and most important meals. Like most, I am not satisfied with it just cooking my favorite meals. I tried some fresh broccoli with seasonings in it and it was really good. They need to make one of these with two baskets in it!

Here are the only tips I have used and would recommend to others that are similar to me. I use avocado oil in any of the foods I cook in it. My skeptical friends are saying "I thought it was oil-less?" The oil is going to get you more nutrients and avocado oil has a 500 degree smoke point, so it keeps it from smoking. The first time I used my friend's air fryer, I did not realize how hot the top of it was going to get and left it just below a cabinet. Well, the candy bar in the cabinet melted. That was my karma for buying the candy bar in the first place! Be sure to follow the directions when it comes to preheating. You just set it for the temperature you are going to be cooking at for 3 minutes without the food in it. The only extra I ordered for it was the 5 skewers double rack and it was just a little over ten dollars. My wife and I both like the steak, bell peppers, onions, on the skewers and it makes those better than the outdoor grill does.

Best product I have bought in several years. I have not tried the roasting, dehydrating or reheating, not that there is any food left to reheat! I think I know what I am getting some people for their birthdays.

I can't say enough about this air fryer. We were wasting a lot of oil trying to deep fry French fries in peanut oil. Of course we all know how bad deep frying is even if you change it after 3-4 times of frying. The fries we made in this air fryer were better tasting than deep fried and plus you only use about a tbsp. of oil such as avocado or olive oil. Much more healthier. I also made fried pickles and they were so good! This will take the place of my deep fryer and most of my pan fried and roasting in the oven. It's easy to use and clean. I did remove the small rubber grommets that were on the bottom of the crisper pan though. Can't wait to try the dehydrate option for my beef jerky recipe!

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use, easy to clean
reviews.reviewText: I got this at Christmas. So far I have done bacon (repeatedly, much more convenient than frying), wings (so easy and my husband loved them) and hard boiled eggs (turned out perfectly without having to mess with my pressure cooker). The 4 qt is a nice size for the two of us, and the price is midway between the expensive models and models I thought may not be the best quality. The basket does not have slits for venting which one reviewer said is nice, any grease is contained within the basket. I agree.

This is my first experience with an air fryer and I'm so incredibly impressed I'm telling everyone I know to pick this thing up. There was a bit of a learning curve, as in I regular use EVOO spray when I cook, but after fries coming out a bit too crisp (more like potato chips) I realized the smoke point was too low and I ordered some Avocado oil spray and gave that a shot. AMAZING and a world of difference. The fries, as expected, were great. With a light spray of avocado oil they came out like boardwalk fries, without the greasy residue on your fingers. Wings are tender and juicy on the inside and perfectly crispy on the outside. Steak, (STEAK!) Came out perfect. Medium to medium rare on the inside. Zucchini done for a shorter time comes out steamed with a bit of glazed browning. All the vegetables I've done have come out great. You can cook them to your desired crispness, or cook them a shorter time for more of a steamed finish. Frozen gyoza came out great. Cleanup is SO EASY. I also ordered one of the accessory kits on Amazon and they fit perfect (as long as the accessories are less than 7inches they'll fit fine). I'm so impressed and I have no idea how I've gone this long without one of these. I spray everything with a bit of avocado oil and perfection without all the grease and cleanup. Highly recommend.

New to me, so I experimented beyond the suggested brochure recommended settings. Example: Frozen fries at 16 minutes? Crunch burnt. Try 9 minutes at 390 degrees.
Thawed hamburger patties? Do 4 minutes for medium juicy. Frozen pork chops? Go 14 minutes. Cut up fries from raw potatoes? PAM spray and go 15 minutes.
As another poster said, I’m using this FAR more than I thought as I have a microwave, toaster/convection oven, regular oven and a deep fryer plus a indoor grill. They all have a purpose but the hot air fryer has surprised me on how often I’m experimenting and using it. But, do test for yourself.

It is convenient as it heats up quickly. That and it is easy to clean after use. I am disappointed that it isn't the quick easy cooking method I expected. It does save time in the heating and clean aspect of cooking.

Love home-made extra crispy buffalo wings in my oil fryer but never liked the mess they produced. I mean when you add frozen, ice covered wings to very hot oil, it creates somewhat of a volcanic explosion of hot spattering oil that goes everywhere, yuck. So I tried this and I'm very impressed. The frozen wings came out very crispy with no mess at all. Here's all I did: Cleaned the unit, dipped each frozen wing in canola oil, then cooked them for about 30 minutes in total but pulled them out every 8 minutes or so to shake them a bit, then pulled them out and tipped the whole fry basket into my hot sauce bowl BUT you shouldn't do this as the ice covering the wings was now melted and lots of water also poured into my sauce and diluted it. Next time I'll just grab each wing with some tongs to keep the water out. Anyway, I think I'll be making wings on a regular basis now as the mess has gone away. Actually you still air frying these in oil at the same temperature but it is just a thin film of oil rather than a deep pool of oil. Very impressive.

I didn't want an air fryer. Then my husband talked to the guys at work. They swore by this product. I fully understand why. Big, but not too big. Loud, but not too loud. And I can make a healthy, delicious dinner in 30 mins. Product was exactly as described. Very easy to clean. I have used it every day.

reviews.reviewTitle: The Air Fryer of my dreams!
reviews.reviewText: So so pleased with this product! I had bought another Air Fryer a few months ago and ended up reselling it because it did nothing better than my small gas over, which cooks pretty fast. I was having some serious missing out, seeing everyone rave about their Air Fryers and so when one of my good friends told me she bought this Ninja 4 QT and LOVED it, I figured for $100 I could try again. SOOOOOO thrilled that I did!! I have only had it one day but have made several things, homemade croutons, crispy broccoli, reheating my pizza and I am just getting started! Great size (I am one person but let me tell you how much broccoli I can eat by myself :) ), and super easy to clean. Love the accessories that come with it (crisper basket and drying rack)- I feel like those are key. I don't think it is THAT loud, I mean you can hear it but I was still able to hear my TV in the other room over it. Digital display is great, super easy to use. I am just so happy I have found my true match in Air fryers! It is large, but it is a 4qt so I didn't expect it to be small. Can't wait for all my cooking!
It's so easy to use. My husband specifically requested this for his birthday and he ABSOLUTELY LOVES IT! The food it makes is incredible tasting and so much healthier!!!! Thank you!!

Got this for Christmas! I was a little skeptical about an air fryer. The idea of fried food that is healthier was great, however, I didn't have high hopes. I have a convection oven which I like but it never made fries, oven rings or faux fried chicken that was anything special. Let me tell you, the ninja air fryer did the trick. I was hooked from the very first cook. It is outstanding! We use it everyday or I should say every meal.
There is a learning curve, but very easy after you get it down. We watched YouTube videos and learned a lot.
Now the hubby and I play fight over who is cooking dinner. Lol

This Air Fryer changed my whole cooking experience.

I had always been skeptical about getting one because I couldn’t comprehend flouring chicken and being able to air fry it.

After reading reviews, I finally decided on this one. One of the best purchases I’ve made in recent memory. It has changed my cooking experience completely.

ᴄʟᴇᴀɴᴜᴘ:
First of all, the cleanup is effortless. Everything I’ve cooked wiped right out with soapy water and a sponge with NO scrubbing.

ᴀɪʀ ғʀʏɪɴɢ:
I have fried chicken wings, and home made chicken strips...battered. To do this, you must buy a spritzer and use it to spray olive oil on the chicken, just enough to glaze the flour. That’ll fry it crispy and golden brown.
My wife made fried green tomatoes (so good) that tasted just like gramma’s used to. Delicious.
I’ve fried battered peaches.
When Air Frying, I recommend setting a timer for half the time you’ve set your AF timer so that you can pause at the halfway mark and flip your food over so that it cooks evenly. I noticed it cooks a bit faster on top than on the bottom. But when it’s finished, it’s crispy and flavorful. This will now and forever be my first option for frying. I think I’m going to buy another one for additional capacity.

ʀᴏᴀsᴛ:
I haven’t “roasted” anything yet but I have baked some cinnamon rolls in it. They turned out fantastic. This AF can do just about anything.

ᴅᴇʜʏᴅʀᴀᴛᴇ:
I’ve dehydrated fruit (peaches and strawberries) and I’ve made beef Jerky. All came out good. Very good. As a matter of fact, the beef jerky I made was the best I’ve ever tasted. I’m not just saying that. The way I seasoned and marinated it overnight made it really flavorful throughout. The more I chewed, the more flavor I got. Season some eye of round with seasoning salt and six-pepper seasoning. Blend some Worcestershire sauce and steak chop marinade together. Put your seasoned eye of round in the marinade and let it sit overnight in the fridge. Dehydrate for 6-7 hrs. Perfection.

ʀᴇʜᴇᴀᴛ:
Bottom line? This AF reheats food and it tastes as good if not better than it did originally. Chicken and pizza especially. No more rubbery chicken and pizza with the warmed-up-outta-the-fridge taste. It tastes like it was just made when reheated in the Ninja AF101.

My microwave is giving my AirFryer the side eye. My oven isn’t too fond of the situation either.

At the end of the day? I’m actually looking for excuses to use it. I’m cooking everything in it.

The Ninja oven air fryer is whole new experience.
We are senior retired citizens, and we are a family of two.
We have health issues and we have to be careful in what we eat.
I"m the cook in the family and I like different cooking appliances .
The air fry is appliance that you need to experience with at first
and not to get disappointed in.
I got a oven air fryer cook book and use it as my guide line in
oven cooking temp and timing . I have been trying frozen french fries,
potato nuggets and chicken nuggets, there was no oily taste,
they all came out great.
I'm keeping a oven fryer dairy in what I'm cooking.
So using my indoor grill, George Foreman and my microwave,
I'm all set in having dinner done in ten to fifteen minutes.
Of course that depends on what I'm cooking.
For first time cookers, start off checking every 4-5 mins
until you see your meal that you are cooking is done and
write down oven temp and cooking time in what you were cooking.
I'm very please this Ninja.

So far, this is the best item out 3 different branded items.
The other two was like broken in few days or started lose its tefal coating.
However, this ninja air fryer works great, and I don't have to worry about losing coating on base unit.
This item has some feature to cook different ways. The food wasn't dry like previous two items.

If you buy this item, please run the item without food like 20-30 min with maximum temperature.
At the first time of trial, this unit started to make some smokes and plastic smells. This smell and smoke were gone
after using 2nd time.
