This thing really works! I mean it will literally turn frozen, in bag fries into fast food quality fries like some kind of crazy Star Trek deal. (Makes me wonder why fast food places have not adopted this tech?!) If you don't feel like upgrading to the Ninja Foodi you will have zero regrets going with the air fryer unit.

reviews.reviewTitle: I LOVE THIS DANG AIR FRYER!!!!
reviews.reviewText:
Let me get the formalities out of the way. This is a great product and I'm very satisfied with it so far. That being said, this absolutely is a game changing appliance. I would go as far as to say, with some design changes, this could easily replace the microwave. I watched a ton of YouTube videos on air fryers before choosing the Ninja. I already have the Ninja Auto IQ blender and use it almost daily.

I've never owned an air fryer but in many of the YT videos, when frying chicken or fish all of the youtubers spray oil and flip the meat halfway through the process. This appears to be necessary because the air fryers don't cook the meat evenly on the bottom and the meat must come into direct contact with the air from the fan located at the top of the appliance and will usually result in chalky spots of batter that remain uncooked. I have found with the Ninja air fryer this is unnecessary. I thought it was the wattage but when I look at other air fryers most have a high wattage than the Ninja which is only 1550 watts., I've seen as high as 1800 watts. So it has to be Ninja's design. Also, I noticed most Youtubers were cooking fried chicken for example for 20 minutes or longer. My first batch, pictured with the Ninja, came out great but had a slightly burnt taste, it was good but could be better but that was because I cooked it for 22 min on 390!!! I also stopped it at 12 minutes and flipped the pieces even though they were golden with no floury spots. For my second batch, I brought it down to about 18 minutes and only paused the air fryer to check them and gave them a shake just in case any were sticking. The end result was much better and close to perfect. Also, I failed to mention that the device doesn't really generate that much heat and doesn't stay hot like a deep fryer or cast iron skillet. I live in a small apartment I did have a tiny problem with it setting off the smoke alarm. Not because it puts out tons of smoke but mainly because where I placed this on my counter was near the smoke detector. Moving it to another area solved this issue. Most importantly clean up is a breeze, no scrubbing, no grease to empty or store. After air frying there's maybe a tablespoon of oil at the bottom and I honestly think it's the olive oil that I dabbed on...I really don't think this thing needs any oil. Rinsing it off with warm water is all it really needs, no splatter...nothing. This is what kept me frying things to be honest, I hated the mess and cleanup.

Now on to what I think is the most underrated feature on this air fryer REHEAT!!! If you've every gone to the fridge and grabbed a piece of leftover pizza, fish or chicken, if you warm it up in the microwave, it's always soggy, it's something we've learned to live with. I took my chicken wings from the day before put them in the air fryer on reheat for 3 MINUTES.....I SAID 3 MINUTES!!! and like magic the wings were crispy like they were right out of the oil. French fries from the day before...same thing crispy and fresh tasting. Fried catfish perfect. In short, I don't run out and buy every gizmo I come across like make your own sodas at home or a bread maker. Not that these aren't great but I have to weigh the versatility of the device, how much soda am I really going to make? Do I really eat that much bread? The Ninja AF-101 was a great choice because it does more than one thing, it's not just a fryer but a roaster, a dehydrator. My next test will be beef jerky, I'll update my review then. Until then, it is one of the best purchases I've made appliance-wise in a while and I can't see myself in the future without one. Now if they can only make one large enough to fit a 12 lb turkey in, I can die a happy man.

This is not my first air fryer. I had a Phillips prior to the Ninja. I gave it away because I didn't like the controls. When I saw the Ninja as a deal of the day I ordered it. I do like the controls and it's much larger than I thought it would be. But, what surprised me is it has no inner liner basket! So, it say to preheat it prior to putting your food in to air fry. However, when you put in your food, you have to pause the air fryer, pull out the basket, put in your food, no liner, and then reset the temp and time to cook your food. It sort of defeats the purpose of preheating the unit if you have to pause it. All the heat dissipates when you remove the air fryer base basket and then push it back in. The other fryers I've seen have a removable liner basket inside the actual air fryer base basket. So you can remove the liner, push back in the air fryer basket, and still let the air fryer keep it's temperature, sort of like a drawer that you can close so the heat remains in the cavity of the air fryer. Not so with this Ninja. That to me is a big disappointment. So, I may not keep it. It's also quite noisy compared to my previous air fryer. It did cook the food well. I did air fried carrots. It also was easy to clean since there is only one piece with a bottom grate to clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: Wow! What a find, love this already
reviews.reviewText:
We purchased this brand mainly because we have several other Ninja products that all work great. Like the others, this is a well designed, easy to clean and use fryer. Ninja seems to make their products a bit more heavy duty than others and this is well made. The pan is a non stick coating as the crisper plate that fits securely in the pan but comes out easy to clean. It did emit a “new paint” smell initially, I ran it for five minutes on high. After that, no residual smell. First off, it made perfect crispy wings like we like them but we’re experimenting with even less oil that works well.
We now just brush on oil lightly and will try a spray bottle as some have suggested. Tried mushrooms and green beans, loved them as well. This product seems to be a winner, should have bought one
Sooner.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fryer works well, but trays and basket wear out very quickly and need to be replaced
reviews.reviewText:
The fryer is great; I've been using it at least 2x a day for the past nine months, and washing it once a day. My problem is with the non-stick coatings on the basket and trays. For the first 4-5 months I was hand-washing them in the sink with a sponge, and the coating rubbed off the tray and started rubbing off around the 'feet' indents in the basket. I ordered replacement trays from Ninja's website, and started putting tray and basket in the dishwasher every night instead. The coating on the trays seem fine, though after four more months the little metal handle in the center of the tray I was using broke off. The real problem is the basket; the coating has been flaking from around the indents and along the back curve between the basket floor and wall, and the exposed metal underneath has been dissolving! At some point recently it dissolved all the way through, and last night when I made a fatty steak molten fat leaked out through the bottom of the tray and left a puddle inside the air fryer (and drips all over my counter and floor.)

I've ordered a replacement basket, which cost nearly half as much as a whole new air fryer. (Replacement trays and basket, with tax and shipping, $64. New fryer with free Amazon Prime shipping, $99 + tax.)

When I buy an appliance, I don't consider essential parts of it to be consumable items. I don't think I'll be replacing these parts again; I'll look for a higher quality brand first.

I've never used an air fryer before, so this is new to me. The Ninja air fryer was pretty self explanatory, so i thought. I jumped right in and decided to make homemade fries. They burned. I followed the instructions in the manual and their setting was too high. So i lowered it to 360, instead of 390 and cooked them about 10-13 minutes. They came out great. I struggled trying to find the perfect temperature at first. It will be trial and error until you get the hang of it. I advise that you write down the perfect temp and time for everything you make, it's so much easier now. Honestly frozen fries, chicken, tots, etc seem to taste best. Im still trying to perfect homemade meals. I wouldn't ever go back to frying, it's unhealthy and leaves my house and my hair smelling awful. This at first, had a smell. But I've been using it everyday and it doesn't smell that bad anymore. It was like a movie theater popcorn smell, nothing horrible. I'd buy this brand again. It's easy to clean. Sometimes homemade foods stick because i don't use cooking spray (not good for you). But even without cooking spray the foods easily comes off and i never put it in the dishwasher, i always hand wash the basket and crisper. Thank you for making a great product!

reviews.reviewTitle: This thing is life changing, especially for vegetarians!
reviews.reviewText: I own a few ninja products and I have never been let down. I was looking for air fryers and really did not want to spend that much. However, when I finally realized ninja was making them, I spent the extra $80 with no hesitation. This model is plenty big enough for me and my partner. I cook with this thing almost daily. Veggie burgers, fries, tempura, eggplant, basically anything you can think of. I don't use it for every meal of course, but I sure use it a lot. The biggest difference vs pan frying, there really isn't oil when you eat your food, so you still get the crispy, but you get a clean taste too. I'm vegetarian so this has made food far more enjoyable. Not that I don't enjoy food that's not fried, just provides a ton more options for vegetarians, in my opinion of course. Anyways, incredible product!

Perfect size no complaints so far I made friend chicken with a better and bake chicken thighs Both came out delicious

Ok I have made this my Kitchen 🌟! I absolutely love kitchen appliances large and small This has to be my favorite I have tried everything from fish whole catfish and salmon to bacon 🥓 my Fiancé is so hard to sale on anything and he refuse to eat his Bacon any other way. The clean up was easy for me but cleaning the kitchen is kinda my thing soo would have enjoyed that challenge😂 The key to this is the your seasoning how you dress your food as far as taste also you will have to play with the temperature a bit. We had Carnish Hens We split down the middle and cooked each piece on 350 instead of poultry 390 as suggested. They came out Perfect.I also used my lemon pepper dust and it crisp to perfection. However I did not like the way the frozen fries came out so I tried cut potatoes and they were divine so hopefully this help food is too expensive to waste tonite we doing Ribeye.. Again!! Also after shopping around for same brand and size Cheapest Price on Amazon🌟🌟🌟🌟

I've looked at what feels like over a dozen different air fryers of different sizes and configurations and it's almost mind numbing at the amount of brands that are out there with names I've never even heard of. The biggest appeal with this brand for me is the high 5 star percentage in the reviews. Even though I had some brands in my wish list that had more total 4-5 stars reviews, the overall 5 star percentage was still low, somewhere between 65-75%. I love the fact that this fryer can also dehydrate and the basket is ceramic and not teflon. The provided booklet helps take the guess work out of which temp and time settings to use but as with anything, there will be a bit of trial and error to get things just right. I've only used my air fryer three times now but am very happy with it and was pleasantly surprised that of the things I've tried to make (fries, tots, chicken wings, and egg rolls) there is no residual smell in the house.

I got my mom a bigger air fryer of a different brand for Christmas. We made wings in it and I was sold that I needed one for myself.
After deciding that I didn't want to spend $200 on one, I found this Ninja. It's a great size and I love that it has multiple options to fry, roast and dehydrate.

I've only made wings so far, but they have turned out to be fantastic.

The unit is easy to clean. The basket cleans easily and the crisper plate is easy to remove and clean.

The unit is easy to operate. It's simple and straight forward so you know what you're doing when you use it.

I'm looking forward to trying to make some beef jerky. I've got some bottom round marinating in the fridge now.

reviews.reviewTitle: Mini convection over plus a lot more!
reviews.reviewText:
I had the Ninja air fryer for about a week and have been using it for the past 5 days. If you want to be happy with this air fryer please take the time to wash the cooking basket as follows. Use your favorite dish washing stuff and give it some elbow grease prior to rinsing it in warm water. Rinse it out really good, and dry the basket. Next insert the basket into the air fryer, and select air fry button, set the timer for 4 min, make sure you are in a well ventilated area and let the thing do its thing. The reason this is important is the need to 'season' the machine.

This little gem does what it says it will do, provided you pre heat the unit for at least 3 min, before placing food in a single even layer. Don't be afraid to fill the basket, just make sure to shake everything into place, and check on the food around half way into cooking.

Bottom line is, the machine will give you crispy potato chips and fries without all the grease. You will end up using around 60% less fat to get the deep fried taste.(Its very close, it won't have the same feel, because you are using 40% less fat, but the food will come out crispy). I would recommend playing around with different thickness of potato slices, to see what works for you.

Unexpected bonus, my knife skills improved by leaps and bounds, as the machine forced me to cut food into uniform slices for faster cooking time and crispier food. LOL

The reason its not 5 stars is, the basket is plenty fine for 2 people, but for a larger group you will have to cook in batches.

OK so this was recommended to me by my mother. To humor her I purchased 1. I will admit I'm hooked.

It needs an 8 qt basket then I would be very happy. I've cooked everything from corn dogs to pork loins with whole potatoes. I cooked a Turkey breast in it and while the outside appeared to be extremely overdone and tough the inside was ridiculously moist.

Air fryers are definitely I trial-and-error cooking utensil so be wary of the recipes you use. And give up on fried chicken it and gonna happen.. Foods that rely on oil cooked batter, from scratch, regardless of the attention given, will not come out looking even close to correct unless your willing to sacrifice moisture.

That means your beer batter chicken tenders are going to look disgusting when they come out but taste fine or theyll look exactly like they're supposed to but it'll be like Jerky under the breading.

Yes, adding a tbsp of olive oil helps...a smidge.

Either way the air fryers great I'm buying 2 more for other people this Christmas I will be looking for a much larger and counter top air fryer for myself though.

Oh, another positive, I have only used my stove top 4 times in the last 2 months and the oven twice. I imagine the its probably saved me 80 or $90 in electric fees

reviews.reviewTitle: I am a big fan. Adds a unique cooking methodology to my kitchen.
reviews.reviewText:
This device will crisp up food items without the need for extra oil, which provides a unique flavor profile relative to other cooking methods. I use it all the time now, most especially for finger foods.

A few important points to consider:

1) While it crisps and browns without the need for extra oil, obviously the prolonged flavor retention on the palate due to clinging oil is lessened; that being said, I do occasionally spray olive oil on the tops of the food items for a middle ground amount of oil-based flavor retention.
2) There is substantial room for user error by those who don't consider the mechanisms involved in convection air cooking, which explains many of the more critical reviews. For instance, people complain that their foods were burnt on the top and not crisped on the bottom have undoubtedly overloading their basket, and blocked free air flow around the food items; by analogy, one could complain that a deep oil fryer didn't adequately fry the items on the top if they overloaded the basket relative to the oil level, i.e. whether food is adequately fried by either air or oil is fully dependent upon whether the heated air/oil can actually come in prolonged contact with the food items. In the same light people may not be taking the time to flip some of the larger food items to allow both sides to be exposed to the hotter air blast being direct from the top. Taken together, lower numbers of smaller food items is the ideal cooking method, which is perfectly fine for a 2 person family such as mine.
3) It cooks faster than even their manuals recommend, so be prepared to pause it and look in once in a while.
4) there is a component of dehydration that occurs with prolonged cooking. Whether or not that is a favorable/unfavorable experience depends on the food type and individual palate (such as crisped largely dehydrated asparagus spears). The dehydrating effect may be more pronounced with reheating already relatively dry previously cooked foods.
5) I am a vegetarian and so my cooking experiences might be different from omnivore food types.

I do not consider this a gimmick type of small appliance and envision ongoing regular use, and the fact that my wife who doesn't like to cook uses it all the time it a favorable testament to its versatility.

Full disclosure, this is my second air fryer. My other one is a NuWave and it’s perfect. I just needed something bigger.

I LOVE this one. It’s a 4 qt capacity and I thought the unit itself would be massive but it’s not. It’s a good size to keep on the countertop.

I also love the dehydration feature. I’m not big into stuff like apple chips or banana chips but I’m sure this will change. I am a huge jerky fan and will love making my own!

The reheat feature is nice too. I usually eat cold pizza but this will help me kick that habit!

The cookbook it came with is neat and has some generic recipes. I would suggest getting another cook book (I bought “The Complete Air Fryer Cookbook” and “The Super Easy Air Fryer Cookbook”).

Mostly I needed a second one for when I wanted wings and fries, or two separate dishes that cook at different temps. This is a great addition to my kitchen!

reviews.reviewTitle: One complaint, I should have gotten a bigger basket
reviews.reviewText:
Update... after more than a month of use. We use this thing almost daily. My kids do their wings, chicken fries, sweet potato fries. Meat pies and mini egg rolls are awesome.

My one issue with the fryer, these screws inside. They just bug me. They are rusting. Difficult to clean. Meh! Won't stop me from using it.

First use today... frozen tater tots, frozen chicken fries, frozen wings!

I did two layers of tots, one directly in the bottom, then the plate, then another layer of tots. The bottom layer cooked thoroughly, but got soft a but mushy, but that's not necessarily bad. The top layer was brown and crispy. Perfect!

Chicken fries, I did them with a layer on the tray, then the rack, and another layer. Perfect!

Wings.... buffalo. I don't eat them personally. My kids love them. They were very impressed with the crispy bits and the coating crisped. No messiness. I can't wait to do my homemade wings. Beef jerky is on my agenda and dehydrated fruit.

I do love new toys. I predict this will be used even more than that electric pressure cooker, and I thought that was awesome. I am glad I didn't go bigger. It takes up a lot of landscape.

Update... 2nd use. Precooked frozen wings cooked 8 minutes. Rotated with tongs. Cooked 2 more minutes. Perfect.

Plain frozen uncooked wings, 15 minutes rotate 15 minutes more. Perfect.

Pizza rolls. 10 ct. 350 degrees 5 minutes. Perfectly crispy!!

This thing is amazing ! I have only had it a short I'm and pretty much used it for everything just to see how it would do and I haven't found anything that can't be cooked in it, frozen or fresh, everything comes out perfect. The crispy texture is also just right. You do have to shake the food around from time to time which is fine for me but other than that your basically free to cook other things and the best part is it cuts your cooking time in half ! Love this great job Ninja

reviews.reviewTitle: Cooks great, Just wish it was bigger
reviews.reviewText: I have only used the air fryer feature so far. It works great but as many of the other reviews suggest, when the recipe book says to cook at 390 turn it down some, 360 is a good setting for most things. I don’t bread anything so I can’t speak for that. My favorite thing to cook is chicken wings. Just toss them in olive oil, garlic salt, paprika, black pepper and cayenne pepper. Cook for 10 minutes, stir them up and another 10 minutes. Delicious. I’ve cooked potato slices and zucchini slices the same way minus the cayenne pepper. I only wish it had a larger capacity.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well, but there are some cons...
reviews.reviewText: Works really well, and gets things super crispy, thanks to the special crisper plate! It does cook a lot faster than expected, which is nice. But you really have to watch it, otherwise you can end up burning your food. The buttons are kind of annoying to set and scroll through. They could’ve definitely made it more user friendly. It’s easy, just annoying. And while it can go to much lower temperatures than other air fryers, it only goes as low as 300 in the air fryer setting, which bothers me. Otherwise, you need to switch to the dehydrate setting. While it fits a lot in the deep basket, I wish it were square to make better use of the inside space and surface area. It would probably store much easier if that were the case, as well. It is nice and quiet while it is running and easy to clean. And one of the main reasons I chose to order this one over other brands was the ceramic coating, which is the safest nonstick coating and doesn’t peel. While the cooking guide it came with is very useful, I do wish it came with a cookbook. This would’ve been a helpful feature to really introduce all the possibilities. Otherwise, I’m pleased with it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy To Use, Easy To Clean . . . .
reviews.reviewText:
When air fryers first came out, they were very expensive and I did not believe they could fry food like a deep fat fryer, so I ignored them for years. Then, for some reason, I started looking at them and decided to get one. A mid-price one was what I was looking for, and there are lots and lots of mid-price ones! Finally, I decided on a Ninja because they make such good blenders, and it looked like an easy-to-use and easy to clean one. It is. It's simple to use and the drawer and metal plate easily wash in the dishwasher. So far, I have mostly cooked fried chicken, onion rings and french fries.

No, the chicken isn't exactly like fried chicken cooked in a deep fat fryer, but it's close enough, as long as you bread it and spray on oil. (I am using a Misto sprayer bottle and light olive oil.) This Ninja comes with a helpful manual and some recipes. There is also a sticker on the fryer itself with times and heat settings for various foods. I don't think those times and heat settings are always accurate, but you learn as you go along what works best. In addition, it only holds about 3-4 chicken thighs, so it's not for someone who wants to cook big batches of food at a time; but it works for me, and is so much easier to use and clean than a deep fat fryer. Healthier, too. :)

Love this thing! It makes food fast and is easy to clean. I was on the fence to buy an air fryer but I'm glad I did. I was overwhelmed by all the brands but I went with Ninja because they are well-known. It's so easy and fast that I don't have to use my oven ever anymore. Ovens are probably almost a thing of the past with an air fryer. Even reheating my food is so fast and it tastes incredible... Good bye microwave and toaster oven... Ok, almost. I have a tiny house so I do have to put it in the closet when I'm not using it because it is a tad big for my small counter space! Also, I don't put it in the dishwasher, I hand wash it so the finish will last. I don't know why I waited to buy one, don't wait!

Love it, it Roasts great with no oil, air Fryer that is fantastic. Makes great fish, chicken and sea food.
Roasts vegetables and potatoes
I lost 20 lbs in a month, using air fryer and weight watchers together
Makes great tasting, non fatty foods.
Makes great chicken wings

I've had other brands but I like this one the best. easiest to use & clean. I use my almost daily. Clean up is quick. I love that coating, Just remember to empty grease after every use. Don't use any metal object to clean coated rack. I cooked chicken wings frequently, cut up pork ribs, fish, When food bake on sit coated rack in soapy water & baked on food come right off. If not a plastic bristle brush. Under the coated lift rack I somestimes use an old tooth brush for that center piece or drinking straw thin brush.

I was all excited to get an air fryer, after hearing from a friend all the things she made in it and how easy it was to use. Perhaps Ii expected too much, but it just wasn't that great. There are only two of us, but when I fixed fish, I couldn't fit 3 fillets in the air fryer, so I ended up frying one on the stove - which actually allowed me to compare the two. The fried fillet was infinitely better, hands down. The fillets in the air fryer just weren't very crisp... they were just 'sort of' crisp. Then I tried frozen french fries. They might have been good, I don't know.... I sort of forgot about them, didn't know they were done, and they sat there all night. Looking at them the next day, it looked like they had overcooked. It's not that hard to clean, but it's just 'one more thing to clean' after dinner. And 'one more thing' to set up in order to use. I like quick and easy - an air fryer (or at least this one) isn't.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product but burnt out in two months!
reviews.reviewText: We have only owned our air fryer for two months and the fan has already gone out. Super disappointed!

reviews.reviewTitle: I was a skeptic, but I like this appliance
reviews.reviewText: After purchasing an instant pot that I tried to use once but gave away, due to inability to get it to work, I was skeptical about purchasing an air fryer. I was given some Amazon gift cards for my birthday, and decided to give it a whirl. I use this every day. I find it is not noisy as some have said; mine had a slight odor the first time I preheated it, but that dissipated quickly. I have reheated leftovers, made French fries, cooked yams in it, and made donuts. It arrived Sunday and this is Wednesday, so I am trying to give it a good breaking in. The donuts were from a recipe book that was a kindle unlimited choice, and the recipe was a failure. (Not the air fryer's fault. They were too runny to roll out, so I just poured them into the basket. They tasted great, they were just not donuts.) On these warm days, it's nice not having to heat up the kitchen with my range. Clean up of this appliance is a breeze. Looking forward to making many more meals in this.

Update 6-24-19. The more I use this air fryer, the more I love it. It really saves time and effort and the results are very good, often better than traditional methods. No more two step cooking - browning on stove top then roasting in big oven. No more babysitting a pan, meticulously turning foods to ensure even browning and to avoid burning. It is changing the way I've cooked for decades. I can't say how this Ninja air fryer compares to others but I'm pleased with the performance and the ease of clean up. The only negative I can think of is that the basket size is small so it may not be the best choice for some households.

Original:

The more I read about air fryers the more I wanted one. I bought the Ninja because of the very good reviews and the price. So far, I've only made "fried chicken" and I am impressed. As a single person, I see myself using this air fryer for many things. No more firing up the big oven for something that will fit in the air fryer.

reviews.reviewTitle: Why did I wait so long?
reviews.reviewText: I've used this on a nearly daily basis since I bought it nearly 2 months ago. I had wanted to buy an air fryer for over a year, and finally got this one and am not at all disappointed. I can't believe I waited so long! I've done both pre-cooked frozen things (fries, corn dogs, chicken nuggets, etc.) as well as things from scratch (roasted potatoes, egg rolls, salmon filets, chicken breasts), and reheated pizza in it (brilliant!). It does everything beautifully. It took a little bit of a learning curve to figure out the best combo of temperature and time for different things, but I've been very, very happy with it. It is holding up great to even daily use. I am careful to not use anything abrasive on the basket or rack when cleaning and there has been no bubbling or wear of the non-stick coating.

I love this fryer. I have used this air fryer every day since opening the box. After the first use, I purchased one for a relative. I recommend this for anyone who desires good tasting food, quickly. I recommend that you also purchase silicone covered tongs, an accessory kit with an assortment of pans and racks (7 inch size works fine). I also purchased an air fryer cookbook - healthy air fryer recipes that are easily made by the average cook. I have of course made French fries which are great. But I have also made a pork tenderloin, fried chicken drumsticks, turkey burgers, chicken meatballs, and roast vegetables. The ceramic coating makes clean up very easy. I plan on baking a small cake, making a small 2 pound roast, and making roast vegetable kebabs (you need the skewer accessory that I mentioned earlier).
Did I say I love this fryer? I plan on purchasing a third one for a retired friend who needs to eat more healthy.
Buy this one!

I love it! I use it daily for almost everything, roast vegetables, I do the picanha meat or any steak, bake, reheat pizza (love this part, comes out like fresh from the oven in 2 minutes). It is very fast, I do wings precooked from frozen in 10 minutes. I even put some aluminum foil under, so it doesn't get to dirty specially with meats, or I soaked in water for a while, just to be more gentle with the inside. The same if I want a toast with ham and cheese, I just wrapped it with aluminum foil (not to tight) just to prevent the wind from flying way a the cheese. It did had a smell at the beginning but with use it went away. Noise is not so bad for me, I guess kind of normal. Overall a great product, I have being using it already for 8 months, still in love like the first day!

We (almost) daily enjoy heating, air frying and reheating food in our air fryer. Don’t have a microwave and this is way better for heating.
We’ve had crispy artichokes, wonderful kale chips (be mindful about flyaways!), reheated veggies burgers that get really nice and crispy, toasted gluten free bread, loads of crispy Brussels sprouts and even almost oil free sweet potato fries. I’m sure I’m forgetting a lot of other stuff we tried. Oh yes, broccoli and cauliflower! In short, a great investment and so easy to clean!
For a couple this is a great size, if you have more people consider a bigger one or just work in batches.

reviews.reviewTitle: What can I say... this is the one to buy!
reviews.reviewText: This thing is heaven sent! My husband wanted a fryer for a while- but I said no because of the smell- so when I saw Ninja had an air fryer- I decided it was worth a try. After all- we have the blender and it’s incredible! It was super easy to inbox and prep for first use. I’ve baked in it- air fried- roasted- because of the rack I did two levels at once. With frozen fries I don’t even need to add a small amount of oil- I’ve been able to take fried food home for leftovers because this reheats them so they are perfectly heated and crispy like in the restaurant! I’ve reheated slices of pizza and had it crisped perfectly! It comes with a booklet with cooking guides/times and tips. And that pesky fryer smell? Minimal. And the “drawer” and inserts are DISHWASHER SAFE! Win-win-winwinwin!!!

My GoWise airfryer lasted me about a year and a half before the coating in the basket started to chip away so I opted for a ceramic airfrier this time instead. I was hesitant to get a product not as well reviewed but honestly the functionality of this thing blew me out of the water. I have a Ninja blender and it works great so I thought, why not? I loooove that it immediately goes to 20 minutes and holding the up and down time button changes the time from 20 minutes to 15 and then to 1. It's a really nice functionality. It's also a lot quieter than my GoWise and the finished ding/ring is quite pleasant as well. I also really like that the airfryer keeps going if you take the basket out for a second to shake it. Anyway, all in all, I'm super happy with my purchase. I hope it will last me a long time.

reviews.reviewTitle: RUN DON'T WALK....Best gadget to date!!!
reviews.reviewText:
We have only had this machine a week, and so far used it 3 times...once for chicken breaded drumsticks and french fries, once for chicken breasts and brussell sprouts and once for pork chops...each item was A-MAY-ZING!!
Juicy chicken inside, crispy non oily skin...WOW!!
I have seen the infomercials...thought it was a load of..... but it's not!!! Its REALLY great.
Easy to use, easy to clean..easy to eat!!
So happy we got one!!

Only tried this once so far with sweet potato fries. Omg. I’m amazed. So much easier and crisper than oven baking. Very easy to use. Just used the book in the box as a cooking guide. Only took less than 10 mins for a one person portion. Can’t wait to cool meat in this. Very impressed. Excellent for the very fair price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to Use! Looks nice on the counter.
reviews.reviewText: I was hesitant about the hype over these things (and there is a lot of it). I already had a Ninja blender that is great, so I went with this brand. Their products are beautifully designed so I don't mind them hanging out on the counter. I was worried about it being a pain to clean (like the blender) but it's really not, and it's so easy to use. I'm sure we're saving a ton of electricity by not heating up the oven for a handful of fish sticks (or whatever crunchy thing my kid wants that day). It was a learning curve figuring out how long to cook our go-tos, but now that we've figured it out... it's awesome!! It's really fast and clean up is easy. There's a cooking guide, but we've found it to be overestimated and I kept burning things at first. Just check the food a lot in the beginning.

reviews.reviewTitle: I named my air fryer Wallace.
reviews.reviewText: This makes cooking things so easy. I'm a busy guy. I work long hours and I enjoy eating healthy. I throw some chicken thighs in the fryer and in 25 minutes, out comes some great tasting food. Sure this is essentially a convection oven but it's great if you don't have one and you don't want to run up a huge electric bill using your oven every day. I love this thing. I named my air fryer Wallace.

Flashback one year ago, my mom bought me an air fryer for my birthday. I don’t even cook and had never heard of an air fryer and returned it immediately.
One year later, I felt the air fryer FOMO. I did some research and settled on the Ninja! My research paid off. This thing is amazing. I would compare it’s ease of use to a microwave. Just push a button and done. This machine is also sooo easy to clean, much easier than cleaning a crusty baking sheet.
This machine makes it so easy to cook and eat more veggies. I don’t even like green beans, but in the Ninja they’re so tasty and perfectly brown.

Buy this!

reviews.reviewTitle: This Airfryer + Carnivore Diet = Quick, Stress-free Food Prep
reviews.reviewText: This airfryer has simplified my life and my eating routine entirely! I use it primarily for steaks. It makes maintaining an animal-based / carnivore diet a breeze, with no more prep work than to salt my steak, and no more cleanup than placing two machine parts in the dish washer after several uses. I usually use it twice a day. A ribeye or strip steak is a reallllly nice medium rare in 5 minutes, whether I flip it halfway or not, but it gets a nice sear on the crisping plate in the bottom of the machine that separates the food from the fat drippings. It makes it really easy to collect the fat for making tallow! Now I always have tallow on hand for any skillet cooking or just adding to food later. The airfryer also cooks chicken easily and creates an great crispy outer skin, which takes much longer than beef, but bacon is done in 5 or 6 minutes depending on thickness. Bacon does flip around inside the machine while cooking, so I have to reposition it flat again halfway through.

Two busy people, one vegan, one mostly vegan/some days vegetarian and this is an amazing little device for us to quickly cook some veggies. We try not to eat too many processed, packaged foods and this device allows us to cook our meals faster and with little to no attention needed once you know the cooking times. We also prefer this to the microwave for warming up food. And when we have fries, no more soggy microwave fries and no more waiting to preheat the oven. Less than five minutes and our fries are brand new!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great product choice, great for 2 person meal cooking.
reviews.reviewText: This is a Fantastic air fryer. I was skeptical about air fryers since I assumed that these small units were more likely to dry foods out. I was wrong! I can cook not only French fries but anything that I used to bake or broil quicker, juicer, and use less than 20% of the electricity than toaster or convection ovens. It strips the heavy greases from the meats like fried chicken, chops, and does an excellent job on steaks. The best feature is that The surface is TOTALLY NON-STICK. Just don’t scratch it with metallic utensils. A quick squirt of premium dish detergent and hot water cleans the cook pot without any scrubbing. It’s perfect for fixing steaks for 2-3 people. It’s smaller than the Foodie cooker products and less expensive. Ninja has generally great products in my experience and this appears to be performing exceptionally well for the last few months. It has my recommendation:)

reviews.reviewTitle: Possibly defective model but still love it
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love this thing and not sure why I waited so long to try it. Easy to use and clean. I eat a lot of vegetables and love roasting. This does it in about 1/3 the time of my oven and doesn’t heat up the kitchen. I would give it 5 stars except, I think I might have a defective product. It comes with a cooking time guide but if I follow the Ninja guide, everything burns. Same with recipes I find online. I have to watch it and create my own notes for cooking times. So that’s a hassle because if I’m cooking something new, I can’t set it and forget like you’re supposed to.

The instructions and guide are very clear, and I was able to make home fries easily (they tasted amazing - video shows them when they're done). It's a very versatile machine. I'm not giving it 5 stars because of the pre-heating you have to do with the air frying option. The instructions say to pre-heat for three minutes before throwing in the ingredients, for best results. So why not just automatically have the machine pre-heat for 3 minutes and ping you when it's ready, like an oven? Instead, you have to program the temperature and time to 3 minutes, finish that cycle, and then re-program for what you want. But, that's my only critique and it delivers on quality in terms of the food.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use and easy to clean.
reviews.reviewText: I had seen commercials and presentations of air fryers for a few years but just didn’t believe all the hype... we’ll let me tell you I believe it now! I’ve been using my Ninja air fryer for almost two months now and I can’t say enough great things about it. The day we received it I used it to reheat leftovers and they were perfect! I cook my chicken quesadillas in this air fryer as it only takes 3 minutes on each side and they come out perfect! French fries come out perfect! Hamburgers come out perfect! Chicken wings come out perfect! Bacon come out perfect! Steaks come out perfect! It’s been a great addition to my kitchen. I do preheat for three minutes before every use as the user guide suggests and I have not had a strange smell coming from the air fryer as I’ve read in some of the other reviews. I have washed the basket and insert by hand and have also put both in the top rack of the dishwasher.

The Ninja is great!? I wish I hadn’t waited so long to buy one. Everything I cook comes out crispy on the outside and moist and juicy on the inside, just it claims. It doesn’t heat up my small kitchen and doesn’t make a lot of noise. It’s very easy to use. I watched many utube videos on cooking different kinds of food, like a pork roast. OMG, it came out great! Also, my fries came out crispy on Outside and moist on the inside. I love this machine. The temperature and time is fully adjustable. Always pull it away from wall when using it. It’s very easy to clean after every use.

I put off buying one, despite being sold on the concept. After receiving an Amazon Gift Card for Christmas, I broke down and bought this one. I picked this one because we have several other Ninja appliances, which we have been very pleased with. We've used it about 4 times so far, for frozen french fries, frozen fried okra and breaded chicken breasts. It takes a little experimenting with to get things right, since it doesn't come with an extensive cooking instruction book. I will buy one separately to supplement with. Clean up is very easy too. All in all, we are very happy with it.

I'm absolutely in love with my air fryer! I had originally looked for a Phillips as that seemed to be the gold standard for air fryers but decided to give the Ninja a try because I've had good luck with their products in the past. I use it daily, sometimes multiple times in a day. I'm using it mostly for veggies and meats and it works great for that. Crispy broccoli, jicama "fries", juicy burgers, crispy juicy chicken, perfectly tender butternut squash, the list goes on and on. Also does amazing for frozen foods such as spring rolls and hashbrown patties (omg try the hashbrowns patties!). I'm already planning on purchasing a few to give out this Christmas because I want everyone I love to experience the joy of the air fryer! Amazing purchase, absolutely recommend!

This wonderful device has cut down my food waste around 75%.
It's only my husband and I eating dinner most of the time.
Even using my smallest pans, we usually have more leftovers than we need for the week.
This fryer is perfectly sized for two people eating a single meal. It also only takes 3 minutes to preheat and half the normal cooking time. It's way more convenient than waiting on the oven to heat up, then waiting for food to cook.
My favorite function is the dehydrator. Fresh produce doesn't keep for long. I have dehydrated blueberries for both snacking and baking purposes. I'm able to dehydrate many fruits and vegetables before they get moldy or unusable.
Through those two functions alone I waste far less food and time.

I’ve used it a few times, and not sure if air fryers live up to the hype. I imagine this one works like the others so not necessarily pointing at this one, but it seems air fryers work with so much hot air, my food seemed not quite cooked enough or it was just too dry and tough. I had trouble swallowing the food without water at every bite or lots of dip on my chicken tenders and tater tots. Tried drizzling oil over the chicken before frying but that defeats the purpose of ‘no oil’ frying. Just not impressed... I think it would be great as a dehydrator (which is what it did to my food anyway), I think they took a dehydrator and called it a fryer?? Hate to see what it would do to a thin fish filet... fish jerky... yum (not)

I actually love everything about this air fryer! I have cooked chicken wings and chicken thighs (very crispy). I have reheated food with no problem or food drying out. I almost went with a smaller fryer since I cook for two however the larger one allows for more food and left overs. I have other products by Ninja and love the simplicity of use by each one. This fryer is sooooo easy to clean!!! Warm water and some dish soap.
I did research other fryers and decided on the Ninja it has great reviews and I am so happy. Mine DID NOT have a plastic smell that others have claimed.
I highly recommend the Ninja!!! It’s great for football and any occasion when you don’t want to slave over a hot oven!!!

I can't believe it took me so long to order one of these. I thought the pressure cooker was going to be my thing, but honestly you have to use so much water everything is kinda soupy. We use the air fryer to make all the standard frozen "fried" foods, but I also use it to reheat meat because I hate the taste of microwaved food. I've roasted veggies both frozen and fresh and like the outcome of both. I use this appliance so much it's earned a permanent spot on my counter tops next to the kitchen aid stand mixer.

Love my air fryer! I was late to jump on the air fryer bandwagon bc I thought it was all hype. Then I went on the Whole 30 and decided to give it a try for quick, healthy meals. I am so glad I did!!! I use it EVERY day! Super quick, cleanup is a breeze & makes food crispy without tons of oil. Children prefer my homemade french fries to the frozen ones in the oven or oil. Husband loves meatballs made in the air fryer, I love boneless skinless chicken nuggets.... all so easy! I’m a fan of Ninja products, currently have their crockpot, blender and now the air fryer. Very pleased!

I've been kicking around the idea of buying one of these for quite a while because I'd heard pros and cons. When I saw the one day only deal on Amazon, I decided to give it a shot and I'm glad I did. Obviously it's not quite like frying something in a vat of hot oil but with the healthier lower fat cooking it truly outways the slight difference in taste. First thing we tried was fresh cut fries and they were really good made with just two tablespoons of oil to fry four medium size potatoes. Next we made breaded frozen fish and it was far superior to baking them. I've had this fryer for a week now and used it to make one or two items a day and every one of them has been real good. I'm really glad I finally purchased the Ninja AF101
This was bought as a gift for someone. Hopefully, they will like it and find it useful. That is why I only gave three stars at this time.

It’s easy to set up as described.
The temp controls are a bit confusing and it SMELLS the first couple of times but OMG it’s redemption is the cooking. Smell went away after a few uses. The noise went away after I tasted the food! There is noise but nothing unbearable.
The temps in the instructional are garbage. Buy some cheap stuff and play with the temps. I mastered it in a few tries. The key is to cut traditional cooking times by half and check on the food. Keep a note on hoe long it takes for your favs.

I’m giving 5 stars because I’ve used it for five months and after tuning it to my taste it’s performed like a beast

The air fryer is super easy to use. The user guide gives a quick tutorial on how to use and clean. The pieces are easily removable and cleanable. No tugging or pulling or feeling like you're going to break a piece trying to remove it from the basket to clean it. The first two times I ran it, there was a slight smell - the typical smell associated with new plastic. I didn't notice on the 3rd use. I have made fried chicken and donuts - and both only took about 20 minutes. My only "complaint" is that the basket isn't bigger, but I knew going in that going in. It is kinda tall, so depending on your cabinet availability, this may be problematic, though it wasn't for me. But it looks nice, even if you have to store it on open shelving or on the counter.

I finally bit the bullet and purchased an air fryer. I decided to go with the Ninja version because Ninja makes great products. I have not been disappointed. As one reviewer mentioned previously, it cooks faster than what is stated in the guide. I love the fact that I can pause cooking and check on my food. The basket is easy to clean and the air fryer is so easy to use. This combined with my Instant Pot, and I can make numerous healthy meals quickly.

This thing is great as a substitute for deep frying, I don't add anything but the food, no oil or seasoning and it turns out crispy and great tasting without all the grease that my deep fryer left behind. I've used it for tater tots, 3 different cuts of French fries, fried chicken, chicken wings, reheating pizza, fish sticks, and chicken nuggets all tasted better then from my microwave, deep fryer or even my oven. Plus doesn't smoke my house up or heat it up. Worth every penny.

I have never showed so much interest in cooking until we got this air fryer. We have tried numerous recipes with chicken, pork and shrimp. They all turned out very yummy! So easy, convenient, healthy and stylish!
Food does not taste fried! Better for warming frozen food or dehydrating.

Very good for making chicken wings, chicken thigh (skin very crispy), lamb chop (4 minutes each side), pork ribs, or any meat with some oil in it. The oil drips down, so you don’t eat the oil, but the oil in the meat can keep the meat from too dry. I tried to make pot sticker with it (after boiling it) and brushed oil on the outside, the potsticker still turned out too dry. I’m still very happy with this purchase, since it provides an option to ‘fry’ the food at high temperature without getting the kitchen oily.
Cooks chicken wings, hot dogs crispy on the outside and juicy in the middle. Amazingly easy. Easy to clean.

I've had the Ninja air fryer for 3 weeks and used it 5 times. It is easy to use and easy to clean. I did purchase an oil sprayer and that has been great addition to the air fryer. I use olive oil if any oil is required. I love the pause function so you can check the progress of your food or stir the food. I have cooked waffle fries, tater tots, bacon, sausage patties and chicken. I'm looking forward to using the air fryer for baking potatoes and dehydrating apples and peaches.

She loves it.
Based on everyone else's reviews the one thing i'll agree with the most, DO NOT COOK THINGS AS LONG AS THE INCLUDED PAMPHLET SAYS.

It's ninja, and i've always had good luck with their brand, this did not disappoint.

What can I say that all the other 5 stars haven't said already? Lol.

If you're looking for a good air fryer, from a reputable brand, get this.

Cooks plenty for two people.

4/10/19 update: just made some French fries (see photo). They were frozen Ore-Ida. They were perfect. My husband was surprised at how good (this is like favorite burger joint good) .

So I’ve had it for a while and have coped a few meals (fish and chicken). Everything comes out perfectly cooked with that bit of crunch we love. I’ve learned that I should pre-heat and then I can cook with less time that what they list. The photos are of 4 boneless skinless chicken thighs. I used 1/2 tablespoon to coat the pieces and then added the spices. Truly a great addition to my kitchen. I got the smaller version since we are empty nesters.

reviews.reviewTitle: I Love My Ninja Air Fryer
reviews.reviewText: I bought an off-brand, low price model as my foray into air frying. It had manual temp and time dials and the basket coating started to flake off almost immediately despite my most gentle handling. I upgraded to the digital Ninja and love it. Easy to use, no guessing if I was on the right temperature and clean up was sooooo quick. Don’t waste time with a no name air fryer, go straight for the Ninja. Oh and did I mention it also roasts and dehydrates? My next recipe is going to be beef jerky!

We use this product multiple times a week. Many of the items we used to do in the oven, we now do in the air fryer. Plus we’ve tried new things just to see how it goes. I find the suggested cooking times are often too long. I almost always start checking when half the time has passed and often get items out a minute or two later. Very satisfied. Wish I had room in our tiny kitchen for two!

reviews.reviewTitle: Game changer in the kitchen - highly recommend!
reviews.reviewText: I was reluctant to jump on the Air Fryer train after buying several "popular" small appliances over the past few years and not getting enough use out of them. I've had this Air Fryer for over two weeks and have used it every single day! It doesn't have the strange chemical smell that some cheaper versions have, and it's easy to use and clean. This has eliminated my need for the microwave, and you can re-heat food or cook from frozen/fresh. I love tossing frozen vegetables in there to get them warm and slightly crisp. Highly recommend!! Fool proof way to cook your food.

I am a beginner, but let me tell you i am absolutely happy with this air fryer, it is so easy to use, to clean and everything tastes better when cooked in it. I loved it so much that I recommended it to my mom who wanted an air fryer for a while but couldn’t decide on which one to purchase and she is as happy as I am. Best purchase ever, makes every day cooking so easy and hassle free. It’s appearance it’s also so nice and stylish, I can leave it over the counter top without looking disorganized or out of place.
The only Con so far for me is that the Temp has degrees pre established and can’t be modified one by one but nothing to get crazy about it or make me regret getting it, i can live with that.

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent Air Fryer in all respects....
reviews.reviewText:
My friends got one and

I swetted bullets to find one that best suited my needs for a decent price.I have used it for about 5 weeks with great results.This fryer seems to be a good quality and very easy to use.I wanted the ceramic coating for easy cleanup and most of the cheaper ones do not.I am 66 years old and never liked to cook but this Ninja air fryer is a gamechanger for me.It can cook a variety of foods and much faster than the alturnatives.And with great results.My chicken wings and homemade fries came out great-Two items I have never cooked before .... It comes with a small instructoinal operating book and also gives you the bacics for cooking many food items.Also purchased the ext.warrenty but hope I wont need it.

I bought this for my mother on mother days hoping that it was going to be a gift she was happy to use. We actually really like the air fryer because it can do more than air frying but as we started to use it the smell of plastic started to fill our house.

We have read the reviews on Amazon. Some people received perfect units with no plastic smell when cooking, while others like us, received a unit which does produce a plastic smell when air frying.

Its such an amazing air fryer just sad that the smell, at least for us, was unbearable.

Had it one week now. Air fried frozen fries, hand cut fries, frozen breaded okra, burgers, chicken wings and they all came out as good or better than deep fried. Reheated some day old fries and was almost as good as freshly fried.
Easy to clean and comes with a pretty good cook book with some great tips. Some of the reviews mentioned a funny odor while cooking but I haven't noticed anything except the usual smell without the nasty oil part. Very pleased with it do far. Oh, even dehydrated some pear slices and they came out perfectly.
I had never used an air fryer. Directions are easy and recipe book is helpful. Brought it to a friends house and she liked mine better than the one she has. Good to know I made a good choice.

I researched and read reviews on all the air fryers I could find on Amazon. Finally took my chance and ordered this one. Super easy to use. Easy to clean. The oil does tend to get baked on the inside of the fry basket. I usually wash it by hand a few time in between the dishwasher. I think it's better for one or two servings but Ive seen people put more in it and then just giving it a couple of shakes during cooking. My favorite things are fresh cut potatoes or Sam's Club Sea Pak butterfly shrimp. Very crunchy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great size and easy to use
reviews.reviewText: so this is my second air fryer and I love it ! when the technology first came out I purchased a big bulky air fryer that I thought was great. I shortly realized that I got over it really fast because of how big it was and how dry my food would come out. the ninja is the best air fryer because it allows you to clearly set up time and temperature.i no longer have to worry about a soggy chicken when I airfare :). I would recommend this because of how fast I can cook and also how great it looks on my counter space.

reviews.reviewTitle: Noisy, big, cooks nicely, NOT 1550 watts
reviews.reviewText: Surprised Ninja hasn't corrected Amazon's posting. Max wattage into a standard 120V receptacle is 1500 watts; 1550 would blow the breaker. Unit sure louder than any microwave we've owned but its excellent performance probably stems from that. It's fan noise and the high velocity air flow is needed to adequately heat the large 4-quart basket. Nice looking, if somewhat buky, on counter. Surprised wife - not pleasantly at first; thought it was unnecessary - but she quickly embraced it after few uses. Will eat healthier and save $$ not using range. What's not to love?

I’m fairly obsessed with this machine. I’ve used it every day, and sometimes twice, since I got it. I was on the fence about getting an air fryer for more than a year. I’m only irritated that I waited so long. The foot print is comfortable in my small kitchen. Since I use it so much it lives in a corner of my counter top. It’s super easy to clean. Onion rings, mozzarella sticks, and chicken tenders come out just like I deep fried them with just a few spritzed of oil. I’ve also made an amazing boneless skinless chicken breast that was perfectly cooked and so juicy. If you’re on the fence like I was, stop hesitating and buy this!

reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent for quick meals! Best for crispy bacon and loaded potatoes
reviews.reviewText: I was hesitant on getting on of these but after I tried it out, I have to say Im a fan. Baked potatoes are done quickly, fries, mozzarella sticks, everything you can think of its done quickly and tastes great. No need to get a batch of oil, heat it up and wait for the stuff to cook, then the whole house smelling like fried foods! Oh, and bacon comes out crisp and quickly! no more having to wait 30 min for bacon on the oven!

We ordered this because a family member had the same brand and we love it. It cooks very fast so you have to watch your stuff, but everything gets brown and tastes crispy and great. Cleaning the pull-out piece can be a bit of a pain, but so is washing anything else. Highly recommend this fryer.

This is my first air fryer and I love it!
If you’ve been on the edge about getting one, just do it! I was debating it for a long time, but I love Ninja products and decided to just do it! I’m so happy I did.
I love cutting up some potatoes and making fries! They come out so much better than in the oven.
I also love toasting wraps in this! I use it to heat up leftovers and anything frozen.
Honestly, it’s taken the place of my oven for most things. And my husband thinks all the food tastes better too, so happy hubby, happy wife, happy life!

Thanks Ninja!

reviews.reviewTitle: Really easy to use and clean.
reviews.reviewText: I love this thing, especially for the cost. It does everything you would expect and I highly recommend it. Only complaint is the pan at the bottom has rubber feet that are a little big, so sometimes the pan rises slightly in the unit. Not an issue, just slightly annoying. Fantastic unit for the price.

I purchased and discovered a whole new world to air frying my food, from steaks and sweet potato fries as well as fried chicken and heating up frozen chicken. Great way to save energy and have very little mess to clean after cooking a single meal for one person. I am more likely to eat at home now. I also use to cook chicken and other entrees for my grandchildren when they come over, such as fries and chicken tenders... it is so convenient, I think I have to purchase some a gifts for family.

reviews.reviewTitle: easy cleanup energy and time efficient
reviews.reviewText: i use this to cook meats and fish. i put it in the garage, which avoids having lingering cooking odors in the house, a huge benefit for me. preheat for 3 minutes, put whatever you want in the basket, and flip halfway through. i used to do chicken thighs or pork ribs, etc. in a cast iron dutch oven, things that took 3 hours now take 25 minutes. love the energy savings. and super easy cleanup. slightly different flavors, not better or worse, just a little different. i resist kitchen gadgets, but this is really not in that category, there are some real advantages. if i wear it out, i’ll get another one...

reviews.reviewTitle: I love it, but it seems some components can’t take the heat for long.
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love how quickly this fryer works and how well it works and it does not smell. What I don’t like is that I have had it for around two months, used it maybe 6 to 8 times and the rubber round legs on the frying pan insert no longer stick so the the insert resides and moves up when cooking. Those things are not removable nor are they adjustable . It seems to me that they expanded with the heat and no longer do their job holding it in place. EDIT: I put the rack in the freezer.. oddly enough it seemed to work and it stayed in place while cooking tonight.

The good reviews don't lie... This is an excellent product and really easy to use. French fries, eggplant fries, chicken wings all came out really well, and the wings were surprisingly crispy. Do shake things up every few minutes to ensure even cooking. Easy cleanup. This is SO much easier than an oil fryer (we're getting rid of ours as a result of this purchase).

BTW, we didn't experience the rubber smell some people have talked about.

Unboxed. Cleaned. Preheat. Air Fryed!

Holy ****! I bought this because I heard you could make fish in it and my family loves fish. I figured there had to be an easier way. There is! This Air Fryer cooked the salmon PERFECTLY! I’ve always struggled in getting fish cooked right. It was always over or under. That will no longer be a problem. We took out 3 filets and only cooked 2 of them.....at first. After we ate the first 2 filets we couldn’t believe how perfectly they came out and decided to cook the other one. This Air Fryer will become a staple in our family’s meals!

Took a week to get to me .Wash it before using it. There is a slight smell when you first get it. No worries, washing it eliminates the problem.Its an awesome little machine! Extremely versatile with all sorts of foods. A bit loud when operating but overall a great product. Easy to clean. My favorite so far is split chicken breast. •350 for 38 to forty minutes. I don't add oil, the skin crisps up great. Salmon comes out excellent. So many uses, I haven't used my stove in quite a while.

very easy to clean. gave it a 3 star on the easy of use because the temp and times, as noted in other reviews, are not accurate. I burnt my first meal veggies and fish). I had veggie chips and fish jerky. So on my next go around I decreased the times by more than half and paused in between to check. This machine is sturdy and well made. I love it. Overall I had to give it a 4 because of the the times and temps. If ninja fixes that it would be a 5.

Not sure how I lived without it? Instead of a cold cereal or sandwich, I can just as easily and quickly make a hot meal like French toast sticks and bacon or chicken strips for the littles. Love this thing!

reviews.reviewTitle: Never knew I needed this until now
reviews.reviewText: With the hot weather looming, I finally broke down and bought this air fryer. I was sure it'd just be an appliance I hardly used, but I stand corrected. This has worked for so many things, including bacon (makes it extra crispy!), homemade french fries, frozen curly fries (wayyyy better made in the air fryer than the oven), chicken tenders etc. It isn't too big and fits nicely on my counter top. It's also very very easy to clean.

I do not know how I ever lived without this fryer! OMG It is amazing and the food is so yummy! My entire family has now ordered A Ninja because they ate my chicken wings and bacon wrapped smokies I cooked in the ninja.. Roasted potatoes are delicious, Steak is juicy and no need to have a bbqer! I have tried only the fry function and have cooked a large variety of foods so far I have had no problems at all! We love our NINJA!!

I've used oil fryers for the past 10+ years. The food was always great, but the cleanup process was nasty. The Ninja air fryer provides even better taste without the need to use oil. Cleanup is a breeze! Remove the tray and wash away. I will likely get a 2nd or 3rd for family members.

This is a wonderful air fryer. I love that this one vents out the top as my old one melted the lid on my foodi that was sitting next to it. I love that the interior has such a nice finish. My old one started losing it's coating. I've had 3 other air fryers and this one is like an upgrade. I also like that it's smaller overall but the basket is still large enough to cook for 4 people.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fast and easy! Glad I purchased this Ninja!!!
reviews.reviewText:
Easy, fast, and convenient.
Very pleased with my purchase. I researched for quite some time and ended up trying this fryer due to the Ninja brand.
I’ve used it everyday. I always preheat for the recommended 3 minutes and have been impressed with the speed. I’ve made tater tots and even used it to reheat.
After nine minutes of cooking, the steak tips were a big hit!
It’s so easy to clean too!

OMG!
I have purchased two AirFryers. One, (the cheaper one) broke with in 2 months.
This NINJA........wonderful!!
I do everything in it!
Like all other new cookware you have to experiment. I love that this roasts, and dehydrates. Actually bought two for Christmas presents!!
THANK YOU NINJA!

I love this air fryer, it is perfect size for me and my husband. Yes, at first it smelled like rubber, but after the 2nd time of using it, that smell dissipated. It makes chicken wings perfectly and it reheats food well. I highly recommend this air fryer. I can't wait to make some jerky in it.

Wonderful appliance for keeping fried food favorites in the diet, while reducing cooking oils. Have made awesome fries, tater tots, and breaded meats. Also wonderful for rendering down green peppers and onions for cheesesteaks. Roasting features for veggies. Browning ground Turkey or hamburger for tacos. Have even baked protein muffins. Easy clean up, and fast cooking times.

This is my 5th Air Fryer and it’s the best. I wash everything by hand as I don’t have a dish washer so being easy to clean is very important to me. It is also my first digital air fryer. All the others were manual. There are no cons, only pros with this air fryer. Also I like the fact that there is a crisper tray and not two baskets one inside the other, too much to clean that way.

reviews.reviewTitle: Most Used Kitchen Item I owned
reviews.reviewText: Before I bought this I most certainly would called my cast iron skillets my most used kitchen tools. However, this machine gets used daily and multiple times for different meals. I have used this for buffalo wings(fantastic), vegetables, fries, ribs(amazing), hot dogs(best I've ever had), and even toast. My only wish is that this machine was bigger and maybe a little easier to clean the sticky bits from the tray. This is an incredible machine. I thought I would have gotten more use out of my Cosori pressure cooker but that hasn't come out of storage for months since I bought this.

reviews.reviewTitle: You can’t always trust reviews but I’m here to say..
reviews.reviewText: I try not to get sucked into reviews but the pictures spoke volumes! Guys, I didn’t even read the directions (not recommended lol) before tossing in some tater tots I had. Within a matter of minutes they come out perfect! I bought this for my husband and I for our anniversary and let me tell you it was the best gift to ourselves. You will not regret this purchase!

reviews.reviewTitle: A great addition to my kitchen
reviews.reviewText: This air fryer works great. I have cooked fish, lamb chops, beef roast, vegetables and even banana muffins in it and they have turned out great. Keeps the mess of cooking inside the fryer, not on my stovetop. And being single, I don't have to heat up my oven to cook one serving of meat or vegetables, I can cook my whole meal in the air fryer.

Just purchased this Ninja Air fryer this month and so far so good......Tried Boneless Skinless Chicken Breast which came out juicy but a little overcooked so I just adjust the cooking time and BAM Delicious....Cooked a thinner Rib-eye steak and Oh my word!!......Came out tender,juicy and the outside fat was perfect.......Best steak I have had in a long time......Also tried thick Boneless Pork chops......This meat is hard to get just right always tough to chew??.....First time cooked on Roast bad idea and then tried the Air fry choice which came out better but not great....Been using it mainly for meats.....But overall this purchase was the perfect choice.....Nice size for 2-3 people.....Having fun trying different recipes.....Hope it lasts a long time.

My family is absolutely in love with our Ninja Air Fryer. I make at least one meal a day in the air fryer, whether it’s cooking up some corn dogs or tater tots for my little boys, or making a chicken Parmesan dinner with a side of awesome toasted raviolis. We continue to find new ways to use the air fryer to replace our oven. Since purchasing, I don’t think I’ve turned my oven on!

reviews.reviewTitle: great product - Dont pay more than 60$ for it - always look for sale prices
reviews.reviewText:
paid 100$ and turned out i shouldnt have
NINJA has their products on contant sale - no reason to pay more than 60$ for this item
either here or Walmart or Ebay.
Actually, both are better than Amazon

After lots of research I purchased this air fryer and am so happy with it. It cooks food in less time than the oven and makes it crisper! I really love the coating of the basket because it makes it a breeze to clean. I rarely use my oven anymore thanks to this air fryer!

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect for the healthy life style
reviews.reviewText: The meats are very juicy and cooks so fast. Easy to use and easy to clean. Fits about 6 medium to large chicken legs.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Healthy Way to "Cook" and Enjoy All Kinds of Tasty Meals!!
reviews.reviewText: This product is very easy to use, produces tasty foods with ease, and is also quite easy to clean. I use it every day and am thriving on better prepared and healthy meals.

I love this air fryer! I have used it once or twice a day since I bought it about a month and a half ago! It does most of what I used a microwave for, and all of the toaster oven jobs, BETTER! It was larger (counter-wise) than I thought it would be, but is worth every square inch! Super easy to clean and operate... I highly recommend it! I encouraged my daughter to buy one, and she loves hers just as much.

reviews.reviewTitle: Way too small, lowest temp setting 250F
reviews.reviewText: It does the job, however, it's a very large sized appliance, with a very small capacity for cooking, at most good for 2 people. I wish I had chosen a different air fryer, with different racks. Temperature setting does not go below 250F, wish it would go down to 190F. Would not recommend. Too small capacity for such a large appliance.
We use it for everything—from cooking to heating up leftovers, even removing grease from fried fast food! Everything cooks so fast and it’s healthier. It’s also easy to clean. What’s not to love?

so far I haven't been disappointed with any ninja product. I paid a little bit more for it for a couple reasons. One is that it's ninja brand, another is because it's ceramic coated basket which I feel is safer for foods. This has a rather large basket, we have only made french fries in it so far and they turned out well, but the recommended time was definitely too long.

We have not stopped using this air fryer daily since we got it. It is the best kitchen appliance. The right size, does not occupy too much counter space. I did a lot of research before deciding on this one...the basket is so easy to clean and dishwasher safe. Tip: even though it is non stick, I spray olive oil or coconut oil for an even more easy cleanup. You wont regret this purchase!

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as crispy as I'd like
reviews.reviewText: I might have expected too much. I thought air fryers would add a really nice crispy crunch to food. Have not found the proper recipe and time and heat settings. Easy to use, good quality, easy to clean, like everything about it but food is not crispy. But the food is very evenly cooked, browned, etc. So it works well.

My family and i love this! Barely have to use any oil, if any, and food comes out crispy. It is a larger appliance, but that should be obvious. We found some of the temps and times to be inaccurate from the included booklet suggested cooking tables, but nothing a little experimenting doesnt solve! We have other ninja products and this one lives up to the name like all the others!!

I bought a scratch and dent. It came w zero Mark's. Ita super easy to use. Super convenient. Makes my summer way easy since I dont have to turn on my oven nearly ever now. I make things I wouldn't have made before and it cooks things quickly. I just have to figure out the times and temps on everything so a bit try and potentially fail. No biggie.

I would recommend that everyone purchase this. I am in love with my Ninja Air Fryer. We are making healthier food choices and trying not to use too much oil. The food comes out better than fried food.

I wasn't sure I wanted/needed an air fryer, but boy, was I ever wrong. I LOVE this appliance! I live alone and this air fryer is perfect for cooking small amounts. I can make full meals for myself without messing up lots of pots and pans. Super easy to clean up! I just rinse it with warm soapy water, and then I throw it in the dishwasher. Fast, easy clean up, and super delicious food. What more could you want?

I’ve cooked empanadas, chicken nuggets, French fries, butterfly shrimp, meatballs, burger sliders, fried liver, bratwurst, dehydrated basil, even fried fresh fish! It has the best crunch ever!!!
Got a ton of leftovers you wish could spring to life like they were at the restaurant? This can fix that! Now I can buy ChickFilA on a Saturday and enjoy them on Sundays 😊

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use, and easy to clean!
reviews.reviewText:
I have used it a number of times for frozen fish fillets, tater tots, my fav! Always come out crispy. Have not had it long enough to try it all.
I know there is lot more to do with this beauty,
Ninja quick start guide shows how to cook veggies to Beef, Salmon, Lamb..even Pork tenderloins... Also to Dehydrate as well... Glad I purchased this NInja air fryer......It is really easy to clean...

reviews.reviewTitle: The best kitchen gadget I've ever bought
reviews.reviewText: Have it now since 4 week and tried several different ways .French fries better then normal deep fryer and I used it for frying sausages,burger and even a complete pork roast.Everything came out great Also dehydration works flawless.The only that did not works is battered fish.The batter is running down and is not flaky.Otherwise PERFECT

reviews.reviewTitle: It can hold a large amount!
reviews.reviewText: I have been wanting to get an air fryer for a long time. Me and my grandmother love to cook together and try new things. We are both trying to lose some weight and we’re wanting to make sure we decide on the right one. It is significantly a smaller amount of fat/ oil. And Ninja has never let me down! We love it!

My sister talked and talked and talked about her air fryer. This popped up and can't beat Ninja so i made the purchase. It really works well. Yes I am surprised but pleasantly surprised on the way it cooks. So far only made chicken (different ways) and roasted style veggies but going to try pork chops next.

We don't use it as much as we should, but everything we've made has been great. Frozen fries taste the best with this air fryer. We've made fried chicken (just flour and seasoning, not the wet batter) and it's turned out great. Most anything you would use a toaster oven to heat food is better with the air fryer.

great! The air fryer i bought is perfect for my use. It's just the right size for two person. It's easy to clean. I have made burgers, chicken, potatoes and they all taste great. The only thing i might object to is that is bulky, but do not let this deterred you from buying one. It's worth it. I will be buying another for my daughter.

I mainly use it to feed my chicken wing addiction. All i do is put my wings in, spray them with olive oil cooking spray, set it for air fry, and set the timer to 23 min and the wings come out great! Also works great to reheat fried food. I get to enjoy my favorite foods and save money at the same time. Also it's super easy to clean

Makes the best tater tots ever! I tried french fries, and they were dry as hell, but tots come out great. I also like air frying veggies. Clean up is a breeze, and nothing ever sticks. With a little imagination you can make just about anything in this baby. I highly recommend this product for it's value and performance.

reviews.reviewTitle: High Quality at a Good Price
reviews.reviewText: I spent a lot of time reading reviews of countless airfryers and went to a couple of stores to see some in person. I like the quality, look and feel of this Ninja over all I saw in person, including Phillips. The basket has a removable crisper plate with a durable ceramic coating. Easy to use and clean. Very happy with my decision.

reviews.reviewTitle: A good machine for a good price that makes very tasty food.
reviews.reviewText: I love how easy the buttons are to read and how fast the machine works to cook the food. I love frying but not in oil. And I love reheating food in a better way than the microwave.

This is a must have, so easy to use and clean, I have had for a week now and use it every day. For one or two people this is great, no more frying pans and no messy grease clean up!!
