The food comes out tasteful and clean up is nothing at all!! I ordered 7 inch accessories to go with, can't wait for them to arrive so I can try other things to make in the ninja air fryer.

Wings, fries, tots and potstickers have already been a huge success in the ninja air fryer. Bacon was a huge hit since clean up was minimal. We are enjoying the air fryer. I wish it was a little bigger but I am satisfied with everything.

I have used this to roast and fry a ton of foods as well as the dehydrator feature which works great. The unit can't make a lot of apple chips like other gadgets can but that's not its main feature. It fry's well as well as roast foods great. It is easy to clean and stores nicely. When people see it, they want to buy one.

We have wanted to get an air fryer for awhile. Finally decided to get one and glad we did...makes some awesome wings and can toss them in frozen! We have used it to make a few other things too and it all comes out great. Clean up is simple. Just wish it was a little bigger so you could fix more at one time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Use it everyday sometimes twice a day
reviews.reviewText: I think it’s best to list what this CAN’T do. Grilled cheese. Ribs. Chicken, fish okra ect... where you make your own flour batter***reheating these foods works well in it though***. That’s all. That’s everything it can’t cook. Buy it.

So glad I bought one. I have a family of 3, so this size is perfect, but if you have a larger family or plan to make large quantity meals, you would need a larger size.

Very easy to use and even easier to clean. Things cook quicker, taste better, and have a crispness without the grease.

Just wish inside was a little larger. Super easy to clean. The recommendations for cooking time is a little high I think. I cooked chicken at recommended heat and time and it was dry. I cook my chicken now at 375 6 minutes, flip and cook 6 minutes more.

Love love love ! So glad I purchased this. It's so easy to use and to clean. Everything has turned out great. Got it for a great price. I am very happy with it. The only thing is that there is a bit of a learning curve regarding timing. The book included does not seem sufficient. But, keep an eye on it to get the hang of it and it's awesome!
Best bacon. Ever. Period. I cannot wait to try all of the recipes I've found for my air fryer. Loved bacon, wings, and fries so far and even bought a 2nd one for our son.

After doing extensive research on the multitude of air fryers available on amazon, we settled on the Ninja, and I'm so happy we did. This is our first ninja product and I'm 100% satisfied. Restaurant-quality food right here at home and no grease/mess/guilt. Got an amazing deal on prime day. Highly recommend!

air fried some wings. runs noisy but manageable. easy to operate functions. food turns out crispy on the outside, dry on the inside, but moist in your mouth. but for no oil frying. its all good. put that buffalo sauce on and you got restaurant food. my house is a restaurant.

The air fryer from ninja is amazing. Do not use an extension cord, plug it in directly to the outlet. Let it run for 3 minutes before each use, and it's good to go. Just cooked a steak that tasted absolutely delicious. Put the temperature at 390 for 15 minutes. It's very easy to clean as well

Not too big or small. Easy to clean. Great for one or two people. Read the instructions!!!! Cooks fast. Use lower temps. For best results. 4 chicken strips and 8oz of fries only took 10 minutes, 9 minutes would have been better. Cooking meat is awsome. Grilled taste. Get a silicone round mat set for hot pan.

I am very happy with this purchase. The product has a nice and neat presentation, as well as it cooks as seller described. Now I can get to eat fried cooking without the guilt of oils as well as I preserves my health. The delivery was prompt and arrived without any blemish. I would recommend this product to anyone.

Best money i have ever spent!!!!! I cook every day now and I actually enjoy it. It cuts cooking time in more than half. Perfectly cooked salmon, beef, chicken. Everything tastes amazing in this thing. I never thought i was going to be this exciting for a kitchen appliance lol sooo worth it!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great air fryer. I Love it.
reviews.reviewText: I was so skeptical about buying this air fryer I had seen them I wanted one but I didn't know if they really worked they work I love my air fryer I use it everyday. Amazon delivered it and left it on the wrong porch but thank God I was able to get it. If you want one by one is the best money you'll ever spend I promise great great great

reviews.reviewTitle: You need an air fryer. You just do.
reviews.reviewText: I mean... we pretty much use this for every meal now. It's great. It holds a lot. We haven't had any issues with suggested cook times. Makes the best food.
I’ve made delicious steaks which cooked in 20 min and they’re perfectly cooked! I’ve also made jalapeño poppers, pork, and banana chips. It’s really easy to clean and a must have.

I chose this air fryer since I've had a good experience with my Ninja blender. I've had it for about 5 months and I love it! It's a great size, not too bulky at all. Food cooks much quicker and is crispier. I love that there is a dehydrate function (not sure if that's in other air fryers). Overall, I highly recommend this air fryer.

Easy to use, makes leftover pizza delicious and crispy, and everything I've made so far has been great. Easy to clean, even melted cheese. I'm not a big fan of the cookbook/manual because it doesn't have anything about reheating leftovers, but Google has helped me out with that so no biggie.

I like this air fryer it is very convenient and quiet healthy as well since a little to no oil of used. But the problem with this is that it makes the house smelly because of the vent from cooking. Still looking for answers if i can use it in our covered backyard?

Thank you!

I bought this air fryer to replace an old worn out one I'd had for a couple of years. The Ninja Air Fryer is far superior to my old one! The cooking basket is ceramic coated, so easy to clean! The controls are so easy to understand and operate! It's sleek looking on my countertop, and I love how it cooks the food quick and crisp!
It burns most stuff turned it down have not been able to figure out where to adjust the temp.

Basically replaced our oven. Especially with the upcoming heat of the summer we look forward to a sensible, big but still portion sized appliance that also more or less toasts, frys and bakes all in one. Easy to use. Love making things like jerky and chicken breasts. Like I said, aside from very few things, has all but replaced our oven and stove top for most of our cooking needs.

reviews.reviewTitle: LIFE IS SO MUCH BETTER! MEALS ARE SO MUCH QUICKER!
reviews.reviewText:
There is not one thing I do not like about the Ninja! I have not turned on my oven or stove or grill since I purchased!
I now by the Ninja Air Fryers for everyone for gifts. Easy to prep, easy to cook, easy to clean..... no stress about meals.
Answer to my prayers!

This is my first air fryer, and I love it. Easy to use & clean. Small enough footprint for your countertop and big enough to cook for two. Its a great starter machine, but I f you’re cooking for 4+ and have the space, you might want to consider an oven-style air fryer.

Love it. Easy to use, clean, and cook just about everything. Size is perfect for us 2 and probably 4 people. Pretty good looking. It's not small but none of them are and some are huge and ugly. I just got it so I update if needed. Ordered one for a family member with lowfat diet needs.

This is a perfect size for my 2-person household. I love it because I can cook steak for my husband and fish for myself, separately of course but fish cooks quickly. Clean up is so easy because nothing sticks. I use the cookbook as a guide and watch to see if the food is done. I also use a meat thermometer.
The Ninja Air Fryer has met my expectations. The food I have prepared in it has turned out beautifully . The items are crispy but not overdone. The clean up is a breeze.

I mainly use this for my kids food--because when they're hungry they want to eat right away. I can cook chicken nuggets and french fries in 5 minutes. If I were to cook in the oven it would take 5-10 min to heat up, another 15 to bake, and they still don't come out crispy. This air fryer has been a lifesaver!

I love this air fryer. I use it almost every night for dinner. It’s great for potato’s, frozen chicken nuggets, cauliflower, kale, tofu, and just about anything else you can think of. I love that it takes half the time an oven would
Perfect for air frying. Easy to use with digital controls We had a different one which had knobs “Cooks Essentials” which was junk

All my friends told me it literally tastes like fried food without frying food but it’s one of those you have to see it to believe it. Exceeded all my expectations. Would gift. Have had for 1 month now and use it pretty frequently.
This appliance is amazing! Ive cooked eveything from french fries to chicken fried rice to roasting chicken. Clean up is super easy. My next project will be dehydrating strawberries. Wish me luck!

Why did I wait so long to buy an air fryer? Although this appliance takes up some space on the counter, it has been used frequently to prepare some delicious and crispy food using just a small spray of olive oil, rather than soaked in oil from deep frying

reviews.reviewTitle: Cooks food quickly. Best for 1- or 2-person household.
reviews.reviewText:
What the product does makes this a 5-star item. However, its usefulness may drop to 3 stars for a household with 3 or more people.

An air fryer is basically a smaller convection oven. It's really cool and fantastic for roasting vegetables, cooking tofu, making tortilla chips, etc... Using this for pre-made frozen items like tater tots is half the time with a conventional oven with a sheet pan. It's also great for reheating leftover pizza, giving the crust a nice crunch. Pretty much everything gets that extra crunch. What I couldn't do were banana chips.

As great as this small appliance is, the capacity is too small. I have to make multiple batches to feed more than 2 adults OR 3 small children. The basket's diameter is only 8". The height is a little over 3", but you shouldn't fill it completely because besides needing the hot air to circulate, you "shake" or move the food around at least once through the cooking process, usually more often, which means some space is required. It's cooking surface area is about the size of a small frying pan, so if the quantity of food you cook requires more than an 8" frying pan, you'll have to cook in multiple batches.

The result is mostly great. The recipe guideline seems a bit too high on temperature and too long on time. So, you should experiment and make your own chart of recommended cooking time. It's not a set-and-forget type of appliance because you should shake or toss around the food every few minutes.

Preheating is recommended, but there is no preheating button. Therefore, you have to set the desired temperature, set the timer for 3 minutes, then turn on the air fryer. The buttons are easy to use, btw.

Clean-up is a breeze. It also fits in the dishwasher, yay!

Overall, this is a great item for cooking a small amount of food quickly. Having to cook larger amount in multiple batches eliminates the time-saving feature because you might as well as bake in the much larger oven. However, this air fryer convinced me if my house oven ever breaks, I want to replace it with a convection oven so I can cook larger amount of food faster. Maybe I'll finish them off in smaller batches in the air fryer to add/enhance crispiness.

Edited to add: though not as fast, it's kind of like a microwave for an oven. You know those crispy savory frozen snacky food, like spring rolls, spinakopitas and Trader Joe's Bird's Nest? I don't know about you, but I don't have the patience to reheat them in the oven for an eternity, so I eat the mushier results from a microwave. However, with the air fryer, the reheating time is somewhere between a microwave and toaster oven, with the result being deliciously crunchy, almost as if you deep-fried or pan-fried them.

As for its "frying" ability, it won't taste or feel truly fried. HOWEVER, that doesn't mean the result not tasty or crispy. For instance, French fries with potatoes or sweet potatoes taste like what they're supposed to taste like because the middle has the starchier texture, but the outer surface is crispy, crispier than oven-baked versions. I'm told soaking the tubers and drying them will increase crispiness, but I don't have that kind of patience.

reviews.reviewTitle: This is indispensable. Perfect for a dieter who loves good food! I am defaulting to this one.
reviews.reviewText:
I am so sold on this Ninja Air Fryer, 1550-Watt Programmable Base for Air Frying, Roasting, Reheating & Dehydrating with 4-Quart Ceramic Coated Basket (AF101), Black/Gray.

It works great for me and it looks so awesome on my countertop. It was extremely simple and painless to learn and I figured it out right away after reading the times and temperatures, as well as what attachments to use for any given food.

I have cooked a few items in this air fryer/roaster/dehydrator with pretty good results. Like every cooker you need to watch what you are doing because this is practically an oven. Sometimes you will want to check on your food, to turn with utensils or shake if it is food that might get stuck together and not cook right altogether in a lump. Just like in a real oven or fryer, but much different. Safer. More healthy. You just push pause if you need to check the food, and you have very easy access to it at any time during the process. It really doesn't get hot on the counter. The top and bottom, and the handle stay pretty cool, which is amazing.

I expected three settings. Instead you just use the attachments (basket grill and crisper) depending on what you are cooking and how you want it cooked. If you want the food crispy there is a removable coated metal crisper at the bottom of the basket. If you want a grill to support the food you just assemble it on top of where the crisper will or will not be, which is at the bottom. There is space for the juices to settle, and my favorite part of all is the easy cleanup. Very Easy. So very easy!

I cooked two sizes of chicken breasts in a way that I think would qualify as roasting. No crisper. I marinated the chicken in orange and lime juices with seasoning on the grill. I brushed on a bit of oil as the instructions say. The skin got a bit blackened, but the inside was very juicy and thoroughly cooked. I think I cooked it the max time for chicken breast bone-in. I tried it later with less time so it was not really burned. The chicken was so juicy! The smaller chicken breast was just right at 10-minutes less than the first, which is why I am opting for less cooking time in general. You are allowed to use liquid on the surface of the food.

I cooked breaded zucchini with the crisper. This was a bit tricky because as the instructions say you need to pay extra attention and care to pressing the breading onto the food. I didn't put that much on anyway over the egg mixture. I had to make sure that the breading was on right, patting it with my hands and fingers. I sprayed oil on from a bottle. It came out nice. I was going off script so I am happy it turned out so much better than I expected.

Just like oil you wouldn't want your food boiling or actually frying in there. Use caution with heat and liquid as it is an electrical appliance. You can put the attachments in the dishwasher but not the actual cooker please.

If you have little pieces of food in the cooker you might want to fasten them down with toothpicks, as per instructions. The fan can blow them around if they are too loose in there.

You can adjust temperature and time independent of each other but on the same display. Then the timer shows on the LED display while your food is cooking, since that is what you will be watching, and because you already saw the temperature you set it for. There is a sticker on the machine with hints for temps and cooking times. I think it is just a visual illustration cluing you into how to use this air-fryer/cooker. I got it to work right out of the box after I prepared the food.

I have to remember to register it too.

I will be using this regularly. It is just a dream.

Enjoy.

reviews.reviewTitle: Simple to use for making healthier meals
reviews.reviewText:
We've been using this for two weeks now and it's a great unit and we've been happy with how food turned out in it. Most nights it's just the two of us and this is just the right size for us. If you have a big family you'd likely want something bigger. I like this size also because we can keep it out on the counter if we want to and don't have to put it away all the time. It is a nice looking unit.
We've made veggies, fries and chicken in it so far and they all were tasty. I like that it's healthier than cooking it all in a bunch of oil. I also like it because I can make our dog's homemade treats in it.
It's easy to use and to clean up and came with ample instructions, including cooking chart times and preparations and a dehydrate chart and basic recipes.

Your best course of action is to take that "recommended cooking time" booklet that comes with the Ninja Air Fryer and burn it. It is useless. 100% of the time it will incinerated your meal if you follow that book.

That said, when carefully watched and experimented with, the air fryer has given me some tasty food!

My first item was french fries. I cook these often in a little fry daddy. I like them crisp but not burnt. When I pulled the fries out after the recommended time, they were close to inedible. It happened quick too. I shook them and returned to them 5 minutes later, they were gone.

I had better luck with fried chicken because I watched like a hawk. Just some chicken breast dredged in egg and breadcrumbs. These were done 7(!) minutes quicker than the book recommended temp and time. But they were delicious. Juicy, crispy like a healthier version of what I'd get accomplished in the fry daddy with just a tablespoon of oil instead of a half gallon.

I've had similar experience with other meats and vegetables. It is also a rather large machine and a counter eater, so YMMV on whether it suits your kitchen.

In short, this is a good product that produces tasty food, but the instructions are not accurate in my experience. Experiment a bit and also guess lower than the expected time and you should be producing good food.

My previous air fryer started to lose the enamel on the basket, not a good sign, so replacing it sounded like a good idea. This Ninja air fryer holds 4 quarts which is slightly larger than my previous one. I like to spread fries around more, the commercials always show full baskets with golden fries, but mine don't look anything like that if I put in that many.

This fryer has lots of functions including roasting and dehydrating. The dehydrate function had me laugh since I dehydrate in bulk. But maybe some leftover cilantro or parsley will work rather than watching it rot.

I tested the unit's roasting function with an entire package of boneless skinless chicken thighs. They looked a bit pale after 15 minutes but were cooked through and incredibly juicy and tasty. I tested breaded shrimp on air fry and found them slightly overcooked at the preset level which I had knocked down to 10 minutes with no preheating. I will reduce that further for next time. They were nice and brown.

Cleanup is super easy as everything is nonstick. This means no metal utensils. I have tongs with silicone covered tips, so no problem there.

The unit is relatively quiet, just the fan that circulates the air is heard. I cannot comment on longivety but hope it will last a while. Very nice performer otherwise!

reviews.reviewTitle: I have gone through several deep fryers and I have hated them all
reviews.reviewText:
Fortunately this isnt a deep fryer. I can never get a deep fryer to work right. My stuff either comes out squishy or over oily. I read the instructions closely and I just cant get it right. Then along came the Ninja that saved my life. It makes deep fryers obsolete for me at least. You get a big amount of space in which to fry your food. The food comes out tasting awesome and you can dehydrate stuff as well. All these combine to make a wonderful, easy to use, Air Fryer. On top of all that the price is fantastic.

I was able to fry fries and a few other things easily. You follow the instructions and a while later you get crispy food. There is nothing every wrong with crispy food and it really does make you happy to eat it. The issue is and has always been the amount of oil in these wonderful tasting treats. This allows you to make healthy food without killing your insides.

This is an easy to use item. I am very happy with my Ninja. I will be trying to dehydrate food as soon as I can figure out how to do it successfully. If you are looking for an Air fryer the Ninja Air Fryer should be at the top of your list.

I got an air fryer for someone as a gift because they kept saying how much they wanted one. I didn't know much about them, but as I was shopping and after reading so many reviews from people who loved them , now I wanted to try one too!

They are super nice for foods that are typically fried. I don't think you are really dropping wet type batter things in it like you do with oil ( like you aren't making traditional funnel cakes in this!) But it is wonderful for breaded types if items. It works with blowing hot air, kind of like a convection oven, but cheaper and portable. Frozen things (like fries) are great. I rarely ever bought those because I didn't have a deep fryer and didn't like them from my regular oven. They are great in here though. I also like it for heating up tortillas chips so they are warm and crunchy. We always buy extras now when we order Chipotle because they come out so good from this fryer. This item is definitely worth it for a versitile appliance.

reviews.reviewTitle: Kind of loud, but it cooks VERY well
reviews.reviewText:
This is my first air fryer, and my first convection oven of any kind. So far, I pretty much love how well it works. I haven't tried dehydrating, yet, but I'm looking forward to that - I just didn't realize that process took 5+ hours to complete, so I'm waiting for when I can set aside a chunk of time to be around for all of it.

I've cooked frozen french fries, pork tenderloins, and even a filet. They all turned out pretty darn awesome. I think that the fries were better than I'm used to because it's really easy to toss them during cooking, so they got more evenly cooked than when I put them in the oven. The tenderloins were cooked nice and evenly, but they taught me a lesson to measure the internal temperatures earlier...I was going by the suggested cooking times in the book, and they were about 30 degrees F hotter inside than required. Luckily not dried out at all, but I do suggest checking meat temperatures early on until you get a good feel for how this cooks. I did that with the filet, and my goodness, it was delicious. This fryer won't give that outer sear like when cooked on a grill or pan cooked, but it was nicely done all the way through.

Cleaning is pretty easy. The crisper plate was pretty sticky and oily after cooking the fries, but the great thing about the design is that you can just put soapy water into the basket and soak it along with the crisper plate. So far, they are still nicely non-stick. Only time will tell if that holds up, but at least when new, they clean really easily. They are also dishwasher safe, but I haven't done that, yet.

Programming the temperature and time is super simple. I might have missed it in the directions, but I didn't see any quick set buttons like some fryers have to just push a button for steak or fish or fries (or whatever). That's fine by me, though. It comes with a sticker on the side for those common things which recommended temperatures and times, and it takes all of five seconds to program it. There's no reference on the sticker for dehydrating, but the booklet details that out for various foods.

I really like the design, too. The basket pulls out easily from the front, and the whole fryer just looks pretty sleek and cool to me.

The one thing that I don't like is how loud it is. You're not going to wonder if this is running. At all. My house isn't huge (~1500 square feet), but I can tell this is running anywhere that I am. It's definitely not painfully loud, and it isn't high pitched or anything. It's just loud enough that I don't want to try and watch TV while it's cooking. As this is my first air fryer, that might be normal for all of them...in which case, I'd have the same issue with all of them.

In conclusion, it is a bit loud when cooking, but the results so far for me have been very, very good. I'm really happy that I gave it a try, and I'll be using it a lot more.

This is a pretty nice appliance. Uses mostly hot air to fry your foods, although if you want them to b really fried you do need to coat things with a little oil, but you use much less than if you were deep frying. I made some chicken breasts in it, lightly coated them with olive oil, then a mixture of lemon pepper, garlic powder and onion powder on both sides. Turned the thing on and 22 minutes later was enjoying nice crispy fried breasts.

The ceramic coating makes it easy to clean too. That's my biggest gripe with these 'convenience' appliances, they make things so easy but then hell to clean. This wasn't too bad, some hot soapy water and it cleaned right up. We also threw some cut up chunks of sweet potatoes in there and they also came out great. I will be using this for a lot of things.
What is this? An Air Fryer for Ants? You could get maybe one good size chicken breast in here.

I know what your thinking...I don't have room for another appliance on my counter that I don't use...I'm here to tell you that you are wrong. You WILL use this. In fact I use mine every day, sometimes 2-3 times a day. I don't know how I lived without this. Ok, seriously...I LOVE my air fryer. I have the 4qt size. I have a family of three and feel this is just the right size for us even when I cook for a couple more people. I cook pretty much anything in here. My favorites are potatoes, potato chips, fish and stuffed mushrooms. I don't buy a lot of processed foods but have tried it for french fries once and it was delicious-without the greassiness of traditional. I will steam vegetables first them cook in the air fryer with a little seasoning. Different settings and temperature levels take a little getting used to. Join an online Air Fryer group and you will get a lot of tips and good ideas. To date I have sold 12 of these to friends, family and co-workers. This model comes with a wire rack. I use this to prevent loose items from blowing around in the air fryer and use it for cooking bacon. I have no issues with the fryer smelling up the house like a traditional fryer. I do however, STRONGLY recommend you place it in a spot that has proper ventilation in the back, because it gets really hot and will melt anything it is flush against. Also you will need to place it on something other than the counter or stove. I use a counter slab but a large tile works good too. This travels with me wherever I go, it has been amazing on trips, camping, Disney vacations and picnics. You will not regret this purchase. I do see some negative reviews about a smell of burning plastic. During your first use there will be a slight smell but once cleaned and used to cook for it will go away. If you feel like it smells you can always place a small bowl of white vinegar or bleach near the vent and bread under the basket. This will help reduce the smell and absorb the grease if there is any. It has replaced our toaster and toaster oven and has cut my stove use in half.Buy it, un-box it and use it! I was worried it would be like the instant pot that I was scared to use and when I did I got burned. This is your forever appliance!

When I received the Ninja Air Fryer as a gift I wasn't sure why I would want or need it. I had purchased a smaller air fryer of another brand for my daughter when she went to college, and she had told me how much she enjoyed food cooked in it, but still, the idea of another appliance to clutter my kitchen didn't appeal to me. Despite this, I glanced at the reviews on Amazon and thought it might be worth a try. I'm SO happy I decided to make space for this appliance!

What I like about the Ninja Air Fryer:

1. So easy to use! Pre-heat for 3 minutes, put your food in, push the appropriate setting and go. The Quick Start guide is very helpful and clearly written.

2. So easy to clean! The cooking bin and fryer plate are Teflon coated and clean-up is super quick.

3. The food produced in the air fryer tastes great! I've made tempura shrimp (from frozen) in 10 minutes what was better than in the traditional fryer - tastier and crisper - with no oil added which makes it healthier. I also used the dehydrator setting to make beef jerky that turned out amazing. I had planned on putting it away, but so far it's being used each day so it stays on the counter.

------------------------------

This appliance is perfect for two people. It is kind of big and it makes some noise (blower to vent heat), but it is really useful.

The Ninja Air Fryer would be ideal for...

1. People who don't have a lot of cooking experience, but like to eat.

2. Dorm or small apartment kitchens where appliances need to do double or triple duty.

3. For cooks who like fried food crunch, but hate the mess that oil creates and/or want a healthier alternative.

NOTE: Tried cooking frozen mozzarella sticks in the fryer and came out with a mess as cheese escaped, but the outside was crispy! You may have to monitor certain foods more carefully to get the desired results.

----------------------------------

I'm truly amazed at how the Ninja Air Fryer can produce crispy, tasty food with little effort. The cleaning of the appliance is super easy and other than its considerable size, I love it. Well worth the money!

---------------

reviews.reviewTitle: Enjoyable and reliable compared to some of the competition
reviews.reviewText: We are coming from a NuWave fryer which was nothing but issues, breaks and failures. On the flip side we find this one is far superior in it's evenness and quality of warming. It takes much less time to get a much better result with this fryer. reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent Air Fryer. I am hooked on air frying now. Glad I chose the Ninja Air Fryer 🌟
reviews.reviewText:
I just recently purchased this item. It was my first air fryer purchase. I researched and read about so many and I did not want to spend big bucks on another brand, which is highly rated. I personally like the quality of Ninja products. I got the Ninja on sale at a local store for $99.00. The regular price was $129.99. I am so impressed with this air fryer that I can hardly wait until their new larger air fryer hits the market. I have also used the Philips Air Fryer, which, by the way is awesome too. The Ninja cooks awesome crispy chicken wings and fries. The Ninja seems to cook fast, so be sure to check on the food in between the total recommended cooking time. The one I purchased works perfect. I am on the waiting list for their new indoor grill/air fryer, and the larger 5.5 quart Air Fryer. They will be on Amazon, August 26, 2019.
I am so excited. I also own the Ninja Magic Bullet Smoothie maker. It is awesome, so I purchased one for my daughter too.

Everyone told me I “had to have one” of these air fryer gadgets, so when my birthday came around I asked my hubby to get me one. Honestly, I could still live without one. I’m not someone that fries many foods to begin with so naturally, I don’t air fry many foods either. I used to do fries in the oven. Now I do them in the air fryer, and they definitely taste much better. I had to adjust the suggested time though. They suggested somewhere around 20 minutes I think for frozen fries. I checked them at 15 and they were so hard and crispy they weren’t edible. After drastically reducing the time, they came out great. I also like to fry the frozen breaded okra. I was excited to pop them in the air fryer for a healthier alternative. I was sadly disappointed with how these came out. Not good at all. I’ve done corn dogs and tater tots that have come out great. I’ve also reheated nachos from a restaurant. These came out better than if I had done them in the microwave as usual. I’m sure there are other things that I need to try that I would love, but these are the things I’ve done so far.
Ok, the bad. As some others have said there is a strong odor that permeates from this thing while it’s in use. I haven’t been able to put my finger on what it is, but another reviewer mentioned a rubber or plastic smell and I think that’s accurate. I thought it was just the “newness” burning off when I first bought it, but it’s just as strong now. Just for reference, rubber/plastic smells don’t usually bother me, but this one does a little. However, my seven year old daughter HATES the way it smells when I use it. She won’t even come in the room while I’m using it. I have to say, the smell has deterred me from using it when otherwise it would have been the better cooking option.

reviews.reviewTitle: Better than NuWave + ignore the "smell" commenters
reviews.reviewText:
Bought at Kohls with a 30% off coupon to replace an 18-month old NuWave 3qt that stopped working (in fairness it was used heavily, not too disappointed). I was leery of changing brands since I'd had success with the NuWave, but after a good 20-min max-temp burn-in this unit was given a workout. I use these machines to prepare side dishes and snack foods. Breaded chicken or pork chops occasionally.

Pro's
- Super easy to use
- Easy clean, the ceramic food plate cleans up much easier than the NuWave mesh basket
- Significantly better crisping action than NuWave and I mean WAY better. Night-and-day better. This means reduced cooking time and temperatures, so watch it carefully until you get a sense of how much time/temp. to use for each food type. Waffle & sweet potato fries come out super-crispy and hot.
- Worth every penny. Keep your main oven for turkeys and other large, slow-cooked meat. Everything else goes in the air-fryer.

Cons
- No auto-turnoff when basket is removed. This could be a safety hazard. Pause cooking to inspect cooking progress. Not a showstopper.

I had zero problems with any "burning smell" reported by others. I was concerned since the basket insert has rubber stoppers that hold it in place, I couldn't believe they would stand up to the heating but they do. Wash/rinse thoroughly, then run at max temp for 20 mins, preferably outside the house and you're good to go.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not even close to the taste of an oil fryer
reviews.reviewText:
I bought this air fryer from Walmart in April of 2019 based on positive reviews from Amazon. We had an oil fryer that was destroyed when left on a stove.
So I after reading many reviews of various fryers I bought into the lie that an air "fryer" would make french fries taste just as good as an oil fryer.
First this isn't a fryer but a high temp oven. This WILL dry out anything you are cooking unless you brush vegetable oil on the food beforehand. Which of course defeats the purpose of having an air "fryer".
I finally had enough and gave my air "fryer" to one of my older kids. I'm going back to an oil fryer.
Don't buy into the positive reviews. If you want to eat healthy then don't eat french fries.

Disclaimer: Did Not Buy On Amazon

For a few months, like everybody else, it’s hard escaping the advertising for these things. Sounds like an incredible idea, and if it works as stated, figured could not go wrong. Main concern being I would use it twice and more junk under the counter.

I did very little research, but I figured a bigger size like this one would be better than too small. Also, I did not want to buy a cheap, unknown brand that would not do this type of product any justice. The Ninja looked nice, and I picked it up for $80. The prices on this product fluctuate wildly. Some stores retail it for $117, and It is certainly not worth that. Most are lower. But the store I bought mine at (dreaded Walmart) raised their price from $80 to $89 the day after I bought it. It’s a decent appliance, but out of the $80 or so price range, I would have gone with something else.

My first time usage results: much preferred over deep frying. This product works quick, and no kidding, it gets pretty hot inside. Yet outside remains cool. The included recommended cooking times, in my opinion, are dangerous if you blindly follow them. At the very least, you will have burnt food. With that in mind, I generally set it for just over half of the time recommended. You have to watch it until the point of feeling comfortable with the times you set. But in my opinion, once ideal cook times are figured out, it works well and everything tastes great.

One more item of note: Wattage used. Many of these air fryers pull in north of 1700 watts, and that was a concern of mine. My home is over 30 years old. My electrical system handles 1500 watt space heaters no problem, but going higher than that for any length of time scares me. This product draws about 1500 watts, and upon using it, I really don’t see how more wattage than that would really be needed. It works fast, and will burn your food to a crisp if you let it.

Clean up could not be easier, and that alone will ensure I use this fairly often.

Some reviews mention a strong odor upon first usage. Not here, maybe a second or two that you could expect from any new appliance heating up for the first time. Smell quickly disappeared and never came back.

BOTTOM LINE: A good appliance to have. Not sure if it’s the best, but works well enough that I don’t care. This will definitely stay on my top counter. Recommended.

Had this for a week so far. We had tried another brand (loaned by friend) and were not impressed, but we are very happy so far with this. The pan and the heating plate are very easy to clean (more or less a quick rinse) and the food cooks fast and well. Based on the 2 we tried, get a product like this Ninja - with a solid non-sick plate that sits inside (and lifts out with) the pan, not one with a wire-type basket.

So far cooked:

4. Chicken Drumsticks
5. Beef Skirt Fajita meat

All worked great. Moist, cooked through, and browned where it needs to be. Recommended.

Let’s start of with “Hi, my name is Kee and I’m addicted to purchasing kitchen appliances” but this has got to be the best purchase... Maybe because my love for french fries 😩 and I really dislike baked fries 😖. reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome! Multi-feature air fryer! Dehydrator for jerky making! Easy to clean!

It's also very quiet when it cooks and doesn't smoke up! This is by far the best air fryer I've used and it will continue to get a lot of use! Healthier food options made simple!
